"Do whatever you want at home, but we have a job to do!" His fiery spirit companion said in his mind. Blazeman steadied himself and regained his dignity, his head swiveled to the escaping Coffins. He blazed towards them, narrowly dodging Hydro-Lady's butt, until he reached his destination.

There he saw the Coffins pushing whatever they had into a hold in the ground and lucky for Blazeman the spiders still had a ton of stuff up top. The remaining Coffins looked at him, before taking whatever small and loose stuff was near them and jumped into the hole. Blazeman followed, making a small light for himself. He quickly blasted one of them spiders, who was about to disappear.

Blazeman eyes widened as he saw wisps of smoke from the spider's body. He rushed to its side and wiped the sweat off his head, it was only the spider's clothing.Thanking luck that he only knocked the guy out, he walked forwards into the tunnel and found to his dismay that there were multiple, branching entrances.

"At least I got you and the guys upstairs." Blazeman told the unconscious spider."And I hope Hydro-Lady got her target."

Going back up, Blazeman's eyes widened as he saw the still enlarged Hydor-Lady tearing apart webbing from her eyes. Once she accomplished that, she saw Blazeman with a Coffin slumped on his shoulder.

"She sprayed me and busted out of a window." Hydro-Lady pointed to the hole in the building's window. "She couldn't have gotten far,the police have this place surrounded!"

Yelling came from outside the warehouse,making Hydro-Lady temple her fingers.
1151111122211211.title: Hydro Lady Joins the fight

11511111222112111.content:
After letting the police do their job, blazeman lead hydro-lady away from the swarming reporters. They are on top of a building and he was watching them before sighing.

“Maybe one interview won't hurt, but only with the news team I trust.” Blaze man said before looking over at Hydro-Lady.

“Hey.” He greeted her.

“Yeah?” She looked to him wondering what he was going to say.

“Good work, but from what I could tell is that you will need some training with your element.” He started to say.

“What do you mean?” She asked

“When he first started, I had to superivse him so he can control his powers and emotions.” His mentor said appearing from his body like her mentor appeared from hers.

“I was planning on doing this because I tried taking a gang out at a time, but there was always one to replace it. So I did stop their crimes, but I made sure that they make time so they could heal before trying something stupid again. I don't show off, but if you want we can help you become your own hero, but you need the control so you won't bee too big to move on your own.” He explained and she nodded gotting his point.

“But still I think we could work well together after you get your feet wet.” He said and she chuckled at the pun.

“I know you didn't mean that pun, but I get your meaning.” Hydro-Lady said with a nod

He gave her a card with his number on it. “That is for when you need to or want to reach for training or tips on controlling your element.” He said and she nodded before looking at it.

“Well we should get home before it gets too late.” He said as she agreed before the mentors disappeared into their bodies.

He vanished a pillar of fire as she dived into a puddle of water down below. Both of them made it to their homes and got ready for the night. When morning came, rena was busy getting ready for work and ryan was working on his next book for his series of books when something pop into his head.

“I think maybe I can start a comic, but I need a better artist than what I have.” He said thinking outloud.

“Are you going to include our new friend?” His mother in all but blood asked him breaking him from his thoughts.

“I think so, but I need to ask her and find a good comic artist.” He said before going back to his writing. She had some time before going to work herself in the city law office.

After 5 hours of writing, ryan broke away from his writing for a break and to make himself something to eat for lunch. His mind was thinking about the comic idea amongst other things, but he was more focused on his writing for now because of a deadline. After lunch, he was stretching so get his body loose and get the kinks out. He heard his phone ring and he went to pick it up after seeing his publisher calling him.

“I'm writing the fastest I can without hurting myself, but I still remember the deadline.” Ryan said with an annoyed tone.

“Do you remember who my mother is and how you are even lucky enough to see a part of the money I'm making?” Ryan said in a near dangerous tone.

“Oi! Keep talking and I will find a new publisher.” Ryan said darkly before hanging up the phone.

'Add that to my list. I'm tired of that greedy slimeball.' He thought before going to the computer and cool down before he was going to write more while he was angry.

Ryan logged into an account on a website for artists and was looking around seeing different skilled artists. A random thought pop into his head of hydro lady inflating like a balloon made him blush.

'Let's go on a limb here.' He thought. Deciding to do a random search of water inflation art, his reaction was between amazed, flat out annoyed, or not even interested. Then he noticed a comic of a tiger lady getting inflated.

'This is pretty good. I like the style and the concept is solid.' Ryan thought before favoriting the artist and was looking through the art gallery on the account.

'Hey, I like what I see as the skill and style. If you want, I'm looking for an artist for a comic and I'm willing to talk about it. Message me back if you want details of the job.' He said the message and logged out of his account before looking up publishers.

'Kaa-chan got me the best deal with that jackass, but I need someone who I can trust and not scared of my mother when she is doing her job.' Ryan thought before looking back at his writing desk.

'On the last chapters for all of them some days aren't worth getting out of bed.' he added.

Ryan logged into another account for writers looking for publishers. He was stuck with the current one because it was the only one his mother could get in the beginning of his writing job. Now he has books out on the shelf, he can look for a better publisher. He was looking through review after review of different ones.

'Going to have to call them tomorrow morning after the chapters are done.' Ryan thought before getting multiple numbers and putting the computer to rest mode for later use if he gets a message back from that artist he liked.

He spent most of the time writing till dinner time in the span of another 5 hours. Two of the three books are done and he will finish the last one after dinner. He made himself some spicy tea and ordered some take out chinese food from couple of blocks over.

“Just one left before I'm done with that and that slimeball.” He said to himself.

After dnner, he threw himself back into work and was working hard to get the last book done. He heard the door opening knowing his mother was coming home from work.

“Hey sochi, how was your day?” She asked coming into the room seeing stacks of papers.

“I don't know, kaa-chan. I got a call from the publisher and I'm thinking changing to a new one. I have numbers to call tomorrow. I have two books done and working on the last before going to sleep. Also I had a thought doing a comic story, but was looking for a better artist than what I have now. I message them so I'm waiting to hear back from them.” Ryan explained and his mother was happy for him, but she knew he was going to change publishers and it was only a matter of time.

“Don't burn yourself out too soon, sochi.” She warned him ignoring the pun she made.

She went to make her something to eat for dinner and going to sleep for the night. He went back to work on the last chapter. At the stroke of 11pm, he was finally done with the last book and he went to bed after a shower to help him relax.

'I hope to find someone to love so mom won't have to worry.' He thought before letting sleep take him.

Meanwhile, rena was getting home and spent time on the computer and relaxing from work at 5pm. Before going to sleep, she noticed she got a message from someone about her drawing.

'What is this?' She thought before reading the message and wait to reply to it tomorrow after work.
11511111222112111.title: Aftermath of this entire endeavor.

115111112221121111.content:
Rena woke up with a catlike yawn,feeling the hold of sleep. Jumping out of bed with grace,she headed towards her computer. Still in her pajamas, Rena stared at the screen,showing off the message she received yesterday.

'Hey, I like what I see as the skill and style. If you want, I'm looking for an artist for a comic and I'm willing to talk about it. Message me back if you want details of the job.'

Rena smiled,before she typed in her response.

"Sure thing,I'll message you in five hours, I got a thing to do." Sending it in,Rena sat down on her chair. Rubbing her eyes,she quickly got herself up to handle the rest of the day.

" L'acquaser, what is still going on that I can help with?" Rena questioned aloud in her empty room. "Are any of the problems from yesterday still going on? You know,inside of the giant bubble things?"

Rena waited,before she remembered that she was in her certainly,not aquatic,bedroom. Standing up,Rena marched over to her bathroom and opened a vale in her sink. She tapped her foot,about to speak again,but was interrupted by a wave of water splashing onto her. The water began to move,and sway,trying to formulate a body.

"Pfft. Ugh, now I gotta clean this place up." Rena said to the forming water snake.Spinning around for show,Rena's stripped her pajamas off,summoning up the Hydro-Lady attire.

She slowly waited as the floor water began to move towards,and while there weren't many puddles,the amount that was on the floor gave Rena a little boost in the curves. She smiled as she saw that,before quickly turning back to L'acquaser,who had now formed.

Opening her mouth,Rena was about to ask L'acquaser the question she had on mind earlier,she stopped as the water being nodded back and forth.

"No need for that, I could clearly hear you speak." L'acquaser answered. "And as to answer your question:yes. However, the disaster with the crashing cruise liner seemed to have resolved itself. Every life on that vessel made it out with minimal injury and barely any casualties.But everything else is still going on; the two droughts, the fire, and the frozen in winter city."

L'acquaser only looked at Rena, or pointed forward,as if to say "We still have a lot of work to do", Rena stretched at the stare.

"is that all?" She sarcastically proclaimed." Well my watery companion, how about we...
115111112221121111.title: The next day

choices: Half of the problems gone, she takes the droughts
1151111122211211111.content:
Ryan woke up to seeing his mother in her work clothes early, but also has a clone in the same clothes. He took a shower to get ready for the day and one of the things is to call a new publisher. After a few minutes, he was ready for the day, but he isn't worry about writing today.

“Hey kaa-chan, why do you have a clone?” He asked while drinking tea and eating breakfast.

“It will be going to work as we have some hero stuff to do.” She said and he sighed with a small smile.

“Out of the frying pan and into the fire eh?” He joked before she went to the fire place.

Taking a quick look at his computer to see a reply from his message:

Sure thing, I'll message you in five hours, I got a thing to do.

Ryan smiled before putting his computer to sleep and meeting his mother at the fireplace.

“You look happy. Got a girlfriend so I can have children to spoil?” She asked and he blushed at her teasing him.

“Got a message from an artist for a comic I have been tossing the idea around. They need five hours because of a thing.” He said and she nodded happy to see him happy.

She turned into fire that went into his body as his hero suit appeared. Before leaving the house, there was the news about a wildfire and he felt he needed to take it. He left the house in a pillar of fire, but he was focused on the job. Blazeman appeared at the wildfire and he hold his hands out.

“Get back. I got this.” Blazeman said channeling his energy over the flames as everyone there was getting clear of the fire. Gritting his teeth, he focused his power into the flames as they were slowly gathring into his hands.

'Grit your teeth!' Blazeman yelled in his mind as a flash of power made the flames move faster into his body. The strain is building, but he isn't stopping till the flames are out.

After an hour, the flames were out and blazeman was on a knee breathing extremely hard from doing something he had little practice with. 'To think we used that as part of the training, but I need to get better with that skill.' Blazeman thought.

'I think you are right, but you stopped something fire related without using more fire.' His mentor said in his mind.

After a good while, blazeman was good to stand on his own feet without falling and he went looking for the cause of the fire. It took some time, but he found the source and it pissed him off to no end. A burnt to ash cigar.

It took him a few minutes to get the police where he found the source. The firefighters were searching for any flames he missed. Blazeman thank them for trusting him and left them to their job.

'I have to let the flames out or use them for something else.' He thought before feeling a chime.

“I have some news for you.” His mother said.

'What is it kaa-chan?' He asked

“There is a frozen city and you can use the flames from the fire to warm the city up and melt the ice.” Was said in his mind.

'Perfect.' Was he said before he left in a pillar of fire.

It took him a while to find the frozen land, but it was cold enough for him to feel it even with his inner flames keeping him warm. Channeling his energy and power, he was slowly warming up parts of the city and making his way through it. Took him about four hours to warm the city and the people there. He just made it to the other end of the city before falling to both of his knees. His mother came out of in a small ember of fire before rushing him home.

They appreared in their house and she rushed him to his bed before resting on the couch. She got on his computer to noticed a number on the desk. She spent most of the afternoon talking with the publisher that ryan was going to talk with about using them and she was happy to know that ryan was going to get a better deal than the former one they were working with. She set up an appointment with them in the future, but both of them were going to let ryan set the day for them to meet. Thanking for their time and the knowledge, she hung up and went to make something for lunch for both her and ryan. It was during the evening that ryan woke up from the two missions that was taxing on his body.

“Need to up the training when I have the time.” Ryan said to himself as he shifted to sit on the side of the bed.

“Finally huh sochi?” He heard his mother's voice.

“What happened? I only remember finally getting the city out of the ice and cold age.” He said.

“You passed out and I brought you back here to rest. I have some dinner for you.” She said and he nodded.

“Food sounds great, but I was going to call a publisher that I found yesterday.” Ryan said as she led him to the table and helped him to a chair.

“While you were out like a light, I called them and I was happy for you. You did the homework and all you had to do was call them.” She said with a smile as she sit across from him.

“You will be getting a much better deal than that other one we were dealing with. They and I agreed to let you set the day of the meeting.” She added and he smiled with a nod.

“Ok good. I was thinking around the day that the new books will be released, but now I was thinking of showing them to the new one before showing them to the former one. Just in case something happens.” He said and she nodded.

When he finished the meal, he noticed the time and left for his computer. Once he sit down, he had pulled his idea notebook out for comics. He signed in the site and messaged the artist.

“Sorry I'm late. Just finished eating dinner and I just woke up from a nap by working too hard.” he sent to artist.

On the side, he had sent them an invite to a chatroom. While waiting patiently for a reply, he was coming up with ideas for the comic and new book ideas.

'I have to go to the library after the books are published and ask for ideas from the kids there.' Ryan thought.

His mother went to make both him and her some tea, but for her to help her sleep. Thanking her for the tea, he got to work on some ideas for a comic before talking with the artist.

'It's been too long since I have seen rena or even spend time with her. She helped me more than me helping her.' Ryan thought thinking of his high school friend.

'College took my time and even more with writing full time, but I never did forget one of the driving forces of my work.' He thought before pulling out his phone and send a text to rena:

'Sorry for a text after a long time, but I was thinking of you and thought we can spend a day. I want to know how you been since high school. I will treat you to lunch and we can talk then. If milady permits it, I will also buy you dinner to make up for being busy for so long.'

After the text was sent, he was focus on his ideas while waiting for the artist to reply back to him. But really he didn't mind waiting because he was in a good mood. Tomorrow will be a good day indeed.
1151111122211211111.title: Suprise.....Blazeman Helps

choices: Deal with the worse drought right now
Deal with the lesser drought right now
11511111222112111111.content:
Even though Rena was supposed to take on the wildfire, it seemed like she didn't need too. Someone else beat her to it.

"I...I...what?' Hydro-Lady exclaimed. "Where's the fire? There was a raging fire, it was going to burn up the entire forest! Where did it go?"

She looked around at what she thought would be an raging inferno,but instead found nothing but the aftermath of it.Nearly three acres,or four, were burnt down to cinders. While much of the other parts of the forest were not in any better shape,they weren't as bad as the area that Hydro-Lady stood in.This disaster could've been much worse.

And Hydro-lady knew that was the most important thing, that no more injuries would occur from this disaster. But she would've like to fix it so if it happened again she would know what to do!

Hydro-Lady was quickly brought out of her brooding by a the sound of cracking branches.

"Lady, you just missed it." A gruff voice belonging to someone called behind her, Hydro-Lady turned around. Behind her stood a very large bear,currently dressed in the clothing of a park ranger. He gave the heroine a small tip of his hat, as if he was apologizing to her.

"Who did this?" Hydro-Lady questioned.

"You know, Blazeman, that hero a little out East." The Park Ranger replied. "Came outta nowhere and started absorbing the fire,flying around like a buzzard. All the flames just kept flowing right into his hands before 'poof.' And it was all gone, all that fire that was destroying the land.The guy even had the courtesy of showing off what caused this damn thing in the first place."

"And what was it?" Hydro-Lady looked at him with a raised eyebrow behind her mask.

"A cigar" The bear growled out with unbridled fury,so gruff that even Hydro-Lady flinched. "You know, I'm going to have to start a slogan or something. It could be like 'Only you can make sure your park is safe from infernos.' Is that too long for a slogan? Hmmm."

The bear scratched his head in thought, while Hydro-Lady took the initiative to search if she was needed. Around her, Hydro-Lady saw various workers, firefighters, and rangers clean up the mess left behind by the destruction.

"Do you need help with something?" Hydro-Lady said to the various helpers in the area. The word "No" was the only response to her question and after awhile, Hydro-Lady figured out she wasn't needed at all in this place. Stepping away, Hydro-Lady made her way to the nearest ice-filled bucket. Placing her hand into it, Hydro-Lady disappeared in a stream of water.

----
"Well at least there is that frozen place I can help out with-"

"Actually, that is already taken care of." L'acquser interrupted. "Fixed by a certain matchbox hero."

"Oh come on!" Hydro-Lady yelled in exasperation. "What else did he fix right now? Do I just call it a day? I feel like he is doing everything for me!"

"You still have those droughts I told you about, you can see what you can do for them." L'acquser assured Hydro-Lady

Snapping her fingers, the water heroine spun around in her mystic getaway. Happily dancing, before she stopped herself. Rubbing the back of her head as she remembered that lives were at stake.

"Still, this looks like a job for HYDRO-LADY" Hydro-Lady spoke aloud, before shooting off towards her next destination. Inside of her mind, Hydro-Lady began to wonder which of the droughts she would deal with first.
11511111222112111111.title: Rena and The Droughts

choices: Rena Deals with the worse drought
Rena Deals with the lesser Drought
115111112221121111111.content:
(Author's Note: This will not be a filler chapter, but this will let you as the reader know about Ryan.)

Ryan as a kid, was in an orphanage before getting adopted by his mother. Ryan is a dragon anthro dragon/fox mix, but somehow still was human. He knew nothing of his birth parents, tried to make friends with the other kids, and help out like a good boy. He was treated like an outcast, but it didn't stop him from trying to help and make friends. During one night, he was sleeping and heard a voice.

“Little one, are you ok?” Heard in his mind.

'I'm sad that no one would let me help or the other kids be my friends.' He said in his mind as his body slept.

“What do you want most?” The voice asked.

'A mother.' He said before he didn't hear the voice again that night.

The following morning was going to be a big day. Ryan kept trying to make friends and help the staff, but he was shy away like he was needed or wanted. With a sad face and a frown, he went to sit under a tree and rest his head in his knees. A bit later there was something coming down the road to the orphanage. A lady wearing a business suit that was altered for her cat and dragon body got out of her car means she works for the city. Her eyes appeared to be slit and golden yellow eyes with orange pupils, her body has red dragon scales and orange cat fur, and felt that she would find the one here.

'That boy will have his wish granted today.' The lady thought before walking inside after locking her car.

After hearing the staff's thoughts, she went to look him on her own. It took a couple of minutes, but she found the boy sitting under a tree alone. She walked by him and sit next to him under the tree.

“Do you wish to be adopted?” The lady asked him as he turned his head to see an older lady talking to him. The voice was the same as the one from last night.

“Please adopt me. I'm tired of being ignored and treated as an outcast.” Little ryan said crying into and she hugged him and rubbing his back.

“Don't worry, little one. I will take your pain and grant your wish.” She said to him before he stopped crying and went to sleep in her arms. She went to the desk and asked for the adoption papers. She had a dragon tail and a cat tail holding him in a snake bind while she was signing the papers to adopt the boy with her.

Time skip: 9 years

During the 9 years since that day, ryan grew happy with his new mother and he still wanted to help people. This time it worked for him, he was given odd jobs and done them well. On a side note, his mother told him that he had a will of burning fire and she can give it a form. He wanted to use his own power, but thanked her for talking to him about it. She smiled before giving him the power over flames. It took him months to control it before getting close to a year that gave him near master control of his flames.

“As you get older and stronger, so will your power. You have to train to keep your control up most of the time.” His mother said as he nodded.

“Is there something you want to do after high school?” She asked him. He was thinking about it for a minute before it came to it.

“I want to be a writer to make my stories help parents and give other kids something I never had before you appeared in my life.” Teen ryan said and his mother hugged him. His head resting on her large chest. (AN: In a motherly way.)

“I'm so proud of you wanting to help is still going strong. Well if you want to be a writer, then you need to have a story to be published.” She said before letting him go.

“I think a good first story would be my time as spitfire.” He said and she smiled liking the idea.

“Good write the first one out and I will find a publisher for it. I want you to have a good education and go to college.” She told him and he nodded before going to write his first story.

During his high school years he kept up his grades, made some friends, outwitted his 'enemies', and kept popping out a story of days as a young hero from his memories. The one thing that stood out in his mind was meeting a fellow hero comic, Rena Westfall. They bonded and debated on comics, but she grew to be his best friend. She walked with him to his house so they could do homework together, and read their comics in his room. She met his mother and rena was loved by her. She had read his first completed series and liked the story, but wanted him to keep writing. Little did she know, that ryan had a crush on her, but it inside him because he didn't want to ruin his frienship with her.

“So you are going to college?” Rena asked ryan as they were at his house.

“To an art college that has writing courses. If there was one closer, then I can stay.” Ryan said, but rena shook her head.

“Don't do that to yourself, both your mother and I want you to have this chance to follow your dreams.” Rena said while saphira was listening to them by the door.

“Just don't forget us.” She said as a sad joke and ryan hugged her before kissing her forehead.

“Thanks rena. Trust me when I say that I will always be thinking of you and my mother while I'm away.” Ryan said and she nodded giving him a smile. Ryan could have told rena the truth of his feelings, but he couldn't do it then. The next day, his mother and rena watched him drive away to his college and work hard.

'Rena-chan, your words have caused a fire to burn within me. So I will make a series dedicated to you and mom. Heh, talking about heroes when you are one to me.' Ryan thought with a smile.

During his college years, he spent most of his time pulling all nighters, drinking tea, and little writing because of the assignments. He would take small breaks to call his mother and rena to give them updates, but mostly to tell them that he was thinking of them and appreciate them having his back. Rena was the one again to restoke his flames and to keep pushing forward. His mother knows that ryan had a crush on the cat girl, but was sad that he didn't tell her yet.

'Rena. When this is over, I want to talk to you about something serious as is my feelings for you.' Ryan thought as he was working on his papers and things for his classes.

Almost right out of college, ryan moved back in with his mother and she was happy to have him back. Ryan did graduate while nearly became the validvictorian. They went to look for a publisher (AN: Ryan's now former publisher in a previous chapter) and he got to research for the first books of a couple of series. Between his writing and researching, ryan felt there was a sense of doing something like this before during his college days. He kept up is training and use the excuse taking out thugs as a stress reliever. Spitfire had grown into Blazeman and it was time for a comeback while giving people hope. During the years from then to now, ryan was busy writing book after book that he couldn't find time for his mother or even calling rena to let her know that he was back for good.

Some days he would look at the dedication he wrote for his mother and a one for rena. Though he wished rena knew she was the one he was referring to in his dedication.

To my mother, for making me feel special and a high school best friend as both became the wind to feed my fire. They gave me the drive to push further and always had my back. To them, I dedicate this book series to them.

'Now that I'm back, I can tell rena my feelings and hope for the best.' Ryan thought closing the first book he written. When ryan was training both at home and at college, his body grew well-toned and not bulky with muscle and gained some serious speed from those muscles when he runs.
115111112221121111111.title: Ryan's Past

choices: She deals with the worst drought
she deals with the lesser drought
1151111122211211111111.content:
(AN: This will be more of his past, but with focus on certain parts like high school).

Ryan is still recovering while 'Blazeman' is letting the new hero handle things on her own. He walked around the house before sitting on the bed with his high school year book. While looking through it, he was lost in his memories of that time.

Flashback:

While in high school, ryan was a good kid and worked on his studies. He barely had any friends, but changed when he met a strange 'hero'.

'I'm happy mom is helping me with my stories.' Ryan thought as he was getting things for his classes.

On the side, he had gotten into the journalism club so he would keeping up with his writing. He took the advice colomn of the paper.

'Who is that with hero comic?' Ryan thought seeing a certail catgirl reading a comic couple lockers away from him.

“Hello?” Ryan asked the catgirl.

“Hmm?” She asked seeing someone she hadn't met.

“What comic is that?” Ryan asked gesturing to the comic.

“Ultimate man.” She said with a shrug.

Ryan nodded knowing of the comic, but never grew into reading them.

“He is ok for a symbol of peace, but you don't have to be one to help someone. Spitfire taught me that.” Ryan said and they went into a friendly debate.

“Ryan 'Rick' James.” Ryan said his tail coming around as his hands were full of books and binders.

“Rena Westfall.” She said as her tail wrapped around his. Their tails shook like shaking hands.

Both realized that they had a same classes together and shared a small smile.

End Flashback

Ryan and rena were friends and they tried their best, but also tried to be each other's lab partner.

Ryan seeing the aged photos smiled softly. One of his journalist friends took a photo of him and rena for the yearbook and had joked that they were cute together.

'Back then, it wasn't a possibility. Now it might happen if she return my feelings.' Ryan thought with hope in his heart.

He lost count on how many times rena had came over to help with the homework and the projects. There was a coupke of times that his mother had called rena's parents to let her know that rena would be staying the night. In the end there was a promise between the parents that they should meet and let both of them have some fun. The parents become good friends and ryan was welcomed to stay the night if there was a project they had to work on.

'There wasn't a project when I took up the offer, but because to return the favor.' Ryan thought.

Flasblack:

The night of graduation and rena was again at ryan's house in his room. They were in their robes and the high school life has endded for them, but not forgotten.

“So you are going to college?” Rena asked as the two talk. Ryan's mother is listening by the door with a smile.

“To an art college with writing classes that seemed like the best for me.” Ryan said with a sad smile.

“If there was one closer, I could be closer to both you and mom.” He added.

Rena shook her head at him.

“Don't do that to yourself. Both her and I want you to go and take the chance to follow your dreams.” She said and saphira was smiling at rena being strong for him.

'I had known sochi-kun had feelings for her, but what would be the chance that she had feelings for him. Maybe time could help them guide them. I hope they find each other when he comes back from college.' Saphira thought with a small smile and an amused look in her eyes.

“Just don't forgeet about us.” Rena said as a sad joke, but ryan hugged her close to him petting her hair.


“Thanks rena. Trust me, I will be thinking about you and mom while I'm away.” He said.

She nodded her head, but she was given a large wrapped box. She looked at him confused.

“Your graduation present from me and mom, but don't open it till I come back from college. I want to see the look on your face.” He said and she nodded her head again.

The next morning both his mom, rena, and her parents were there seeing him off. He gave hugs to his and rena's mothers, shook her father's hand, and for rena he kissed her head with a heartfelt hug. He opened the door before looking at her and gave her another hug, but also gave her a peck on cheek. The small group was surprised at the action, but ryan drove away.

'Rena-chan, I hope when you find out about your present that you will have a smile that will last through all of time. Your words last night caused a fire to burn strong within me. I hope a future series that I write will be up there among your favorite. Another goal is that I will have a series dedicated to you and mom.' Ryan thought as he was driving to the next step towards his dream.

He let out a chuckle. 'Talking about heroes, she is one in my books and she doesn't even know it.' He added.

End Flashback

'I hope to get to my real goal of making that series with a real dedication from my heart. I don't know how long the comic will be in its own series, but maybe hydro-lady could help answer that. The books are about done as a series and I should write one final book each. Then plan out the new one.' Ryan thought closing the yearbook

'College was hell and I almost didn't make it, but once again rena came to breathe life into my dying flames.' He thought with a small smile.

' I need to put an honest review for that old publisher. He kept trying to steal from me and that last call from him was the final straw that broke the raging camel's back.' Ryan thought getting up from the bed.

College flashback:

The first couple of days was easy because students were coming to get situated. Other than his writing classes is that he was taking one or two art classes for his ability in drawing or sketching.

'With the following years before graduation, I was doing all nighters, drinking spicy teas to help me stay awake, and almost stopping ALL of my writing because of the assignments, tests, and projects. The stress was building so much I had to release it either fight the gangs aournd there or dunking myself into a pool and turn it into a hotspring.' Ryan thought.

Sure the work was hard, but it was worth it. During a night, he called rena while he was a working on an art ptoject.

“Ryan? Why are you calling this late?” A tired rena asked with a yawn.

“I need help. It's like high school, but worse.” Ryan said sounding almost defeated.

“What is wrong, ryan?” She said a bit more awake now.

“I keep driving through and getting the work done, but the stress almost getting to the point where I might actually errupt like a live volcano.” Ryan said. He already talked with his mother about almost using his powers to make a dessert into a sea of glass.

“Sounds like you are pulling all-nighters since I'm not there helping you like in high school, but calm down. Take a few minutes and come back to it later.” Rena said before letting out another yawn.

“Thanks.” Ryan said as he gave her a quick good bye before hanging up. He finished taking his break before hammering everything into his work and got it done. Seeing the time, he took a cold shower before going to sleep.

'Rena-chan, I wish I can there for you like you are there for me.' Ryan thought. During the rest of his college years, he put his will into overdrive and nearly became the valedictorian. The graduation was a bit over the top. Rena couldn't make it due to finding a job and he understood.

'I hope she is doing well.' Ryan thought during his college graduation.

His mother made it and was happy for him as usual. Now he could start writing books like he wanted. It took ryan a couple of hours to pack everything from his dorm after graduation, but it would be his last night. His mother left for home after he was done packing, but would come back to help him putting things in the back of her car.

College flashback end

'When I came back, mom and I had to meet with that piece of crap publisher just to work on my starting books. Maybe with the new one I can work on my real book.' Ryan thought as he looked at the number of the new publisher that his mom talked to him.

'That will have to wait till I meet with the artist for the comic and spend a day with rena. Maybe I can throw that into the deal, but not till I meet with my chosen artist.' Was added as an afterthought.

Soon his face has a blush while his thoughts were of the heroine of water.

'I wonder on who she is.' Ryan thought before laying on the bed before taking a nap before it shifts into a dreamless sleep.
1151111122211211111111.title: Rena Deals with the worse drought

choices: Look around town for some clues
11511111222112111111111.content:
Hydro-Lady walked through the cracked and dried land. The place known as Delightful Valley wasn't a very delightful place at the moment. She could feel the sun doing its best to dry her out,the hot winds blowing against her. If she was just normal Rena at the moment, her fur would've dried her out.

She looked down at her form and gasped out a wheeze in shock at how emaciated she looked. In fact, she looked near skeletal in appearance!

"L'acquser!" Hydro-Lady shirked.She rushed forth to a tiny puddle and began to scream into it. Finally the snake form of her companion splashed forth to greet her.

"Yes Rena my dear?"

"Look what happened to me!"

L'acquser stared her up and down. Nodding the snake thing began to explain.

"Its just a natural reaction of your body in relation to this weather. You go into a mummified form so as to not die of dehydration. All that water is just inside of you in a tiny core that will expand when you find some water, Rena!"

"Really?" Hydro-Lady replied. "So can I have some water then?"

L'acquser nodded, somewhat, and dived back into the water. The pile rumbled for a moment, before it shot forth and blasted Hydro-Lady in the chest. The cat girl held up her hands for a moment burbled out curses as she felt her body begin to expand. Her breasts and hips swelled followed by abdomen. She slowly regained her normal proportions until even that began to reach past the norm. Her curves expanded into her costume, stretching it,,but never ripping it entirely.

Finally Hydro-Lady had stopped expanding, leaving her with curves that would make a car weary.Hydro-Lady sputtered out something some water and her pupils looked down onto L'acquser.

"I said I wanted some."

"And there was 'some' water! No lets get back to work!" The water snake disappeared and the puddle flew straight into Hydro-Lady. The heroine wiped her head and made off towards civilization.

"I know there's a town somewhere here,it was like on a documentary or something. I can't remember its name at the moment though. Oh curse me not really paying attention to nighttime television! I also know there's a dam here, maybe I should check there? What should I choose?"
11511111222112111111111.title: She deals with the worst drought

choices: Rena plans out what to do next
115111112221121111112.content:
"I'll go after the lesser one right now, If its not too bad, I can probably get it done lickity-split" Hydro-Lady shrugged out her suggestion. She shot through the waterways. Upon feeling the instinctual hand that guided her, Rena traveled up a long corridor of water and blasted herself into wherever she was going to next.

"Tada!" Hydro-Lady proclaimed. She looked around at the desolate space she arrived at and huffed.

"Well. That isn't a good sign." She quickly absorbed the puddle she arrived from to gain some curves,as well as a nice water source. She placed a flat palm over her eyes to block out the sunlight. Peering in the distance,she found something under a heat mirage, it appeared to be a town. Thinking that was where she needed to go, Hydro-Lady began her journey forward.

Walking in this place made Hydro-lady's eyes widened.With various cracked dirt and hot wind blowing through her hair. She made her way until she found the place she was looking for. "Moris Town" was painted haphazardly on a sign and Hydro-Lady took it as where she needed to be.
115111112221121111112.title: Deal with the lesser drought right now

1152.content:
Feline Fetish Doll - In this storyline, Rena is not technically an actual person, but rather a product of the OmniGene Corporation, a company that specializes in genetically engineering custom-made "sexual servants" for their customers, each one tailored to the individual's specific tastes and desires. Rena in particular, is a specially designed model, having been created with super stretchy skin, and valves where her belly button and nipples should be. She's just been delivered to her new master, a geeky man with a fetish for catgirls as well as inflation, particularly with air or helium.

As a product of OmniGene, Rena's mind is programmed to be 100% loyal to her master, and to do whatever he tells her. From here, it's up to the author what happens. Rena might spend her life fulfilling her owner's fantasies, or maybe she''ll begin to question why she should have to live as a slave and try to escape. Either way, it's sure to be interesting.
1152.title: Rena, the Living Blow-up Doll

choices: Daniel tests out some of her capabilities.
Daniel instead opts to show her around the apartment.
11521.content:
Daniel puffed out some of his breath, dragging the suitcase-like box into his modest apartment. Smiling, he thought of all his travel to get it, worth it.

He couldn't just drive over and get the box back to his abode. His car was in the shop at the moment, making the guy have to travel three miles to the post-office by using the bus. Bring it back to the bus station, and then have to bring for an additional mile. The reason being the bus station wasn't close enough to his apartment complex. Daniel then had to travel up a flight of stairs to the fifth floor, because the elevator for his complex was out. But in the end, Daniel made it with his prize.

Going into his kitchen, Daniel took out a long knife. Walking back over to the box, he carefully began to slice off the tape. Slowly did he make sure to cut it, like a surgeon cutting open a patient. He didn't want to destroy or cut the product. Finally, when he had enough of an opening to tear apart his section. Looking down, Daniel could see the plastic-wrapped form of a orange-cat girl, with black stripes like a tiger. There were black stripes over her eyes,making her look almost raccoon-like

Heading to the more feline side of the spectrum, but still had enough human in her;she was never the less pretty to his eyes.And most likely the best Daniel could get. Daniel was average in build and intelligence, meaning he never could get a girlfriend. Or at the very least, one around his area. So instead he opted for OmiGene 'Fetish Doll';Model: Feline; Fetish: Inflation. It cost him a pretty penny, but he had the cash to spare. He also noted the positive; unlike a real girl, she could live out his fantasies!

Staring at her flattened form, Daniel wondered what was the magic word to bring her to being. Taking her out of the box, Daniel inspected the flat figure, looking over her like a detective. She was three feet in diameter, making her easily transportable. Still, she would be better in the third-dimension.

"How do I do it though?" Daniel said. He did another take into the box, that had produced results. A slip of paper was at the bottom, probably covered by her.Taking it out, Daniel read it.

"Hello, Dear Costumer.
As a fine consumer of our products, we are proud of your purchase. Blah, blah, blah. How about some instructions for his dream-girl, dammit! Looking for that necessary part, Daniel noticed it.

"To bring your OmniGene 'Fetish Doll' to life, simply take out the gel included in his/her wrapped form. It will be marked as 'OmniGene Vita Gel', and will be a cylinder shaped container. Next, pour it down the doll's throat and wait five to seven minutes. Give your doll time to adjust, and presto, you'll have your product come to appease you! Daniel ignored the rest of the paper, and began to do just that.

He flapped her open,and saw the rest of her.Noting that she would be around five-foot and six inches. And that she had plugs for nipples and for her...lower lips. Black stripes were around those areas, almost as if they were supposed to be highlighted. He also noticed that she had intense,green eye. Another addition was her red, flowing hair. Her mouth was a faint muzzle, but not too exotic in length.

Daniel blushed at her nakedness, and then noticed the Vita Gel rolling on the ground. He almost lost the damn thing by flapping her open! Grabbing it, Daniel noticed the green glow to it; interesting, but not as interesting as the results it could give!

Opening it, Daniel poured it down the throat of his doll. Noticing the lifeless eyes of it, creepy, but that not going to last! Finishing with the last drops, Daniel put the now empty cylinder down on his counter-top. Not knowing that in the instructions that it specified not to use the entire thing, but Daniel wasn't one for reading things the entire way through.

He stood in his loft, waiting for his doll to come alive. After a few minutes, he saw the results of his action. Slowly did he see his doll move her hand a little, twitching on the floor. Daniel shivered, but she wouldn't keep doing that, would she? Next he saw her flat form twist around like a fish out of water. The phase didn't last for long as he saw the deflated cat-girl fill up with whatever gel was now in her.

Like a balloon attached to a hose, did she start to fill out. Puff,puff, puff, did she grow. Right until she was to a filled out size, or a third dimensional one. Daniel noted that she was flatter than a board;where was her curves?

The cat-girl stretched a little, licking her faint muzzle. Then she looked at Daniel, and smiled. "Hello there master, I am your OmniGene 'Fetish Doll"!
Surreal Number: 626. Model: Inflation. And under generic name: Rena. How may I assist you?"

"Is a question relating to your curves okay? I don''t mean to intrude." Daniel asks. Rena looked momentarily startled, and proceeded to turn her head downwards.

Looking down at herself, Rena then looked back up at Daniel. A toothy grin greeted the man. "Ahh, yes. You see, the corporation didn't receive any specifications in my design, besides the ones you picked out. They instead picked the smallest form they had, just to give my larger sizes a huge difference."'

"So, your curves will grow when I blimp you up?"

"That is correct;and because of my smaller form, I can grow to larger heights than that of my 'sister' models." Rena stated with pride.

Daniel licked his lips, and sweated a little, this was great! Rena still beamed at him, and followed with a question. "So, master, what would you like to do?"
11521.title: Feline Fetish Doll

Rena Island-

         Rena, our young space marine, is located at a remote space station with thousands of other personal.Floating above an hospitable planet, full of life. It is currently being surveyed for a colony.

          Equipped with bio-chemical implants, transforming armor, and trained to be efficient; Rena still has a lot to learn about herself.She was just about to going into advanced training to compensate for herself. Unfortunately, the station was besieged by alien life-forms that took out a portion of the station. Now it is up to Rena's group to deal with the phenomenon.

choices: Rena thinks about it and goes to see a doctor for herself
Rena doesn't go to the doctor, unaware of the expansion taking place
115222221.content:
A long, serpentine beast slithered its way through the corridors, hunting whoever was unfortunate to be left in the corridors. It scanned the area, using its alien eyes to find a target and it did find one. The serpentine creature licked its "lips" and slithered slowly after its target. It reached it soon enough and just when it was about to chomp on the unfortunate being's head, a bolt of plasma ripped right through it. Its target wasn't prey, the beast was the target's prey.

"I got another "creeper", Boss. How is everyone else doing?" Rena announced, she looked at the size of the serpent she got."Creepers" referred to the snake-like monstrosities that invaded the station. Right now, Rena had acquired a fair sized specimen, although, she had to compare that to her other trophies.

Rena craned her neck behind her, almost a mountain of alien corpses were behind her. Even with the mountain,she still had her work cut out for her.

===

Rena thought she would have an easy job, she just finished her basics and just had to mentor under another station. She picked one of the lushest, and most hospitable, colony and station around.

Turvok possessed a measly population of 20,000, on and above the surface of the planet. Its training station was spacious enough to contain the 600 soldiers working on the place. Rena thought she was just going to train, drinks some nice beverages, and hang out with some guys. However, it seemed that fate had taken her relaxation as a sign of hubris, it decided that it wanted to mess the whole thing up.

Some,life-forms had crashed both on the station and near the colony on Turvok. And unlike the other aliens that the Collective had encountered, these were intelligent.This would be a monumental moment in all of history, these were the first alien-life forms that showed true sapience. However, when they started killing civilians on the station and colony, the novelty wore off.

It was on fortune's luck that most of the soldiers were down on the colony itself. Unfortunate was the fact that they weren't up at the station, which was doing its best to send an S.O.S back home. And so here Rena was, doing her best to keep these aliens from destroying the last hope for salvation.

====

"Everyone else has gotten their quarry, Rena. Its okay to come back to the barricade now." "Boss", because he was the undisputed leader of the soldiers after their real commander died, said.

"I'm coming chief, hopefully I can cap off a few more of the bastards" Rena went behind the pile of corpses and put down a device, flicking on, Rena moved back as a flash of light engulfed the corpses. Almost instantly after she had turned it on, the corpses disappeared. Apparently satisfied with her action, Rena walked off, her plasma gun ready for action. While she made her way down the corridor, Rena heard a scuffle going on. She readied herself and ran to the battle and she was greeted by two soldiers firing off at a horde of creepers.

"Hang on men, i'm coming!" Rena jumped into the action, she fired off round after round to thin out the horde. She also made sure she wasn't in the line of fire for the others, who seemed to be thankful for her response.

So caught up in her action, she didn't even hear the beast that made its way behind her. One of the soldiers looked at Rena's position and shouted a warning. "BEHIND YOU!"

She heard his cry and instantly turned around, a alien form called a "Grabber" behind her. A weird form that was comparable to a jellyfish and octopus floated gently; whether it was the cry of the solider, or Rena's aggressive stance, didn't matter much in the short-term. With a horrific roar, it came at Rena; at the moment,the cat-girl had tried to transform her armor into a shield. With this action, it changed Rena's life forever. The tentacle pierced her armor and the strange energies of her armor reacted to that. Rena fired a few rounds into the beast, unaware that its blood was causing even more strangeness to happen inside of her.

After a few rounds of shooting it, Rena figured it was dead. Which was easily discernible with the car tire size hole in its form. She could hear the sound of the battle finish without her and with that the call of one of her companions-at-arms

"You okay solider? Do you need medical assistance?"

Rena waved him off. " I'm fine, the gel will fix things up!"

Rena was, again, unaware that she made her situation worse. The blood of the Grabber was slowly changed her DNA without Rena knowing the true extent of its machinations. What would she do now?
115222221.title: Rena Island

115222222.content:
Fight Of The North Sun-
A parody of "Fist of The North Star", Rena follows the role of Kenshiro. With the titular power being replaced by an expansive version of itself. Rena travels the waste looking for her love, all the while expanding evil-doers and villains. Will she achieve her goal?
115222222.title: Fight Of The North Sun

12.content:
Jackpot! - While working as a stagehand for a magic act in Las Vegas, Rena decides to hit the slot machines on a whim. As luck would have it, she wins the jackpot of ten million dollars! Having not eaten all day, the first thing Rena does with her newfound wealth is hit the buffet. Having never eaten this much before, Rena discovers she enjoys eating a lot, and decides to keep it up. But how much is enough for her? How fat will she become?


Rena in Blubberland - A parody of Alice in Wonderland. While on a camping trip, Rena ends up getting lost. She follows a very strange, fat rabbit down it's hole, and finds her self in the upsidedown world of Blubberland. The denizens of this place are appalled buy how thin Rena is, and are determined to make her a fat as them.


Rena the Striped - One of my favorites from the original story. Rena is an all powerful sorceress in a mythical land, known as Rena the Striped, who is very arrogant, with a massive ego. The Grand Council of Mages summon her to destroy fifty deadly monsters that have been released and ravage the land. Fed up with her arrogance, the council decide to teach Rena a lesson, and place a spell her. If she should die on her quest, she will be resurrected, but she will gain more and more weight each time she comes back.


Dream On! - Rena dreams of a world where everything from the trees to the ground, even the animals are made of food. After making a pig of herself in her dream, Rena awakes to find she has gained a substantial amount of weight! This happens over and over again each night. Why is Rena having this dream, and how is she gaining weight?
12.title: Weight Gain

121.content:
Las Vegas, Nevada. Where fortunes are won and lost, but mostly lost. Most stories that begin here tell how some lucky bastard hit it big, but then lost it all in the same night. Most of them. But not this time. This story is about an average catgirl, who by a stroke of luck, or fate, depending which one you believe in, her life was changed forever. For better or worse? That's for you to decide.

It was a typical night on the strip. Bright lights flashing everywhere, illuminating the casinos and hotels in an attempt to lure even more suckers in, to blow their hard earned money in the slim hopes of getting lucky and winning the jackpot at the slots, blackjack, craps, roulette, or whatever their game of choice may be. Outside one of these casinos, The Mirage, to be exact, there was a bright neon sign, advertising the casino's entertainment for the evening.

ONE NIGHT ONLY! THE AMAZING ALEXANDER DUFONT, ILLUSIONIST EXTRAORDINAIRE! A SHOW LIKE NO OTHER!

In the backstage area of the Mirage, a skinny catgirl with tiger-striped fur held a clip board in her hand, taking inventory of the props for that night's magic act. "Piranha tank, check. Guillotine, check. Disappearing cabinet, check."

"RENA!"

Pompous A-hole, Rena though to herself, double check. She turned around to see Alexander Dufont, her boss, storming up to her. He was a bald man with a curly handlebar mustache, and a distinct French accent, dressed in a black suit and tie. He was also an egotistical jerk, thinking himself the greatest magician since Houdini. Rena, along with a good number of others, saw him as a Criss Angel wannabe.

"What did you do with my hat?" Asked Dufont, angrily. "I haven't seen it, sir." "Don't give me that! You were the last one to touch it when you picked up my suit from the dry cleaners, so where is it?" Rena was used to this sort of treatment from her boss. She had been working as his stagehand since she was sixteen, and he would always blame her whenever something was misplaced or went wrong. Not to mention, Dufont was too cheap to hire more assistants, so Rena had to pretty much do everything by herself. If Rena didn't depend on this job as her only means of income, she'd have told Dufont to shove it a long time ago.


"The last time I saw your hat, it was in your dressing room, with your suit. So if it's not there, someone must have moved it." Dufont grunted "Stolen, more likely. That hat is my trademark! When I find out who took it, their ass is mine!" As Dufont stormed away, Rena scoffed to herself. That egomaniac was about as intimidating as a basket of kittens. Rena's stomach let out a loud rumble. She looked at her watch to see that it was 7 PM. She had been so busy preparing everything for Dufont's show tonight, she had skipped lunch, and it was past dinner time. "Might as well take my break now." Dufont allowed Rena to take one half-hour break everyday to do as she pleased, about the only decent thing he had done for her. Placing her clipboard aside, and grabbing her purse, Rena made her way away from the stage, and towards the buffet area. But in order to get there, Rena would first have to go through the slot machine area of the Mirage. Rows upon rows of flashing lights and spinning symbols, each occupied by tourists with cups full of quarters, all trying desperately win the grand jackpot. Nobody had hit the big one on the slots at the Mirage in quite some time, and every night it kept growing and growing, bringing in even more gamblers in the hopes of being set for life.

As Rena made her way through the section of the casino, one thing in particular caught her eye. It was a grand slot machine designed to look like a throne, surrounded by neon signs, with lights shaped like various jewels lining it's frame.

The name of the machine was The King's Ransom. It was currently occupied by a man who was swiftly inserting quarters into the machine, and yanking down the lever in such a fury, Rena was expecting the man to break it clean off. At his feet was a large cup of quarters nearly as big as a bucket, and was rapidly becoming more and more empty with each attempt the man made to win. With her superb hearing, Rena heard the man muttering under his breath "Come on, come on, baby, three crowns, daddy needs a payday."

After ten straight minutes of this, the man plucked his final quarter from the bottom of the cup, inserted it into the slot, pulled the lever, and crossed his fingers. When the symbols stopped spinning, he got three lemons. Defeated and furious, the man swore loudly, banged his fist on the side of the machine, and stormed off, ranting and raving that the game was rigged. Rena looked up at the electronic sign at the top of the machine, and then understood why the man was so mad that he had lost.

JACKPOT: $10,000,000

It was at this point that Rena caught a glimpse of silver out of the bottom of her eye. She looked down and saw a single quarter glistening in the light. She picked it up, held it in her palm, and simply stared at it. Rena wasn't the gambling type, but even so, it was extremely tempting. Should she go for it? Could she possibly win the grand prize, and instantly become a multimillionaire? She imagined what she could do with all that money. She could quit her job and never have to put up with Dufont and his insufferable ego ever again. She could actually get a decent home, instead of her cramped little apartment that was more like a broom closet. But most of all, she'd be financially secure for the rest of her life.

Ah, what the hell, she thought. It couldn't hurt to try. She approached the machine. According to the rules posted next to it, in order to win the jackpot, the symbols had to land on three crowns in a row. Rena inserted her one quarter, and pulled the lever. The symbols instantly began to spin, going so fast it was impossible to tell them apart. Rena stood there and watched, fully expecting the symbols to stop on a losing one. She held her breath as the first symbol began to slow, eventually coming to a stop.

One crown.

Soon the second symbol began to slow. In the back of her mind, Rena knew that it would no doubt land on a losing symbol, and she would lose her big chance. The second symbol stopped. Another crown. For a brief moment, Rena felt excited. Could it be true? Could she really have some luck for once in her life? The final symbol started to slow. Rena suddenly began to lose hope, as she thought about how she had never been that lucky, and would lose by a hair's width.

Suddenly, Rena nearly jumped out of her skin, as alarms and bells suddenly went off, and the machine's jewel shaped lights began rapidly blinking on and off. The sign above the machine flashed a single word in bright red letters: WINNER. Rena looked down at the symbols display.

Three crowns in a row.

She did it! She'd won! Overcome by a wave of triumphant euphoria, Rena began jumping for joy, raising her fists in the air and shouting "YES!" But her celebration was cut short, as she was approached by a man in a black suit and tie, with dark sunglasses. "Excuse me, miss, I'm the head of security at the Mirage. May I have your name please?"

"Rena Westfall."

"Congratulations, Miss Westfall. If you'll come with me, please." Rena followed the man to the owner of the casino's office, who shook her hand vigorously. "You are one lucky lady, Miss Westfall. If you'll just give us your bank account information, your prize money will automatically be transferred to it." Rena did so, and left the office as a millionaire. She couldn't believe it, in one night she had acquired more money than most people make in their whole life! More money than she knew what to do with! Actually, that last part wasn't true, because at this point, Rena was reminded of her earlier hunger as her stomach growled loudly. The first thing she would do with her newfound wealth, was hit the buffet.

Option 1: Rena is so hungry, she gorges herself at the buffet. Having never eaten this much delicious food before, she decides that from now on, she'll eat whatever she wants, and as much as she wants. Afterwards, she tells Dufont to blow it out his ass, and goes on a shopping spree with her newfound wealth.

Option 2: Same as above, except instead of going shopping, Rena is confronted by the man who was trying to win at The King's Ransom before she did. He might try to rob her, or assault her, wherever the story goes from there is up to the author.

Option 3: Reader's Choice.
121.title: Jackpot!

1211.content:
Rena felt her stomach growling and then rubbed her stomach. "I guess that makes up my mind for me." Rena decided to head to the buffet since she was still hungry. Hey, she was rich now, she could afford it. Once she got to the buffet, Rena found some fresh fish and immediately started going to work on it, leaving the bones in a neat little pile. "So good." She said with ecstasy.

It was good, after all, as a stage hand she was once off limits to this kind of high quality food. She even dipped some fish into mustard and before she knew it, the fish was gone. Rena let out a slight belch and then covered her mouth. "Maybe I better stop it. If I eat all this, I'm going to get... hey, it's my body." As Rena was eating, she was about to be interrupted.

"RENA!" Rena stopped eating as a steak bone was sticking out of her mouth and let out a groan. She saw that hack Dufont coming forward and he was steaming mad. "You lazy cat! Stuffing your face at a time like this, and so close to showtime! You better drop what you're doing right now or else!" Rena spat out the T-bone and cracked a smirk as she turned around. "Or else what Alexander the Not so Great?"

Dufont gives a glare Rena's way as the patrons look on in awe. "What was that?" Rena walkes in front of Dufont and hisses as she shows her claws. "You heard me. I'm sick of your crap Dufont. I'm done being a slave. You're a no-talent hack whose threats are as empty as Homer Simpson's head. But I've hit the jackpot now. I don't need you any more. In fact, you were the one who needed me. Go soak your head up that top hat loser!" To get her point across, Rena picks up a pie from the buffet table and splats it right in Dufont's face as the magician yells.

Everyone laughs as Dufont runs off and Rena gives a satisfied smile. Now she'll never have to deal with that creep anymore.

Now what does she do?
1211.title: Food and Retaliation

12111.content:
Smiling with satisfaction to herself at having told off Dufont, Rena resumed eating. Never before had she eaten so much delicious food in one meal! By the time she was finished, she had eaten at least three pounds worth of fish, prime rib, steak, ice tea, shrimp, and several other dishes. Rena leaned back in her chair, picking her teeth with one of her claws as she let out a small burp.

She gently patted her now full, slightly distended stomach and smiled. Today had been quite interesting to say the least, not many people could say they became a millionaire overnight. Speaking of which, Rena began to think of what she would do next with her money.

Countless possibilities came rushing through her head all at once. She could get herself a nice new house, a car, maybe even her own private island. She giggled at the thought. Then her mind turned to the extravagant meal she just ate. She had always been on the thin side, and usually ate lite. She never really knew how good it felt to eat until you were actually full and satisfied. It was a wonderful feeling to her, and she wanted to feel it more often.

It was then that Rena decided that from now on, she would eat whatever she wanted, and as much as she wanted. And if she put on weight, so be it. She was tired on having a stick figure body anyway.

Rena looked at her watch, and saw it was nearly ten thirty. All that food had made Rena sleepy, and she decided she might as well go to bed. She paid for her food, and checked herself into the hotel section of The Mirage. She usually slept on the sofa in her former boss's trailer, but seeing as she just quit her job, that wasn't really an option.
Not that it bothered her, because she had ordered the best suite in the hotel, and was pleased to finally sleep in a real bed again .

Collapsing onto a bed as soft as a cloud, Rena fell asleep in minutes. She awoke the next morning, and was surprised to see that her formerly flat belly had developed a bit of pudge to it. She supposed this was to be expected, after all that food she ate last night. Speaking of which, she felt like ordering room service for breakfast.

She picked up the hotel phone and ordered the biggest omelet they had, along with bacon, toast and a whole gallon of milk. As Rena ate, she thought of how she would spend the rest of her day. She decided since she now had millions of dollars to her name, she might as well put it to good use. She was going to need new clothes if she was going to eat as much as she wanted from now on, to accommodate the inevitable changes to her body.

After breakfast, Rena took a taxi to the nearest mall. As the taxi pulled up in front of the mall, she tipped the driver for the trip. As she approached the building, she decided to,

Choice 1: Go to the local clothing store and buy herself some new clothes.

Choice 2: Head to the grocery store and buy herself as many treats as she can carry
12111.title: Finish the Buffet

choices: She heads off to buy new clothes, then go to a restaurant.
She goes to a restaurant, then go shopping for clothes.
121112.content:
With millions of dollars in her name, Rena decided to go buy food first, then clothing. She headed to the supermarket, grabbed a trolley, and began to raid the store of all its sweets, meats, and drinks.

People gave her curious glances as she walked by with a trolley stacked high to heaven with products, most of them absolutely calorie-inducing, but she didn't care; she was rich!

All of the food added up a bill that would feed an entire middle-class family for a month, but that didn't even make the slightest of dent in her budget.

She called a taxi and loaded the trunk up with food. Back at the hotel, Rena stacked her coverts with food and her mini-refrigerator.

As for her sweets, she consumed all four pounds of it, washing it down with soda. She stretched out on her bed, rubbing her candy-filled belly, and she doused off.

When Rena awoke, she discovered that she was even more fatter than earlier. She examined herself in the mirror: her belly began to curve, her butt was larger and wider, her face was losing its cat-like sharpness, and her breasts were slightly larger as well.

"Looks like I'm gonna need some new clothing," she said, becoming aware of the tightness of her jeans
121112.title: Food Bonanza

1211121.content:
As her weight was increasing dramatically, Rena knew that she would have to buy new and bigger clothes soon. Grabbing her purse, she head outside, caught a cab, and went back to the mall again.

On her way to the nearest clothing department, a store that sold sports equipment, and also sport uniforms for soccer, football, and hokey, caught her attention.

Before the window, a mannequin was put on display, dressed in a strange blue leotard. A tag hung from it that read, "One size fits all."

An idea popped into Rena's head, and she went inside. Catching the first employee that walked by, she asked him, "That weird suit on display in your window, does it really fit all sizes?"

"Well," said the employee, "From what I heard it's supposed to be made out of super stretchy fabric. So, yeah, I guess."

"Then I'll take it." Rena said.

The catgirl had a simple plan: with this super elastic suit she would not have to buy any more clothing for a while. The cost didn't bother her, for she had a ton of money, but it was annoying to go out shopping for new clothing every time she got a little bigger.

With the leotard under her clothing, Rena left the store, heading off to the nearest all-you-can-eat restaurant.
1211121.title: Unique clothing.

choices: Rena accepts the offer, but they both soon decide they like living together
Rena rejects the offer, and becomes fast friends with Lei
12111211.content:
Rena practically skipped into the restaurant, a diner-style buffet called The American Dream. She was soon seated at a table for two near the window.

"Good evening, ma'am," the waitress, a gray-furred wolfgirl who was more belly fat than anything else, said. "My name is Lei, and I will be your server. What will you be having tonight?"

Rena smiled hungrily. "I'll have the buffet."

"Excellent choice," Lei said. She then leaned in close and stage-whispered to Rena "You probably can't tell, but I'm particularly partial to the buffet."

Rena and Lei both chuckled. The wolfgirl jotted something down on her notepad and waddled off to take the next order. Rena meanwhile walked up to the buffet table and picked up a plate. She almost giggled to herself before she walked down the line and took a handful of everything. By the time Rena reached the other end of the table, her plate was piled high with French fries, burgers, and at least twenty different kinds of hotdogs. She plunked her plate on her table before going back three more times to create a total of four near identical plates.

The first bite was heaven. Rena had to force herself to moan in pleasure right there in the restaurant, no matter how orgasmically delicious the greasy burger in her hands was. Rena quickly wolfed down the rest of her burger and moved on to the next. And the next, and the one after that, until the next bite she took was of an equally delicious hotdog. After that bite, she was lost in a food induced utopia until her fingers scraped porcelain. Rena looked around her table for more food.

There wasn't any. Rena had eaten all four plates of food, and judging by the fact that she had a six-inch high stack of plates on her table, she had eaten far more than she'd intended. Rena was snapped completely out of her reverie by the shooting pain coming from her stomach. Her previously mostly flat stomach had rounded out quite a bit- it not stuck out roughly a foot and a half from her body.

"Are you alright?" A familiar voice asked Rena. The catgirl in question managed to see through the haze of pain to see that it was Lei, the wolfgirl waitress from before. Rena groaned and shook her head.

"Do you want me to drive you home?" Lei asked.

"Don't... you... have... work?" Rena groaned out.

Lei looked amused. "The restaurant closed two hours ago. I'm the only staff member here 'cause I volunteered to stay behind."

Lei gently guided Rena's hand to her massive stomach. To Rena's pain-numbed surprise, it was taught.

"Of course, I couldn't help myself and I just had to have some food for myself," Lei said fake bashfully. "So where do you live?"

"Don't... have... a home," Rena said. "Won... jackpot..."

"Easy there," Lei said. "Save your strength. And how about I let you crash with me until you get your own place?"
12111211.title: Hit The Limit

121112111.content:
"Thank... you..." Rena said.

"No problem!" Lei responded.

Lei helped Rena into her car and drove off to her house.

It was a moderate home. Fairly small, two story, one bedroom, one bath, and the like.

Lei slowly and carefully led Rena out of the car and into the house.

Once they were in the living room, Rena plopped down on the couch and stayed there.

Lei asked "Feeling better?"

"Yeah, thanks." Rena replied.

"No problem! It was getting lonely here anyways." Lei giggled.

Rena laughed along with her, but not for long, as her stomach began aching again. She then grasped her belly in pain.

Lei, clearly worried, asked, "You okay?"

Rena, still holding her massive gut, said, "Yeah, just still hurts."

Lei then asked "So what did you say about a fortune?"

Rena then recited everything that has happened before now.

Lei, having heard the entire story, said "Gee, that guy must have been a complete ass!"

Rena responded, with a light giggle "Yeah, he was. Glad I miraculously won that jackpot!"

Lei took one quick glance at the clock, and said "10:00 already? We'd better get to bed!"

Rena happily obliged, and lied down on the couch .

Lei quickly asked "Do you want any pajamas?"

Rena responded, "Are you sure you've got any that will fit me?"

Lei giggled at Rena's remark, and went and got her a pillow and blanket.

The next morning, Rena woke up very groggy, as per having a huge belly.

When she got up, she noticed that her belly had shrunk, as it had digested the feast she had before. It didn't shrink a lot, still about the size of a beach ball, but this made it easier to get up.

She went into the kitchen, where Lei was preparing breakfast.

"Good morning, sunshine!" Lei said, noticing Rena.

"Hey, what's cooking?" Rena asked.

Lei responded, "Oh, just a little meal for us. Nothing to big."

"Alright then. I'm going back to the living room. Just bring it out when you're done." Rena said, trying to not fall asleep right there.

Lei giggled and shook her head as she watched the obese cat girl waddle her way back to the couch.

After a few minutes, breakfast was served. Rena was taken aback by what was in front of her. A full spread of breakfast foods was in front of her.

Lei was sitting next to her, smiling. She then said, "Well, what do you think?"

Rena, still surprised, asked, "What's all this for?"

Lei responded, "Oh, just thought I'd give you a welcome gift!"

Rena, now realizing it was all for her asked, "What are you going to eat?"

Lei replied, "While you were out cold, I made a small breakfast for myself, and I was gonna make one for you, but then I thought about how you tore through your burgers at the buffet, and thought you'd might enjoy something bigger."

Rena was flabbergasted. She had actually impressed someone.

Lei noticed the look of amazement on Rena's face, and asked, "What's up?"

Rena told her, "I was never really able to impress anyone before, my boss always did knockoff tricks that only amazed kids. But You're amazed at how much I was able to eat at the buffet, now that... That makes me feel way more than just being fake sawed in half."

Lei, not sure what she meant by this, asked, "What do you mean?"

Rena replied with, "I mean, all my life, I thought I was a side character... but you made me feel like I was someone important."

Lei, now understanding what Rena has been through, told her, "I felt the same way. When I first got the job at the buffet, I felt like I was making the worst decision ever, but turns out that I was wrong, cause I met you. You showed me what being amazing can be like. You were in total bliss when you scarfed those burgers down like they were nothing! I knew you were something, but when I noticed you were in pain I knew I had to step up to the plate. The only reason I stayed behind was to see how you did it, but I soon figured out that you've never been like... This before."

"It's okay, I know I'm fat. I think I'll get used to it though!" Rena responded, "So basically, I was an inspiration for you?"

Lei nodded.

Rena was speechless. She never thought she would have someone looking up to her, but, low and behold, Lei outright said it. "So im assuming you brought me here is because you're becoming a crazed super-fan and want me for yourself?"

"What!?! No! Of course not! I wouldn't stoop that low!" Lei responded.

"Just wanted to make sure." Rena affirmed

"So... You ready for breakfast now?"

"Heck yeah!"

And the feast began...

About 12 minutes later, Rena had finished the entire set up. Lei sitting next to her, with a look of congratulations, rubbing her belly.

"Oof, I've never ate that much in my life!" Rena said, clearly stuffed beyond belief.

Lei responded, "Well, get ready, cause we're going to the mall today!

"Wait, REALLY!?!" Rena nearly screamed.

Lei replied, "Yep, and you get to choose where to go first!"

Rena said "Well, what are we doing here, sitting around? Let's go!"

They got into the car (Rena had to move her seat back due to her large gut), and drove off to the mall.

"So, where to first, Rena?"
121112111.title: Rena accepts the offer, but they both soon deci...

1213.content:
How about these options?

Option 1: A local gambler invites Rena to his party at his penthouse. While there, she gorges herself and becomes the life of the party.

Option 2: Rena decides to head back to her apartment and order some food.
1213.title: Reader's Choice

122.content:
