A young feline woman stood atop the leaf-covered hill, deep in the woods outside her hometown. She took a deep breath, enjoying the musty smell of the various plant life. Brilliant emerald green eyes flitted back and forth as she used the hill as a vantage point, searching for a particular clearing. Her eyes lit up, her tail giving a happy flick, as she found the place she was searching for. Shifting the straps of the heavy pack on her back, so large it dwarfed the scrawny catgirl, she made her way down the hill. A few stumbles that thankfully didn't result in her rolling down the hill later, and she was plopping the oversized backpack on the ground with a small 'oof' of relief.

"Aaaaah!" She exhaled deeply, having sucked in a large breath of refreshing forest air. She loved that musty, woody smell. She camped in this exact spot every summer, had ever since she was a little kitten of a girl. She'd always loved the woods and having some peaceful quiet to herself for a few days was jut the thing she needed after a year of hustle and bustle. Taking a moment to push aside some stray strands of her long red hair, she set about getting all her things unpacked and in their proper place. After nearly an hour of work, she was done. Slapping her furry hands together to rid them of dirt, she plopped down happily on a small fold-up chair. Between the long hike lugging that heavy pack around and setting it all up, she definitely needed to kick back for a bit. Her thin legs were sore and complaining, and she took a moment to arch her back in an effort to work the kinks out of it and her shoulders. The hard part was over though! Now she got to sit back and relax, not worrying about anything and just enjoying the woods.

Her stomach rumbled, reminding her of the other thing she liked about camping; camping snacks! Rummaging through her much lighter pack, she retrieved the essential ingredient: extra large marshmellows! As far as she was concerned, it wasn't quite a camping trip unless you had marshmellows to roast and to make s'mores with. Plus, since she was out here alone, that just meant she got to keep all of it to herself! Tail flitting about in anticipation, she fished out some matches and got a campfire going. It was still a little early to be lighting a fire, but the sun wasn't that far from going down and the night would be cold anyways. Giving a small giggle of amusement as she squished a plump marshmellow between her fingers, she popped it into her mouth. She had long since found she was too impatient to simply wait for the marshmellows to be roasted, so as she chewed the tasty treat she set about impaling a handful of the fluffy white cylinders on a large stick and held them over the open flame.

The fire crackled and snapped, the flames just short of reaching the tantalizing treats she was dangling above it. Swallowing her small sample, her free hand dipped back to her bag and popped another marshmellow into her waiting mouth. Just as the marshmellows started to turn a crispy golden brown, her hand dipping back down to the bag for one more marshmellow... She found to her confusion that there was no rustling of her furry hand on plastic and no plump and squishy treats between her outstretched fingers. Confusedly, she glanced away from the roasting marshmellows and found the entire bag had somehow vanished! A rustle of movement caught the corner of her eye, snapping her gaze back in front of her to find that the roasting marshmellows on her stick had vanished as well!

"What the?" She muttered, confused and alarmed at her vanished treats. Standing up, she glanced around in search of an explanation or culprit. Not far away she spotted one. A big lump of snow-white fur sat on the ground. Big floppy ears and large hind legs, and the large puffball of a tail, gave it away as a rabbit almost immediately. Just a very fat one, looking like a ball of fluff more than a lean and spry animal.

"That hit the spot..." A loud sigh of contentment came from the rabbit, and it patted it's chubby paws on it's large belly appreciatively.

"Hey! Those were mine!" The tiger-patterned catgirl objected, an annoyed look on her face. Her stomach gave a rumble of support for her protest, having not had it's fill of the marshmellows either.

The rabbit didn't pay her any mind, pulling a gold pocketwatch from a fold of fur-covered fat. After fumbling with the latch and getting it open, the rabbit let out a surprised squeak and quickly stuffed it back where it came from. With surprising agility for such a fat creature, it bolted off into the woods.

"Oh dear! I'm late! I'm late for a very important date!" The rabbit's cry floated back into the clearing.

It took a moment for her to register what had just happened, her annoyance replaced with confusion. After a moment that was replaced with indignation as she realized it'd just stolen her food and run away, and she gave chase. There was no way she was going to let that rabbit get away with that! Her sandal-clad feet slapped against the leaves and snapped fallen twigs as she pursued the thieving hare, accidentally snagging her hair or shirt against a low branch here and there. Despite these mishaps, the large ball of white was easy to keep track of against the green and brown of the forest floor. The rabbit made a sharp turn towards a large tree, diving into a large hole at it's base.

"Oof!" The fat hair grunted as it's rotound middle stopped it from passing through completely. Flailing it's hind legs, the pursuing catgirl gave a cry of triumph as she quickly caught up. Just as she reached down to grab the thief by it's hind feet, a sound like a cork popping free of a bottle sounded and the hare vanished into the hole.

"Hey!" She cried out in frustration, fingers closing around empty air. She quickly dropped to her hands and knees, peering into the hole. Only pure black met her inquiring gaze, far to covered in shadows for her to see even the hint of a white rabbit in there. It was a large tree the rabbit had fled into, so she supposed even one as fat as that would have enough room to hide. Reaching one hand in tentatively, she flailed it around in search of anything. Her hand again met only open air, and with a frown she reached in with her other one as well. Still finding nothing, not even the feel of solid wood, she ducked her head through the hole as well. Having expected to smack against dirt or wood, she was surprised when she pitched forward, unbalanced and tumbling into the hole entirely. While she was much taller than the rabbit, her scrawny form was much thinner and had no trouble making it through at all.

Down she fell through the pitch black darkness, air rushing past her, and she let out a surprised shriek. Suddenly the darkness was broken by light far below her, and she screamed louder at the sight of ground below her. If such a long fall didn't kill her, it'd certainly break something! She slammed into the yellow ground hard... Bouncing back up? Too confused to be scared, she bounced a few more times, each time with less momentum, before she found herself simply sitting on the ground in confusion. She smacked the ground a few times with her hands, the spongey material wiggling and smooshing in response before going back to it's natural shape.

"Sponge?" She mumbled to herself, pinching it between two fingers. A small piece broke off, and she brought it up to her green eyes to get a better look at it. Squishing it between her fingers and turning it, her nose tickled as she got a whiff of a familiar smell. She tilted her head curiously, confused. That smell was... Sponge cake? That was impossible! How could the floor of a cave under the forest be made out of sponge cake? Compelled to prove it couldn't be sponge cake, she tentatively gave it a lick. To her amazement, it tasted exactly how it smelled. Now more curious than confused, she popped the piece of sponge cake into her mouth and chewed it thoughtfully. Her stomach gave a rumble of approval, and her eyes lit up in further amazement. It was sponge cake! Impossible or not, she was absolutely sure that's exactly what it was!

Standing up tentatively, giving an amused giggle as she bounced up and down on the spongey surface a few times, she glanced around for the first time. The 'cave' wasn't very large. It was a big round room, the ceiling so far up as to vanish in the darkness. She couldn't even tell where the hole she had fell through was. The entire floor was made of bright yellow sponge cake, and the walls seemed to be made of dark, smooth stone of some kind. On the far wall, the size of a mousehole, was a door. She blinked at it curiously when she saw it, but the large white table set in the middle of the room caught her attention first. A note sat upon it, along with a small clear bottle.

"Eat me...?" She read aloud, puzzled. She lifted up the small bottle, eyeing the contents. "Chocolate chips?"

After a moment, she shrugged. She didn't know where she was or what was going on but, that rabbit had come through here too. This note seemed like it was some kind of instructions, and there didn't seem to be any other way out. Unscrewing the lid, she fished out a single chocolate chip and popped it into her mouth. The taste of chocolate met her tongue, and she made a small 'mmm' of appreciation. Fishing out another chocolate chip, she popped it into her mouth as well when a strange tingling sensation prickled across her orange and black fur.

"Weird..." She murmured, looking at her hands and arms in confusion. Still wanting more chocolate, she dumped the whole thing into her hand and set the jar aside. Popping another into her mouth, she returned to examining the room. That doorway seemed like the only other thing worth looking at. Another chip into her mouth, the tingling still present. With a sigh, she looked back towards the table. That door was way too small. Another chip, and she paused.

"Wasn't that table taller?"
122.title: Hi Ho The Derry-O, A Camping We Will Go!

123.content:
Long ago in the land of Torim, there existed fifty terrible beasts known as the Malabestia, monstrous beings of great evil, who knew no better pleasure than terrorizing the mortal races of the world. For untold years they ravaged the land, until finally, the Grand Council of Mages banished them to an empty dimension for all time. A millenium passed, and the Malabestia faded from all memory, except those of the council, who from that point forward passed the knowledge of the Malabestia and their imprisonment on to their successors, so that if they would ever escape, the council could once again send them back into oblivion.

But alas, as the centuries passed, the knowledge of the spell that was used banish the Malabestia was lost. So now, if they were to be released, the only hope to save the world from their plight, was for someone to do the impossible. Someone would have to destroy them.

But no ordinary weapon could harm the Malabestia. In order to slay them, one would need an exceptionally powerful enchanted weapon, not to mention the one wielding it would have to be extremely powerful themself. Someone like the legendary sorceress, Rena the Striped.

Raised since childhood in the arcane arts, Rena quickly discovered she had an exceptional talent for magic, and was always looking to increase her already extraordinary powers. She was a member of the race known as the Kath, humanoid cats of various breeds. She was famous throughout the land, not only because of her power, but because of her massive ego.

Ever since Rena her academy days, Rena had developed quite the superiority complex, believing herself to be the most powerful sorceress in the world, and while that may not have been far that from the truth, the Council, as well as her fellow mages, grew more and more fed up with her arrogance by the day.

One day, as she was soaking in her personal hot springs, a phoenix swooped down from the sky, with a piece of parchment clutched in it's beak. Rena knew the phoenix had been sent by the Grand Council of Mages, those old geezers had always communicated by way of mystic birds. Rena never understood why, then again, she didn't really care for anything the council did. She considered them all to be foolish old men, spending all day in their tower on their gilded thrones, debating over such petty matters as whether they should revoke the entrance fee for the Arcane Academy.

Rena set the scroll aside as she stood up and exited the spring. She used to have such a scrawny figure, but thanks to a little alteration spell, she now had a sizable bust, as well as an admittedly perky rear. With a snap of her fingers, her body instantly dried, and her fur was nice and smooth against her skin.

She noticed the phoenix was still there, seemingly staring at her nude self. Rena scowled. "Why don't you carve a statue? It'll last longer." She aimed two fingers at the bird, and a bolt of lightning shot from her hand, striking the ground directly next to the phoenix. It flew off with an angry squawk, as Rena gave a light smirk. After dressing herself in her usual attire, a red cloak and hood with a emerald green tunic, Rena sat on a nearby rock as she opened the scroll and read it.



Rena the Striped,

You are cordially summoned to the Tower of the Grand Council, to discuss a most urgent matter. We feel you are the only one qualified to handle this dilemma, and urge you to come to the city of Tytus post haste. Complete the task we bestow upon you, and your reward shall include half of the gold in our vaults, the Heart of Torim ruby, and the Gauntlet of Menomitus. Please come at once the safety of the world depends on it.



High Wizard Borus


Rena grinned. So, those old fools we're willing to give her their greatest treasures, in exchange for completing a measly task? This would be the easiest score of her life! No matter what their little assignment was, it would no doubt simple for someone of her power. She had made her living by saving entire cities from natural disasters, monsters, and other such things, but only at a great price, usually in the form of gold or a powerful magical artifact.

Picking up her staff, Rena focused her mind on the city of Tytus, the capitol of Torim, and with a bright flash of light, she appeared outside the entrance to the Council Tower. the tower itself was easily the tallest structure in the city, if not all of Torim, and symbolized the status and power of the Council itself. They didn't govern the land, but acted as advisors to the emperor, as well as providing various services to the public.

Rena entered the gates, past the sentry golems that guarded the entrance, and stepped onto the stone disk with mystical symbols carved into it. Rena banged bottom of her staff three times on the disk, which began to glow with a bright purple light. In an instant, Rena was was standing in the center of the Council chamber, facing the seven council members as they sat on their thrones. They all wore dark blue robes, and had long white hair and beards, Rena always wondered if it would kill them to let a woman on the council, not that she would be interested in the job, she had much better things to do.

"Ah, Rena the Striped. Glad you could make it." Said Borus, the head of the council. He sat in the center chair, with three other council members on either side of him. "Whatever.This had better be worth my time, old man." Rena replied. Borus put on a slight scowl as he continued, this was not the first time they had commissioned Rena for a task, and he and the rest of the council have had just about enough of Rena's arrogance and disrespect. "I promise you, complete this task, and we shall make it worth your time. You must hunt down and slay the Malabestia."

Rena arched an eyebrow. " I thought they were dead already." "Not dead, just banished from this plane by the original Council." Said Borus "We don't know how, but they have escaped their perdition, and are running amok throughout the land. Only an extremely powerful artifact can destroy the Malabestia, and so we present you with this."

Borus clapped his hands together, and a magnificent sword materialized in mid air in front of Rena, who gasped in amazement. "Is that..." Borus nodded "Yes, the Sword of Souls." Rena set her staff on the floor, and grasped the sword, drawing it frown it's scabbard. It's blade was forged of pure gold, and a silver handle with a large ruby in the center.

"This blade will absorb the souls of those it slays." Borus continued, "It will also grow in power with each soul absorbed. After you've slain all fifty of the Malabestia, you are to return the sword to us. We also ppresent you with this enchanted feather." Borus produced a white feather from his leave, and it levitated over to Rena. "It will point you in the direction of the nearest Malabestia, and will glow once you have found it. And finally, to help you succeed in your quest, we will place a spell on you that will resurrect you right here, should you die on your journey."

Rena scoffed. "Oh please, I don't need your help. I will slay these petty beasts on the first try, without the aid of feeble old fools." Taking the sword and feather, Rena prepared to leave, but she had already crossed the line. There was a noise like thunder as Rena's body was suddenly paralyzed and Borus' voice boomed out.

"RENA! YOU HAVE DISRESPECTED THIS COUNCIL FOR THE LAST TIME! YOU ARE VAIN, ARROGANT, GREEDY, AND AN ALL AROUND PAIN IN THE ASS!"

There was a bright flash of light, and Rena could move again. "What just happened?" All seven council members looked down at her with a sneer as Borus answered "We have had it with your disrespect towards this council, so we have decided to teach you a lesson in humility. We have placed our spell of immortality on you, but each time you are resurrected, you will gain more and more body weight."

"WHAT!?" WHY WOULD YOU MAKE A SPELL LIKE THAT!?"

"Simple. You are known for three things, your magical prowess, your immeasurable ego, and your lovely figure. By placing this spell on you, we hope to remove the latter two from the equation. In fact, let's make a little wager, hmm? If you complete your quest without dying once, you may keep the Sword of Souls."

At first Rena was furious, how dare they do this to her! But then she remembered, she was Rena the Striped! She would destroy the Malabestia without even trying, curse or no curse! "Fine, old man, you have a deal." With that said, she slammed her staff end on the floor, and teleported back to the gates. After Rena had gone, the council members all burst out laughing.


And so Rena's quest begins, but where will it take her first?

Option 1: Rena goes to a remote village where the Malabestia Zombie is spreading a deathly plague.

Option 2: Rena hunts the Malabestia Werewolf in the Forest of Bane.

Option 3: Rena must slay the Malabestia Dragon, who is terrorizing a nearby kingdom.
123.title: Rena the Striped

1231.content:
Rena gave a smirk. "You know," she said. "I think I'll start with the easiest one just to humor those beasts. The zombie should be the easiest one to kill, after all, he's already dead." Rena decided to head off to the village where the Malabestia zombie was spreading his plague as she waved her backside.

The Malabestia zombie resembled a decayed Cryptkeeper-style corpse, except with purple veins over his body and wavy light purple-blond hair. The zombie was groaning as he leaked out toxic purple slime from his mouth. The zombie coughed as his jaw dropped into the river nearby Crystal Lake Village. The zombie fished out and put his jaw back in right after it leaked out a foul smelling black ooze that turned the water a purplish color. A few birds drank the tainted water, causing them to mutate into skeletal forms that moaned out and decayed. The zombie walked into the deep water as more animals started to drink the tainted slime.

Rena had arrived near the village and was holding up the feather that had been given to her by the magic council. It pointed to Crystal Lake village and begun to glow. "Aha," said Rena. "So that's where the zombie has been hiding. Well, he'll have to return to his grave soon enough."

Rena walked closer to the village and saw that the village houses were covered in a thick moss and that there were toxic purple clouds flying above the village. Rena looked around and there were corpses everywhere, apparently having succumbed to the plague brought on by Zombie. Some corpses even looked like they died in the middle of their work since one corpse had been carrying a hoe.

Rena begun to cough and she took out her magic scarf to cover her mouth in order to protect herself from the poisons in the air. She bent over and saw a young girl corpse holding a doll and as Rena shook her head, she had to rub her eyes because she thought that she saw the corpse's hand moving.

Suddenly, Rena heard a loud snort and then she turned her head around to see that a zombified bull was running forward. Apparently not all corpses had completely stopped moving. Rena held out the Sword of Souls and swung it just as the zombie bull came at her. The sword took off the bull's horns but the bull ran past Rena and was coming back.

"Okay," said Rena as she held out her sword. "Time for a spell."

Which spell would best defeat the bull?
1231.title: Zombie Apocalypse

choices: Accidentally creates too much Power and Kills both her & the Undead (Mini Nuke)
Kills the Bull but causes a fire to spread to the rest of the Village
12311.content:
As she sneered at the Beast she Slowly lifts her sword. At this moment Rena closed her eyes and began to mumble. As she mumbled her sword began to glow red, as she held the blade; it’s temperature rises, higher, and higher and even higher. As she stands Flames begin erupting from the blade itself forming a rather small and fiery ring around the young Tigress.

(The Bull keeps Charging)

The Ring glows with a light of white glowing brighter and brighter to the point of making all but it’s user blind. It’s energy slowly to imbue as time moves on and on,The Ring grows larger and larger burning literally everything it touches to ash.

(The Bull keeps Charging )

Rena Opens her eyes now glowing a bright red. Immune to the Blindness she spots her prey taking her Stand on the Ashes of what use to be a farm. She gets ready to strike, instead of shooting the fire she decided it was best to strike it down fashionably and show a message to the rest of his kind. She prepares to strike Heating her sword even further

(The Bull keeps Charging)

Rena in shock of the persistence of this bull begins to think. “Does this thing want to die?” Clearly she is overdoing this Charging thing. As she charges time itself lagged at the terminal. The Undead bull charged towards the Young Tigress Running through the Ring. Now on Fire with the Bull still running it gets closer and closer to the Sorceress.
12311.title: Fire Spell

choices: Get back up and Check the Town for Survivors!
Move Onward to the next task, Remember what you Did
123111.content:
Rena Wakes up covered in Ash.

“What Happened?” Says the Young Sourceress

In front of her she sees a husk of what use to be the Bull

“I DID IT 1 down 49 to go-“

Too soon, as she celebrated her victory she felt a a small amount of tightness in her Robe. She looked down to see her stomach a few inches wider then it previously was. “Seriously? Damn It!” First Death Self inflicted, this is Embarrassing...Oh Well! Bet those Oldies didn’t Expect this!

She tried a body Charm; she sees the stomach get smaller

Ha take it! Then a face of laughter turned to regret as in a Matter of seconds her stomach went from shrinking to growing, now it is larger then it was previously. Okay Fine! Nothing I can do about that.... I Really Hope work this all off. Let’s see.... last I checked I was about 120 lb...

Rena cast a spell to check her weight, it is now 135

WHAT! 15! Merlin I Expected lower than that... One day I will get those sexist Sons Of B-

The Enraged Tigress grows to a sorrowful cub, she see’s something much worse than a little flab. The village is absolutely gone, everyone is Dead not a zombie but actually dead.

“I killed them all”

She falls too her knees crying

“I KILLED THEM”

I’m so sorry, None of you deserved any of this....
I wasn’t even thinking....
123111.title: Accidentally creates too much Power and Kills b...

12313.content:
As the zombie bull came forward, Rena held out her hand and cast a spell to turn it into a harmless zombie frog that she easily dispatched by stepping on it. "Sending zombified livestock after me? You're a coward, Zombie. Come on out and meet your death like a..." Before Rena could finish her sentence, a pair of zombie arms burst out of the ground and grabbed her by the feet. Rena screamed before Zombie popped his head out of the ground.

"You shrieked?" asked Zombie as he opened his mouth and bugs came out. Rena swung her foot and knocked zombies head to the side. "Head's up!" yelled zombie as his body came out of the ground. Zombie then waved his arm to call back his head. "How's kicks with you?" asked the Malabestia corpse. Rena then held her sword dangerously close to the zombie.

"Be careful with that, Rena the Striped," said Zombie. "Somebody could get hurt. And we definitely want that to happen." Zombie let out a laugh before Rena kicked him in the face and knocked him back. Zombie had to readjust his jaw. "Prepare to return to your grave, corpse breath," said Rena. "Because you're about to be destroyed by the greatest wizard in the world." Zombie took out one of his own eyes to polish it before speaking. "And people say that I'm full of hot scare. You think you're clever, clever salty girl. Ollie, ollie oxen-free!"

As Zombie yelled, all the poisoned corpses rose off the ground and moaned, even the little girl. Rena couldn't believe it. Even a dead dog rose off the ground to come after her and roared as it tried to bite her tail.One zombie cut Rena in the hip with a pitchfork as she screamed and Rena had to cut that zombie farmer in half. But then several zombie children and grabbed her to hold her down.

All while Zombie himself was laughing. "Game over, Rena the Striped. You'll be sure to go down in his-gory." While Zombie was laughing, Rena cast a fire spell to destroy the undead children and then a particularly fat zombie grabbed her in a headlock. Zombie's minions walked up towards Rena as Zombie himself laughed. Rena cast a few fireballs but was only able to hit one zombie at a time.

She saw the Malabestia Zombie himself laughing like a hyena and held out her Soul Sword. It looked like she had only one shot so she prepared to take aim with her sword just as Zombie was laughing. She aimed for his heart and tossed his sword.

Was she successful in hitting her target?
12313.title: Zombie Dance

choices: Take the offer- hope there's not too many leftovers
123132.content:
The Soul Sword spun through the air, gracefully, beautifully... and completely off target. The sword hit a zombie horse hilt-first and clattered to the ground. There was a moment of stunned silence before the Malabestia broke out into laughter.

"Oh, wow!" He said between guffaws. "Your aim is terrible! That's why you use spells! You couldn't aim if your life depended on it!"

The Zombie abruptly stopped laughing. "Which it did. Kill her."

The fat zombie that had Rena in a headlock grabbed her at the base of her neck. With a wet tearing sound, Rena's head was torn from her shoulders. The zombie dropped it to the ground. The Malabestia walked over to Rena's corpse.

"Sorry, girlie, but looks like you were dead wrong," he said. He raised his arms over his head. "Move, body of Rena the Striped. Join my army!"

A black bolt of lightning struck Rena's body. It crackled around her a bit, but nothing happened. Just as the Zombie was about to cast the spell again, white light shone from Rena's body. Her head reconnected itself with her body, and when she opened her eyes, the white light exploded, killing all the zombies except for the Malabestia. But the blast still did heavy damage to his body, blowing off all of his limbs. Even so, his limbs slowly began to regenerate. Rena, the Soul Sword in hand, walked over to the Zombie.

"Well, I honestly didn't expect that," the Zombie said.

"I already told you- I'm Rena the Striped, most powerful sorceress alive," Rena said. She positioned her sword to stab it into the Zombie's chest. "Any last words?"

"Yes, actually," the Zombie said. "Two things. First, we Malabestia can only be defeated by the Soul Sword. The Soul Sword gets more powerful the more Malabestia it has slain."

"I'm aware of that, Zombie," Rena said, poking the Zombie's chest with the Soul Sword.

"But this is where the fun part comes in!" The Zombie said. "If you learn the true name of the Malabestia you've killed, you can use a little bit of their power."

Now that was interesting. "What's your power?" Rena asked.

"My power is, obviously, to raise the dead," the Zombie explained. "If you say my true name, you can summon a single enemy you've killed at a time. That enemy will have all of the abilities that it did while alive."

"Well, then, Zombie, what's your true name?" Rena asked.

The Zombie smiled- a genuine smile, not the sneers he'd been doing- and said. "It's kinda hard to say: Dfgapy."

"And what's your second thing, Dfgapy?" Rena asked.

"Did you gain weight?" Dfgapy cackled before being impaled. Rena angrily sheathed the Soul Sword and cast a diagnostic spell on herself. Sure enough, she had gained weight- ten pounds of it. She poked her stomach- sure enough, she had gotten fatter. Of course, the diagnostic spell had told her that, but she felt she had to double check.

Rena turned around at the sound of groaning. She readied a fireball spell and whirled around. As it turned out, there were no zombies like she'd thought, but the zombies she'd slain had turned back into normal humans. The first to recover, a muscular woman wearing an apron, walked over to Rena.

"Yer the one tha' saved us?" She asked in a thick drawl.

"Yes, I'm the one that saved your town," Rena said, preening herself. "Are you going to give me a free room?"

The woman blinked before scowling. "I was, but yer attitude has made me think othawise," she said. "I'm the owna and cook of tha town's inn. If ya can eat all o' tha leftovas afta tha bar closes, I'll let ya stay one night fo' free."

Rena resisted the urge to blast that woman right then and there. Who the hell did she think she was? But Rena calmed herself. The High Council wanted her to learn humility, so she might as well start here.

"Before I answer," Rena said, "what if I want to stay more than one night?"

"Then ya hafta eat tha' night's leftovas too," the woman answered. "So, what'll it be?"
123132.title: Night of the Living Rena

choices: Forge ahead to fight the Malabestia Werewolf
Stay in the village to recharge safely, at the expense of getting fat
1231321.content:
Rena was smart about preparing for her chore. According to Lynn, the innkeeper, the bar closed at eleven at night. Rena had killed Dfgapy at roughly seven. For the next four hours, Rena ate nothing. She would have also cast hunger-inducing spells on either the patrons or herself, but Lynn had been smart and disallowed magic. Eventually, the last patron shuffled out of the inn, and Rena and Lynn were alone. Lynn spent a few minutes gathering the leftovers onto one table. Rena was about to sit down at the table when she noticed something.

"A lot of these are untouched!" She said.

"Some folks orda ahead o' time," Lynn answered. "Normally, it's no' this much, bu' all o' this stuff with the Malabestia made folks forgetful."

Rena sighed and sat down at the provided chair. After Rena had shifted to make herself comfortable, she grabs a fork and knife and began to eat a half-eaten steak.

§........§

As much as Rena hated to admit it, Lynn was an amazing cook. The flavors in her dishes were exquisite, and Rena could hardly control herself. Before she knew it, she was scraping the last bit of pudding out of a bowl and licking her lips.

"Well I'll be damned," Lynn said. "Ya actually ate all o' it. I'll put your room key on the table."

Rena barely registered Lynn's words, as she was trying not to pass out from the pain. The leftovers had been enough food to stuff ten humans, and Rena had eaten it all. Kath physiology was near identical to a human's on the inside, with the exception of the stomach. The stomach started out at the same size as a human's, but could stretch much further. No one knows why this is, but the most accepted theory is that that trait is a holdover from when Kath were much less humanoid.

Scientific babble aside, Rena cast a pain numbing spell, grabbed her keys, and tried to stand up. She nearly overbalanced and fell of her massive stomach, she managed to catch herself.

Speaking of her stomach, it managed to be large enough that gravity noticeably affected it. The mass of food and a tiny bit of fat was dragged down to mid-thigh, and a diagnostic spell told her that she weighed twenty-two pounds more than when she'd started eating. Rena groaned and lumbered her way to her room.

§.........§

Rena woke up and cast another diagnostic spell on herself. The meal had been entirely digested, and she now weighed eight pounds more than she had yesterday. Immediately after she cast the spell, she felt woozy. Rena cursed. Magic Deprivation.

Magic Deprivation was caused by a sorceress' magic running dangerously low. How long it took to recover your magic depended on how much magical power you had. If all you could do was simple party tricks, a few hours was all it took to fully recharge. But someone as powerful as Rena took months to recharge. And until you were fully recharged, you couldn't use magic.

So what does Rena do? Travel to find the second Malabestia, and hope her sword skills are up to snuff? Or stay in the village and get fat?
1231321.title: Stuffed!

124.content:
"Huh," Rena said. "This is new."

Rena reached up to the tree and pulled off a leaf. It was slightly sticky to the touch, and had a minty smell to it. Tentatively, she licked the leaf. Minty. Shrugging, Rena popped the leaf into her mouth. Instantly, the catgirl's emerald green eyes widened, her tiger stripe fur standing on edge. Holy crap, that was sweet! She spat the leaf out, wiping her tongue to rid her mouth of the overly sweet taste.

"Alright, Rena, take little bites this time," Rena said, reaching up to pick another leaf. She absent-mindedly nibbled on the leaf while she inspected the tree's bark. The minty smell of the leaf overpowered everything else, so she just peeled off a small piece of bark and popped it into her mouth. Rena moaned. Chocolate, and the highest quality Rena had ever tasted. She discarded the half-eaten leaf and attacked the tree. Rena ripped off huge chunks of bark and practically inhaled them.

You see, Rena had quite the sweet tooth. She never could resist candy, especially chocolate. It was her sweet tooth that had led to many weight-related problems in her youth. In seventh grade, at her heaviest, she weighed over 500 pounds. One visit to the doctor later, and Rena was told that if she continued to gain weight like she had been, she would die before she turned 30. By the time her senior year of high school rolled around, she had gone from morbidly obese to almost underweight. However, she never truly lost her sweet tooth.

With a creaking groan, the tree Rena had been eating fell over. Not wasting a beat, Rena picked up the surprisingly weightless fallen tree and shook all of the leaves off, before inhaling the remaining chocolate. She reached for another tree, before realizing that there were no more trees. In her chocolate-induced haze, she had eaten the entire forest, and it showed. Rena sported a chubby face, with cheeks so fat she was forced to squint. Her sixty chins melted into a neck as thick as the trees she'd been devouring. Below that was her previously flat chest. Before she had been like a wall; now her cleavage could be called a valley and not be hyperbole. Each breast extended for miles from her chest, and would have pooled on the ground were it not for her gut.

Her belly covered all of the land Rena could see. Even when she managed to look behind herself, her belly was there, enveloping the globe, drowning it forty miles deep in blubber. While she couldn't see her butt, Rena still knew that it was shelf-like; continental shelf-like, that is. Her massive thunder thighs were bigger than cities, and tapered off into hilariously normal-sized feet. Rena opened her mouth and let out a huge belch, creating a shockwave that destroyed the moon. Chunks of moon fell onto Rena, including one that impacted with her face.

Rena woke up with a gasp. She couldn't quite remember what her dream was, but she remembered it had been a good one before abruptly ending. Rena tried to get back to sleep, but was stopped by a curious sensation in her gut. It was an odd, bloated feeling, and it bugged her to no end. Sighing, she got up to go to the bathroom. She stumbled forward slightly, but chalked that up to being tired. She entered the bathroom and flicked on the lights. It took Rena a minute to realize what she was staring at in her mirror.

"The hell?" Rena asked. "Why am I fat?"

Indeed, Rena was fat. Her previously flat belly had puffed out to form a rather large potbelly that made her shirt ride up to show most of her belly, her breasts had popped out of the top of her shirt somehow and now were as long as her upper arm, and her flannel pants had ripped while trying to contain two globes of ass that hadn't been there before. Curious, Rena stepped onto a set of scales. The dial spun for a second before landing on the number 250.

Rena let out a low whistle. "Whatever just happened, it made me put on 130 pounds!"

After marveling at herself for a little bit, a wave of tiredness washed over Rena. Yawning, she flicked the bathroom light off and flopped down onto her bed. She fell asleep instantly.

A few hours later she was awoken by the beeping of her alarm clock. Groggily, she turned off her alarm clock and stretched her arms above her head, unintentionally diving her nose into her cleavage.

"Huh," Rena noted. "So that actually happened last night. Weird, I thought my clothes were too small..."

Indeed, Rena's clothes had been too small, but not anymore. Her white sleep shirt now hung loosely off her frame, like it had previously, and her pants were just a little too long for her legs once again. An inspection of her closet revealed that the same thing had happened to the rest of her clothes. Intrigued, she picked up a bra, wondering how big she was now.

"36K," she read aloud. "Sweet."

She then briefly panicked, before remembering that it was spring break. Grinning crazily, she rushed downstairs. Time to marathon more online FPS!

At midnight, Rena groggily made her way back into her room. The marathon had been fun, but draining as usual. Not even bothering to shower, Rena stripped down to her underwear and went to sleep.

That night…
124.title: Dream On!

125.content:
Parasite- Rena is infected with an alien parasite that increases her appetite to an astronomical level, to the point of gaining a large amount of weight. But no matter how much she eats, nothing can satisfy the parasite and she only becomes more hungry to the point where she's willing to eat absolutely anything.

Supernatural Sumo Gladiator- Rena is one of several creatures from a mystical dimension that have been captured by crime lords who have dabbled in the black magic market, similar to the Dark Tournament. But there is a twist. All the creatures in the tournament are supernatural creatures like the beasts of myths and every last one is female. Now Rena has to fight for her life as a sumo sized gladiator as she is fattened for the upcoming gladiator matches.

Or Maybe Something Else
125.title: More

choices: The Food Coma Lasts The Entire Night
The Food Coma Wears Off In A Mere Hour Or Two
1251.content:
A young tiger-striped orange and black catgirl stifled a yawn as she stretched in her seat, scratching one of the triangular ears jutting through the sea of long red hair atop her head. She leaned back in her chair, free hand bringing the sheet of paper up to her face to continue reading.

"Sample... store at freezing... Blah blah. Can't he get to the point?" She grumbled to herself, skimming through the rest of the report. It wasn't so bad when it was on paper since then her boss was limited by room, she supposed. The rare emailed report was like an entire biology book by comparison. Sometimes she wished she was interning under some other researcher. Finished skimming, she tossed the report onto the desk carelessly, leaning forward and eyeing the box it had come with curiously. It was one of those cold storage containers, so good at staying cold that it looked chilled on the outside.

Standing up from her chair, she scooped up the container and made her way over to the sample freezer. Delicately pinning the box between a boney hip and one hand, she gave the freezer door a sharp tug with her free hand. No dice. The freezer was practically vacuum sealed shut or something. Trying to get it open was always a huge pain. It didn't help that the door was on the top and opened upwards, making the angle really odd to try and get any sort of leverage on. Another two attempts finally saw her succeed though, and she was met with a blast of chilled air. Shivering slightly despite her lab coat, which was too thin to really keep her warm, she set the box on the lip of the open freezer while keeping the lid propped up with one hand. With her other hand, she undid the latch that kept the box sealed.

Several test tubes nestled securely in a small styrofoam mold greeted her green eyes, filled with bits of rock and soil and a few small nuggets of ore. Prying them from their cozy container, she set them one by one in the slots for test tubes, taking a moment to curiously examine the contents of each one. The tubes were extremely cold however, and her poor furry fingers were starting to ache from holding them a little too long. Technically she was supposed to wear gloves for this sort of thing, but she didn't bother unless it was something actually capable of hurting her. As she hurried to unload all the test tubes from the container, her numb fingers fumbled and one of them tumbled out of her grasp. The tube smacked into the lip of the freezer, the lid popping open from the impact and sending a small handful of lumpy soil into the freezer.

"Ah! Not good!" She cried out in surprise, quickly catching the test tube before it could roll off the lip and ducking into the freezer. Scrambling frantically, she scooped all the soil back into it's test tube as quickly as possible. Teeth chattering from having her head and upper torso in the freezer, she glanced around frantically for the missing cap. Shuffling the contents of the freezer around gently, she found it's hiding place in the corner under the test tube holder. Grabbing it, she frowned as she noticed a bright green sprinkle stuck to the side of it. She contemplated where it could have come from for a moment, shrugging and licking the sprinkle free and returning the cap to it's rightful place on the test tube. It was just some soil samples anyways, so as far as she was concerned the five-second rule still applied and it was only like... Eight seconds, tops.

With the storing of the samples accomplished and catastrophe averted, she began rooting around the obscure corner where she had found the test tube's cap. Her efforts yielded her a frosted-over ice cream sundae, covered in sprinkles. The syrup had hardened like a shell, and there were visible ice crystals jutting from it all over. The ice cream had definitely gone more towards the 'ice' side of things, that was for sure.

"How did this get here?" She murmured to herself out loud, trying to recall. She didn't remember hiding this in here... Oh, that was right! She'd hidden it during the christmas party a month back. They had all kinds of food and stuff, and she decided to hide a sundae there to snack on sometime while working. She'd apparently up and forgot it was there and never got around to eating it. Giving a shrug at the solved mystery, she took the sundae with her as she pulled herself out of the freezer and let the lid slam shut with a loud 'thwump' sound. Still shivering slightly, she made her way back to her desk and set the frozen treat down as she plopped back into her sight, sighing in boredom.

She supposed she could busy herself reading or something. She'd completed all her tasks with storing those samples, all she had to do now wait until she was off the clock. She stared contemplatively at the sundae, giving it a poke with her no longer numb finger. Hard as a rock. There was no way she was going to be able to eat that thing, not without giving it time to thaw at least. Was watching ice melt the equivalent of watching paint dry? It probably was, although in this case at least she got a tasty treat out of it as a reward. Turning her attention to the small stack of books on the side of her desk, she rummaged through them for a moment for something to read.

"Read that one ten times... No... God this one had a dumb ending... Eh, maybe... Ahah, here we go!" Her rummaging ended as she found a book she had only recently purchased, having not actually had a chance to read yet. Leaning back in her chair, resting her feet up on her desk, she settled down to read. Every few pages she would look up from the story to glance at the ever-slowly thawing sundae. After the first chapter, she had started to pry a sprinkle off now and then. By the second chapter her stomach had started to rumble, causing her to glance at the clock mounted on the wall.

"Sheesh, still a half hour..." She gave her flat stomach a pat under her shirt in an attempt to placate it. She was always starving when she got off work because of the no snack rule. Sure she got a lunch break, but they always made her take that early on in the afternoon and she didn't get off until well into the evening. Returning to her book to kill the remaining time, the catgirl assistant soon found herself out of sprinkles. The sundae was still far too frozen to attempt to eat, but the rumbling of her stomach wasn't so easily dissuaded.

After a moment of thought, she propped the book open against her lap, holding the sundae in one hand and turning a page with the other. She'd turn a page, take a lick of the sundae, and repeat. Then it went from turning a whole page between licks to reading half a page. Then a paragraph. Then a sentence. In short order she was taking a lick for every word she read. By the time it was closer for her to leave, between the room temperature slowly thawing it and her constant licking, the sundae had softened considerably. Once she had finished the second chapter, she had started to nibble on it, and by the time the clock hit the hour, the entire top half of the sundae had been whittled away. Her stomach was appeased at first, but it was quickly demanding to actually get some substance into it.

Folding the page to mark her place, she tossed the book back into the pile. Ready to leave and get a proper meal, she contemplated what to do with the rest of the sundae. She couldn't walk out of the room with it, since someone would probably catch her... Best to finish it off, even if it was still a little frozen. Tipping the small plastic container up to her mouth, she used her tongue to pull one side up and out, opening her mouth wide to take a large bite out of the frozen treat. A few tough moments of chewing, her tongue thoroughly numb from the cold, she swallowed the sizable bite of heavenly vanilla and chocolate. The very instant it hit her stomach, her belly rumbled and she found herself taking half the remaining sundae in one large bite. Without pausing, the rest of the sundae was in her mouth and down her throat. Licking the plastic container for every ounce of ice cream that might be left on it, she blinked rapidly in surprise at herself.

Even accounting for how hungry she usually was by now, she didn't usually go at her food like that. A little embarrassed and glad nobody was around, she tossed the container into a waste basket and shuffled out of her lab coat. Hanging it up on the rack, she quickly left the room and made her way out of the building. The sundae had quieted her stomach, but she still felt hungry enough to be in a hurry. Giving a quick wave good bye to the secretary and the security staff she passed on her way out, she made her way to the parking lot and into her car. It was a short drive home, but her stomach had started rumbling halfway there and she found herself compelled to get something on the way instead.

A short stop at a drive through found her ordering a large burger with fries, and that sundae earlier put her in the mood for a large shake as well. The burger was devoured in a mere three bites, driving with one hand as she ate, and the fries just barely lasted her to her neighborhood. The last fry went past her hungry lips as she pulled into her driveway. The milkshake, already half gone during the drive, was finished off by the time she opened her front door. Her stomach full and strained from eating so much so rapidly, the young tiger-patterned catgirl shuffled her shoes off and stumbled over to her couch, flopping onto it with an 'oof' and quickly drifting off to sleep. The sound of soft snoring quickly filled the room, accompanied by a gurgling sound from the young intern's bloated stomach. Despite having been packed with food mere minutes ago, her tight stomach was visibly returning to it's normal flat shape at an impossible speed.

Unawares of any strangeness, the feline young woman shifted in her sleep as the pressure in her git vanished and allowed a more comfortable position.
1251.title: Five-Second Rule

choices: Rena continues to eat, trying to sate her hunger.
Rena stops eating to try to figure out what's going on.
12511.content:
Rena woke up at six in the morning. Groaning, she sat up trying to massage the kink out of her neck.

"Urgh, what happened last night?" She asked herself, her head still foggy from sleep. Soon, that fog cleared up. "Oh, right. Hope I didn't put on too much weight from that."

She poked her stomach, and was pleasantly surprized to find out that no, she hadn't put on any weight, or at least none she could feel.

"Ah, I shouldn't've been worried," Rena said, patting her stomach. "My metabolism's amazing. I wouldn't put on any weight from ju-"

Rena's eyes went wide as she cut herself off. Nausea bubbled up in her throat as she made a mad dash for the bathroom. She barely managed to make it to the toliet and flip it open before Rena's stomach heaved, a small amount of vomit passing between her lips. She dry heaved a few times, then collapsed to the tiled floor.

"...shit," she muttered to herself. "This is from that soil sample, isn't it?"

Her stomach seemed to growl in the affirmative. Rena sighed and pulled herself to her feet. The smell of vomit in her fur was bugging her, so she splashed her face with water and began to scrub. Multiple times while Rena was washing her face, she felt hunger pangs so strong she nearly collapsed again. As fast as she could, Rena dried off her face and washed the acrid taste out of her mouth. Once that was done, her mind was consumed by one thought and one thought only: FOOD!

Rena stumbled out of her bathroom before loping over to her fridge. She tore the door open and grabbed the first thing she saw, a chocolate cake so big it took up an entire shelf in her fridge. There was some story as to why Rena had such a huge cake in her refrigerator, but she was too hungry to remember it. Rena slid the cake out of the fridge and into her arms so she could carry it to the table. Due to a combination of how weak she felt and how heavy the cake was Rena almost fell over. A quick step back with her back foot was all that prevented the monster cake from falling onto the floor.

The disaster of sugary proportions averted, Rena made her way over to her breakfast table, going red in the face from the strain. The damn thing must've weighed fifty pounds! The catgirl set the cake down on the table with a heavy thunk before grabbing a chunk of cake as big as her head and biting into it. Rena moaned through the first bite. Maybe it was the fact that she felt like she hadn't eaten in a week, but the chocolate cake tasted like heaven to Rena. Her appetite seemed to double as Rena tore into the cake with her bare hands, before just taking huge bites directly out of the cake.

The effects of Rena's binging were primarily shown in two places on her body. The first was the area around her mouth, as more and more chocolate got stuck in the fur there. The second area affected, and probably the more noticable of the two, was her belly. Barely a tenth of the way through the cake, and Rena's belly was already nearing the size and shape of a bowling ball, unrestricted due to the button on her jeans popping off solme time ago. When said event happened, Rena briefly stopped eating to wonder where the button went, before shrugging and going back to eating.

Eventually, Rena ran out of cake, which she realized when her claws scraped against the serving dish the cake was on. Almost as an acknowledgement of that fact, the catgirl let out an earsplitting belch, complete with cake crumbs flying out of her open mouth. Sated, Rena faded out of her feeding frenzy to assess the damage.

First, her jeans were completely ruined, the sheer volume of food Rena packed into her stomach ripping the waist beyond repair. Her shirt wasn't much better, the white cotton stretched and ripped near the bottom, and stained by chocolate near the top. All of this damage was done by her gargantuan stomach.

Rena knew how tall she was and how much she weighed. She was 5'4" and weighed, or rather, had weighed, 130 pounds. Looking at her stomach, Rena guessed that it stuck out somewhere near five feet. Strangely, Rena felt no pain from it. In fact, she still felt a bit hungry.
12511.title: Ravenous Rena

choices: It's her phone. Dr. Gast wants to know where she's been!
It's her belly. Rena's mysterious hunger has returned!
125111.content:
"There's got to be some kind of limit to my hunger," Rena mused. In thought, Rena's eyes flicked up to the clock, before going wide at the time.

"What? It's only seven?" Rena asked. She made to get up to look at the clock, but was weighed down by her heavy belly. Sighing to herself, Rena wrapped her arms under her belly and waddled over to the clock to get a better look at it. Sure enough, only an hour had passed since the catgirl had woken up.

"Wow," Rena breathed. "Whatever caused that weird amount of hunger aside, that's impressive. I wonder how much I actually ate?"

Shifting slightly to a more stable stance, Rena waddled to her bathroom, as she had a set of scales there. Even with her giant belly, Rena was able to pass through the door without touching either side, although just barely. It was a bit akward getting onto the scales so Rena could see her weight, but she managed. The scale churned slightly before spitting out a three digit number- 180.

"Fifty pounds in an hour," Rena noted. "That's... way more than should be possible."

Rena set her belly down on the bathroom skin so her could bring her hand up to her mouth in thought.

"I wonder if there's any limit to my stomach's capacity, considering I don't even feel full at the moment," Rena mused, her stomach growling as if on cue. A flash of inspiration coming to her, Rena pulled her phone out of her ruined pants pocket, dialing a somewhat familiar number. The phone ringed exactly once before the person on the other end picked up.

"Ah, good morning Rena!" A middle-aged male voice answered from the other end. "How are you doing this fine day?"

"I'm doing fine, Doctor Gast," Rena answered, leaving her unnatural hunger problem out. "I was actually going to do some research on a personal project of mine, and-"

"And you wish to use some of the lab's funds for your research?" Gast finished.

Rena nodded, although Gast couldn't see. "That's right, sir."

Gast made a thoughtful sound. Rena could picture in her mind what the scientist she was interning under was doing- running a hand through his black and gray hair. Dr. Vincent Gast was the world's most famous biologist. There was literally no one in the entire scientific community who didn't know who Dr. Gast was. And the best part was, none of his reputation rode off of other's successes. The only potential black mark on his records was a some arbitrary number of greats uncle of his that lived almost four hundred years ago, who was... not the most moral of people.

"Very well," Gast eventually said. "You have access to two percent of the lab's funds to use as you see fit."

Rena felt her heart skip a beat. Two percent of the lab's funds was enough to run an entire army with state-of-the-art gear comfortably for five years.

"Th-thank you, sir," Rena stammered out before hanging up. With shaking fingers, Rena dialed up the number of a nearby delivery place.

"I wonder how much I can eat?" Rena muttered to herself while her phone rang.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------

The answer to Rena's question was, predictably, a lot. Pizzas, sub sandwiches, Chinese, and many other kinds of food passed through Rena's lips and into her ever expanding stomach. Eventually, however, Rena started to feel full. However, she was determined to find the full capacity of her stomach. So, some time later, Rena finally found her capacity, her stomach throbbing in agony as one final noodle was sucked down her throat.

Through the haze of pain, Rena looked at the time. It was five in the morning, and according to the digitized calendar next to the time, Rena had started eating almost two days ago, and her belly really showed it. Rena sat on one side of her house, but she could feel the other side with her belly. It was so heavy that Rena couldn't move it. Somehow, however, Rena had gotten her scale to give her what she assumed was an accurate reading- 2480 pounds.

As muddied by pain as her thoughts were, Rena couldn't help but marvel at how much she weighed, almost two and a quarter tons! Rena quickly scribbled her weight on a nearby piece of paper before passing out from exhaustion and pain.

As Rena slept, her stomach gurgled, digesting the food inside rapidly as it shrunk down to a fraction of its size, distributing fat all over the catgirl's body.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------

Rena woke up and stretched, yawning as she did.

"That's weird... my arms feel really heavy," Rena said, her eyes still closed. When she opened them, she shrieked in surprised.

"I'm... I'm fat!" Rena shouted. "Fat" was a bit of an understatement, however. Rena's formerly slim frame was now extremely obese. Each of her breasts were somewhere around the size of her head, and her butt was about four times larger than her boobs. The "piece de resistence," however, was her belly, a massive gelatinous blob that threatened to overtake Rena's knees while she sat down.

Rena struggled to stand, her body unused to so much weight. The obese catgirl did eventually stand, and waddled over to her scales. When Rena had settled in a position in which she could see the scale's readout, she looked down and blanched. An even 600 on the display stared back up at her.

"So, if I remember correctly, I had eaten 2,350 pounds of food," Rena said. "If I now weigh 600 pounds, that means I gained 470 pounds overnight. So, unless something changes, I gain one fifth of whatever I eat in weight, apparently only while I sleep."

Suddenly, a loud sound distracted Rena.
125111.title: The Experiment

1252.content:
Rena was panting and sweating heavily as she was waking up. She then begun to cough and groan. "Oh," she moaned. "I feel terrible. What did I do last night? Why am I so hot?" Rena tried to get up, but stopped mid way to catch her breath before finally standing up. But for some reason she had trouble maintaining her footing. "Huh?" she asks. The cat girl noticed that her room is dark and then blinked her eyes to activate her night vision. She then spotted a mirror and gasped as she looks into it.

There she saw her orange and black striped fur and red hair. She was a cat sith, or rather a neko from the land of Enigma, a plain where the creatures of myth and legends live. But she distinctly remembered being scrawny and flat chested. But for some reason that was no longer the case. Rena saw that she was taller than she once was, her guess was that she was now 8ft tall, but that wasn't the only thing that changed about her. She had for some reason become totally fat. Her stomach had to be five feet wide with H-cup breasts and a monster sized butt, each cheek was twice as big as a watermelon. Rena looked down and saw that she was wearing nothing but a white bra and a sumo thong that looked as if it was painted on.

"What?" she asked. "What's happened to me? I'm fat!" Suddenly she heard a banging noise and realized that she's not alone. There was a window on the side of her wall with a view of the next room. "Keep it down in there!" yelled a voice coming from the next room." Rena waddled up to the window as her fat shook and then looked through it to see another monster girl was in the very next cell.

The woman was a large ogopogo girl, a sea serpent resembling a giant eel with several hunches on her back. She was bright pink with purple spots and had a dragon like face with bright blue eyes. The ogopogo woman even had spikes jjutting down her back and purple hair. The ogopogo was just as fat as Rena but seemed taller. She was wearing nothing but a purple loincloth and a seashell bra. "An ogopogo?" asked Rena. "Out here?"

The ogopogo girl walked up to the window and let out a yawn, showing her large white teeth. "The name's River," she said. "And you must be new here. I take it you were a twig just yesterday." Rena nodded her head and pushed her hands against her fattened cheeks (her face, not her ass) before she answered. "What happened to me. Just last night I was cutting wood in the forest. I mean, it's not as if there are any other monsters around. Wish I had a boyfriend. But then I got home and saw a basket filled with blue apples. I found a note that said they were sent from a secret admirer. I love apples and I thought somebody finally loved me and so I ate them all and then everything went black."

River let out a sigh and shook her head. "I'm afraid you fell for a trap. Those blue apples were laced with sleeping medicine and a filled with a potion that balloons monsters up like Thanksgiving blimps." Rena felt her stomach again and saw several rolls. "Who would do such an awful thing?" she asked. "The White Apple Club," said River. "They're a human crime group that abducts monster girls, fattens them and has them fight in sumo matches. I hear that you're going to be next to fight today. Be careful, you could be up against any amazon."

River walked up to her bed in the corner to lay down and then Rena was more scared than ever. But before she could do anything, she heard her door open up and saw men in mechanical armor carrying taser staffs. "Come on kitty. The crowd's waiting. The five men walk forward and surround Rena. Rena could probably take them at her much bigger size, but unfortunately they were armed and she went with them.

The armored men took Rena to an arena that looked like some kind of coliseum. As Rena walked out, she saw that in the stands there were tables like there would be in a fancy restaurant. All the guests were wearing masks and dressed in either tuxedoes or cocktail dresses as they awaited the fight.

Rena looked up to see a figure in a hoverchair. The figure looked like a girl with long golden red hair and a white jack o'lantern mask. She was wearing a gold colored dress as she held up a microphone. "Ladies and gentlemen!" she yelled. "Today the White Apple Club has a new kitten in the ring. Meet Rena, the cat sith. Weighing at 600lbs, she's still a little green, but don't worry. One of our veteran girls will break her in and show her how things work around here soon enough. Let the games begin!"

Rena gulped as she saw the opposite side of the arena open up. She heard stomping and realized there was a monster girl bigger than her that was coming out. Her opponent was a large sumo...
1252.title: Supernatural Sumo

12521.content:
Rena looked in pure horror because the monster that stepped out was another obese monster but even bigger than she was. This was a goldish furred cerberus covered in scares. She had six glowing red eyes and her fangs dripped with drool as she stared down her opponent. All she was wearing was a chainmail bra and sumo thong. The cerberus woman held all three heads in the air as they let out a roar and turned their attention to Rena. Rena stepped back out of fear, but then an electric barrier appeared right behind her and made her scream and jump back.

Rena looked back and rubbed her oversized rear where the electric fence zapped her before the announcer was about to introduce the cerberus girl. "In this corner stands Rena's first of hopefully many opponents. Weighing in at 900lbs and three heads of razor sharp teeth, here comes Trianna." Trianna stomped up towards Rena and growled as they both bowed. "Get it over with!" yelled one of the patrons. "Let's see some bloodshed!"

The announcer flew down in her hover chair and whispered into Rena's ear. "Alright pussycat. Listen here. I've got customers who've paid millions to see you sumo beasts duke it out, so you better keep it interesting. You don't get out until either you beat 100 gladiators, or until you can't fight anymore. Now let the mangling begin."

The announcer left the ring and gestured for her cronies to ring a gong. The fight started and Trianna ran at Rena hammering her with her large fat belly and pushing her back. Rena meowed in pain as the electric ring burned her large butt again. She then growled as Trianna came at her and was forced to push against the cerberus's massive breasts while using her own enlarged belly to drive Trianna towards the electric ring herself.

But Trianna's center head growled and her heads at the sides bite Rena in her breasts and made her scream as Rena was forced to let go. Trianna then punched Rena in one of her blubbery cheeks as the crowd cheered. "No fair!" yelled Rena. "This is sumo! You can't use your hands in sumo!"

But Trianna growled and foamed at all three mouths before slobbering on the fat neko girl. Trianna then slapped Rena at the sides of her face with her fat breasts before wailing on her some more.

She felt a little woozy and then she turned and saw more men shooting her with tranquilizer darts. "Oh no." She said. With that, Rena fell down and collapsed to the ground.

It wasn't long before she was brought back to her cell and was eating several large tunas. For some reason she was so hungry. She felt like she was getting bigger, especially in the hips. She was so starved she was even eating the bones. "What could've gotten into me?" she asked. "I can't be this hungry. I'm a giant fat neko. I can't be..." That's when some handlers tossed in more fish and the giant neko girl pounced on it. She was snarfing up every bit that came her way. As Rena was snarfing she heard grunting. She turned to her side to see that River, the ogopogo girl had been brought back to her cell.

"River!" yelled Rena. River held onto her arm and was rubbing it in pain. "So newbie," said River. "How was your first fight in the big ring?" "Well," says Rena as she wipes a chunk of fish off of her face. "I went up against a large cerberus girl even bigger than me. It's a wonder I survived. Let alone one." River let out a chuckle but held her shoulder. "I wish I could be so lucky. I went up against a big werebear girl who nearly tore my arm off."

"But this is sumo." Said Rena. However, River let out a scoff. "Wake up kitty cat," she says. "There's no fair play in this game. This is the White Apple Club, the underground ring." Rena handed a fish through the bars to River but River is hesitant. "Come on River," said Rena. "Eat up. Surely I don't need this fish."

"You're dreaming," said River. "That fish is laced with chemicals made to induce appetite. That's how you got so fat. You're getting larger right now." Rena looked down and saw that she was indeed getting bigger and gave a look of pure fear. "We have got to get out of here," she said. "Who knows how big we'll get now."

At that very moment, the wicked host of the White Apple tournament was counting the money made from the fight and smiled to herself. "That new cat girl really paid off," she said. "Nobody expected her to win. Now if I can build up that girl and win her the favor of the audience, it will pay off big when she comes crashing down.

The host then pressed a button and revealed a pit trap with a snarling creature inside. It was too dark to see what kind of monster the creature was and it would appear that it was ten times bigger than Rena and appeared to be quite ferocious. The host lowered what appeared to be a large cow into the pit as the creature mooed loudly. The beast growled as the cow frantically tried to escape and was lowered into the pit.

The monster quickly devoured the cow as the host looked down and smiled as she took off her mask and rubbed her brow. âSoon my champion,â she said. âSoon, youâll be facing a rival worthy of your abilities. The monster let out a growl and spat out the cowâs skull. âLook out Rena,â said the host. âThe White Apple club has plans for you.â The monster in the pit reached out and then tried to snatch away the host of the club, but the host closes the pit quick and begins to inhale and exhale. âOkay,â she said to herself. âI gotta remember to be careful around her. But not as careful as Rena.

 The next day, Rena looked and saw that she had indeed gotten bigger. Now she was 12 feet tall and from the looks of it, she weighed a ton. Rena sighs and taps her oversized stomach to realize that what River said about the tainted food was all too true.

River had gotten larger as well and was actually larger than Rena. âWhat did I tell you kitty?â she asked. âThis is our fate as monsters in this tournaments. Weâre going to be stuck in this sadistic game until we die in the field.â Thatâs when Riverâs cage is opened and the guards chained her up to take her off to her fight. âYouâre coming with us ogopogo girl.â River let out a sigh. âWell,â she said. âHere we go. Hope I see you later Rena.â After River is taken away, Rena shuffles her bloated body up to a window on the top of the wall to her cage. She could see the arena and saw the Host ready to call the next fight.

"Alright everyone," she said. "Time for the first fight of the day. In the red corner, we have a veteran monster of the White Apple club's most grizzly division, the ogopogo, River." River waddled forward as the crowd cheers and she panted as she lowered her head. Her massive weight was getting to her and Rena could see it. "And now," said the host with an evil smile. "Her challenger." Rena heard a loud roar and then saw River's opponent coming forward. The monster was an intimidating sight. She appeared to be a seventeen foot tall minotaur that had to weight at least 5 tons. The minotaur had teal fur with green spots and an udder bigger than her head with a monstrous belly and rear. Rena looked in pure fear at the minotaur as the minotaur giantess looked down at River and huffed.

"That's right," said the host. "River's opponent will be the unbeatable Wow Cow, the biggest, meanest minotaur in the entire club. Will the ogopogo bring home the beef or is sea food on the menu tonight." Rena was in pure fear as she looked to see the fight beginning and both opponents charging at each other.

1253.title: More to choose

choices: 170 pounds (gain of 100 pounds, end goal of 1070 pounds)
700 pounds (gain of 630 pounds, end goal of 6370 pounds)
12532.content:
Rena shivered, hugging her thin blanket as close as she could to her diminutive form. Weak from hunger, Rena stumbled under the bridge that would be her home for the next few days. With a herculean effort, Rena dragged herself into a comfortable position under the bridge.

Rena hadn't always been in this situation. In fact, it was a fairly recent thing. Four months ago, Rena had been a member of the mafia, and a rather successful and wealthy member at that. In fact, she was so successful, that the boss, a husky by the name of Antonio, told the other members of the mafia to, ahem, "deal with" her. One bumpy car ride and a bullet in each shin later, and Rena was no longer a problem. A little more meddling on the mafia's part, and Rena Westfall was declared legally dead on October 5th.

Unfortunately, it seemed like Rena would actually be dead in a few days if she wasn't miraculously saved somehow. The bullet wounds in her legs had gotten infected with something nasty, and Rena could almost feel her body shutting down. She supposed that it was the middle of February didn't help either.

As Rena curled up to go to sleep, possibly for the last time, she spotted something near her head. It looked like some kind of stone tablet with weird symbols on it. Rena didn't know what compelled her, but she tried to dig up the tablet. It took a long time, but as the sun's last rays touched the earth, she managed to pulled the tablet out of the hole she dug.

"The hell are you?" Rena asked quietly. She rubbed her hand across the lower half of the tablet to wipe the dirt off. As she did so, the symbols on the tablet flashed briefly. Intrigued, Rena slid her hand across the tablet again, slower this time. As her hand passed over the center, the symbols lit up again. Curious, Rena placed her hand of the center of the tablet, lighting up the symbols once more. After a few seconds, a voice spoke in Rena's mind.

"Thank you, Rena Westfall, for awakening me from my slumber," the voice boomed.

"The hell? How do you know my name?" Rena asked the voice.

"I know your name for I am Epsilon, the god of exchange," the voice answered. "I know of anything that has been exchanged between two mortals."

"A god of exchange, huh?" Rena said. "Say, could you use your godly powers to get me out of this mess?"

"I can," Epsilon said. "However, you must give me something in return."

"The hell? Why?" Rena asked. "I've been living like shit for the past four months! Can't you exchange that for a better life?"

"I cannot reverse an exchange by making its opposite," Epsilon said. "Someone has already wished this upon you."

Rena growled. "Who? I'll fuck 'em up."

"I also cannot reveal the creators of past exchanges," Epsilon said hurriedly. "I can give you a better life, but you must exchange something you hold dearly if you wish to do so."

Rena thought to herself. What did she have left that she held dearly? She didn't really care about her blanket or her clothing. She didn't have any jewelry. The only thing she did hold in high value was...

"I offer my looks," Rena said. "I've always been highly attached to my looks. They're the only thing I hold dearly."

"Very well," Epsilon said. "The exchange has been made. When you wake tomorrow, you will have a better life, but you will gradually lose what you consider to be your beauty over a course of nine months. When you wake, you will have lost ten percent of your beauty. Farewell."

The symbols on the tablet stopped glowing, and the tablet faded away. Rena laid down on her side and closed her eyes on the last day of her old life.

§.........§

Rena woke up in a large white bed. Blearily, she rubbed her eyes and swung her legs over the edge of the bed.

"Mmf... I think that deal worked," Rena noted. Lethargically, Rena stood up, and had to steady herself slightly.

"Weird," Rena noted. "I'm off balance."

Rena fumbled her way into her bathroom. Rena stepped onto her scale and rubbed the sleep out of her eyes. When she saw the number on the display, she gasped.

"What the hell? I can't weigh that much!"

How much does Rena weigh?
12532.title: Everything Has a Price
