Secret Sauce

Story: Rena is selected to participate in a scientific study with a new form of nutritional supplement. Little does she know that it has had some bite to it as well.
12533.title: Secret Sauce

choices: "I thought it might be kind of fun"
125331.content:
(Credit goes to Thiel-kun for this revived chapter)

Walking into the cold, sterile building, Rena couldn't help but shiver as she looked around at the stark white walls and ceiling. The place had an almost "NERV-ish" vibe to it, she thought, connecting the building to one of the latest anime she had seen. She almost expected a blue-haired girl with nearly blank eyes to pop out, but that was ridiculous.

"It's just a testing session for a new nutritional supplement! It's not like I'm signing up for military duty!" she laughed, walking through the halls as she noted the door numbers. Stopping at number 777, she snickered. "More like casino duty. Who sets up shop in a room whose number is a gaming standard?"

Walking in, she looked around, noting there was no one else inside. As her line of sight swept to a table, a voice popped up near her ear, asking "May I help you?"

Turning around in shock, Rena came face to face with a blue-haired young man with a kind smile, dressed plainly in a white chef's tunic and neatly pressed blue slacks. His red eyes contrasted with his hair wildly, but still felt kind. He was wiry, with glasses and a gangly body, but he carried himself well. Topping off his appearance were a pair of dog ears poking out of his head.

"Umm...oh...yeah! I'm here for the supplement testing." Rena replied, smiling and letting the young man in. "Is this the right room?"

"Of course it is! I'm Thiel. Thiel Fenrir. Unfortunately the other applicants all pulled out, so you'll be the only person tasting my dishes today, Miss...?"

"Ah, Westfall! Rena Westfall. It's nice to meet you, Mister Thiel." Rena said, walking into the room as Thiel flipped on the lights. "So...the dog ears...you're a Dog-man?"

"No. Werewolf. I just trained myself to be like this all the time. I think it's a bit cool, don't you?" he asked, chuckling and making his way behind the kitchenette in the middle of the room.

"Yeah! You look just like Inuyasha. Rena laughed, sitting down in front of the small kitchen while watching attentively.

"I've heard that alot. I don't think I look quite as good as him, though! I'd need to dye my hair white, get a red robe...too much hassle." Thiel answered, already busy cooking. "So, why'd you sign up for this testing?
125331.title: The Only Panelist

1253312.content:
(Credit goes to Thiel-kun, the original writer of this revived chapter)

"Well, I just wanted to do something to help out. Besides, I heard a gourmet chef would be cooking, and I really wanted to try some great food." Rena said, smiling and watching Thiel cook away, a nice sized piece of fish sizzling away in a naked pan with a light coating of lemon zest and fresh ground white pepper. The light smells made her tail whip about and a barely audible purr escape her throat.

"You flatter me. I'm not quite gourmet, but I've got a few years of culinary school under my belt and I studied under two separate renowned chefs. I hear they've been working at a hotel recently." He replied, deftly slicing a green onion before adding it to the fish and wafting the scent towards his nostrils. Nodding in a satisfied fashion, he pulled out a tray of small, crispy bread slices from a small oven beneath the kitchenette and slid it towards Rena. "Want one?"

Taking one, Rena took a small bite, her eyes lighting up in bliss from the nibble. "Wow...what is this?" she asked, finishing off the first one and nibbling on a second.

"Toasted bread with a sugar and lemon glaze. I always find crispy bread to be a good start to a good meal." Thiel replied, flipping the fish with a swift motion before pouring a glass of white wine for Rena, scooting the glass over to her and smiling. "Just a heads up: The wine was bottled here and the supplement is inside. I just wanted you to know to avert any little questions about where it was."

Nodding, Rena took a sip of the wine, watching Thiel scoot the fish onto a nearby plate and begin to deglaze the pan with another white wine, reducing it down to a pale sauce. Pouring it onto the fish, he smiled. "One slice of Pollock with white sauce for the young lady." Thiel said, smiling and taking his hat off, sweeping into a bow. "I hope you enjoy."

Starting on the light meal, Rena's eyes truly lit up as she ate. Easily the most delectable fish she had eaten, she still took her time out of respect. Before long, the fish was gone, the toast was eaten as a small dessert, and the glass of wine had been drank.

===============================

(I'm going to take a page from the two much more admirable writers that work on most of the other arcs in this story and give the two choices ahead of time with a bit of what I hope to see and how I think it should go as a bit of advice.

1. The supplement functions as a metabolizer, causing a larger portion of the food to be stored as fat, which means the project was funded by the military for people stationed up north. Rena is told that since she is the only person who signed up, she will have to stay at the facility for further testing. Of course, this also means more gourmet meals.

2. Nothing happens, apart from a slightly upset stomach from more upscale food than Rena is used to, and she returns home. The supplement is still there, though, and could possible cause something...odd to happen.)
1253312.title: A nice light meal with a glass of wine.

12533121.content:
( Again, credit goes to Thiel-kun)

Rena sat back, purring contentedly as Thiel cleaned up the pans and utensils and scrubbed the counter, a bit of the sauce having crusted onto it from proximity to the range's flame.

"That was amazing!" Rena gushed, grinning from ear to ear and nibbling on a roll. "Easily the best food I've ever had!"

Smiling meekly, Thiel tossed the damp sponge into a nearby garbage can, a tint of blush on his face. "You really do flatter me, Miss Westfall! I'm nowhere the skill level you say..." he replied, setting the pans in the storage space beneath the kitchenette and pouring himself a glass of brandy.

Sitting up, Rena opened her mouth to reply only to have a cute little half second burp escape her lips, causing her to blush. Covering her mouth, she giggled. "Pardon! But anyways, I think you're not giving yourself enough credit. That fish was so flaky and moist...and the sauce was just right...the toast was divine..." Rena fawned before her eyes misted over with the memory of the delectable fish.

Thiel simply laughed and drained his glass in one swig. Setting it back down, his eyebrows arched up in a curious glance. "Umm...Rena? You don't feel...bloated in any way, do you?" he asked, looking at her now ever so slightly cushy midsection.

"No...why?" Rena answered, looking down only to notice her slight paunch. "Eh?! What is this?"

"It's a complete success!" a third voice stated, before the door opened and a stern faced, clean-cut military man clomped in. "It looks like the Winter Survival Supplement is a resounding success. On behalf of your country, I, General Mid, thank you."

"Winter Survival Supplement?" Rena echoed, clearly confused. "But I read it was going to be commercially available ? What is all this?"

"Yeah...I only signed on because I thought this was going to help people." Thiel said, walking around to the front of the kitchenette and taking off his jacket.

"It will be commercially available...to any country that can pay for it," General Mid said, smirking. "And the price is going to be astronomical. Just think of the potential of a food additive that can instantly metabolize a layer of fat, giving the consumer a more insulated body for the Arctic. Or imagine a supply of food laced with this for one of our own spies placed in a freezing country! Other nations will TRIP over each other in order to get a piece of the pie!"

"That's what this is for? Greed and espionage?" Rena cried in disbelief, a hand on her pudgy midsection.

"Miss Westfall...making it sound like that is so crude. I like to think of it as...good wartime business." Mid replied, his eyes showing his insincerity. "Now then...on to business. Miss Westfall, as the only one who signed on to this project, you will be held here for further testing. Any personal effects you wish for can be secured and brought here. My guess is that the full testing cycle will take about four months. You will not be returned to your former shape, and if you refuse you will be confined as a threat to security and forced to undergo the testing. We hope it will not come to that, but if necessary we will travel down that path."

Rena's mouth fell open in disbelief, her whole body numb. Thiel spoke up, though, asking, "What if I offered to prepare Rena's meals? Would that be acceptable? I can't stand the thought of this girl being fed rations when she's already being practically forced to take all of this. I would ask for no compensation, apart from accommodations here in order to supervise Miss Westfall myself."

General Mid nodded, his face unreadable. "Of course. Better a chef preparing her meals than having to waste our own on her." he replied, the smirk back in place.

Rena shook her head, her eyes wide. "Wait...this isn't fair! You lured me into this!" she cried, tears in her eyes. "I can't just drop my life!"

"It's already been done. All your connections to the world have been severed, and your house is ready to be sold. After the testing, you will receive the funds from the sale, and you will be given an apartment that will be paid for by the military."

Rena slumped back in disbelief, shaking her head.

==================================

1. Rena accepts, and it turns out her stay may be pleasant, as she has access to anything she would want, including any entertainment she desires.

2. Same as the first, except it turns out that her room will only be allowed what she wants from home, though a large bed is already in place.
12533121.title: "I WHAT?"

choices: Maybe a nap first...then dinner and a movie.
125331211.content:
( Credit for this revived chapter goes to Thiel-Kun. I'm just doing what Anonymous One asked me to do)

After a few minutes of silence, Rena slowly nodded her head, her eyes coming back into focus.

"Fine...just...can we keep the scientists to a minimum? I know I'm just a test subject, but I don't want to have to wake up every day and know right away I am." she said, sitting up properly.

"Of course. I may be firm, but I would never invade a lady's privacy." General Mid replied, standing aside and motioning towards the door. "Now, if you'll follow me, I'll lead you to your quarters. Maybe your personal chef can whip something clean up for you."

Nodding, Rena stood and followed the General, Thiel following close behind as the three made their way deeper into the complex. Coming to an elevator, Mid bent down and performed a retinal scan, followed by a voice confirmation password, confirming his identity and allowing the three onto the elevator. Sinking down a half dozen floors, the trio walked out, Rena looking around in awe.

"Wow...this is incredible!" she said, keeping in step as she took in the polished steel walls and various labs around them.

"I agree...it's going to be eerie staying here, though." Thiel chimed in, shivering at the cold sterile appearance of the floor. "And for months..."

Rena looked back at him, stunned. "Wait...you're going to be staying too?" she asked as General Mid turned.

"Indeed...I wonder where you got the idea that you'd be allowed to stay."

"Well, you don't want your secrets getting out, do you?" Thiel said slyly, his mouth curling into a grin. "I might just spill a few if I'm not allowed to keep an eye out to see if Rena is being properly taken care of."

Scowling, Mid turned back and resumed walking while Rena smiled gratefully. "Thanks...I'd have gone crazy if all I had to talk to were scientists and military men."

"Don't mention it, Rena." Thiel assured, walking alongside Rena now. "It's the least I can do for someone who likes my cooking so much."

Stopping outside a door, General Mid ushered Rena and Thiel in, following quickly and chuckling at their amazement.

The room was enormous, easily taking up two floors on it's own. A large flatscreen TV sat at one end of the room, taking up a space equivalent to a single story from the floor up. A king size bed sat opposite it, along with a few chairs and a sofa. Game consoles lay around the TV, with beanbag chairs nearby. On the wall opposite the trio, a kitchen had been erected, a quartet of refrigerators and a trio of stoves in place.

"This...this...this..." Rena stammered, in awe of the luxury of the room.

"Speechless, eh? We may be soulless, greedy, espionage maniacs, but we know how to treat a subject. Now, go on and get used to things. There's a communicator on the wall, and you can ring up anyone you need." Mid said, turning to go. "Have fun, Miss Westfall and Mister Fenrir."

===================================================

1. Rena's stomach growls, and Thiel gets to work right away, whipping up a meal that Hiroyuki Sakai would be jealous of.

2. Rena figures it would be good to get some shuteye and then take everything in with a refreshed mind. Afterwards, she finds her hunger has been turned up five-fold, and Thiel is called to act.

(Note: I intended for Thiel to speak with someone about walling a section of the room off for him. If someone wants to take an option and branch him into the lab sleeping quarters, that is just as good.)

choices: later in a dark room with lots of food.
12533221.content:
One late summer evening, a young catgirl named Rena lay on her bed in her PJ's, a large storybook in her hands. The title read 'The tale of Herra Swordfang' one of her favourite story books. Smiling, the tiger striped catgirl read the book chapter after chapter, green eyes flipping from left to right as she read the book, despite knowing every verse off by heart, she smiled as she reached her favourite chapter, 'the battle of Ostarigan' where Herra did battle with the evil Demon King Raijoro, and his undead army with her own army of loyal amazonian warriors, the two sides suffering heavy casualties as their leaders went at each other ferociously attacks with enough power to create canyons being displayed by the two mighty warriors.

The battle was so well described that Rena could practically picture herself in it, imagining the fires of battle, the sounds of clanging metal, the screams of the vanquished and the vanquishers, and of course, the battle between the titans of the army, Raijoro and Herra fighting tooth and nail, attacks occasionally missing and hitting the armies instead.

The book told that the battle raged for three whole days, then, as the ashen fog of war finally lifted, the surviving soldiers of both sides awoke to find that their mighty leaders had both vanished, the two most powerful beings in their world, gone without a trace.

"oooh...what i wouldn't give for them to have made another book..." she said, sighing as she put the book on her bedside table, getting up to go to the bathroom, taking out her toothbrush and toothpaste.

"I wanted to know what happened..." she said, brushing her teeth, before yawning and walking back to her bed, getting under the covers and drifting off to sleep, unaware that she was being observed, by someone very familiar.

"Wanted to know what happened eh? well...ask and you shall receive..." the male said, smiling as he stared into a crystal ball, Rena's image held there, his purple, serpentine eyes filled with curiosity and reviere. Smiling, he clicked his fingers.

Rena didn't know it but at that moment Her entire house had been taken to an entirely different dimension, like it had never existed in the human world, the house appearing with her inside it in a strange world, with red grass, a strange purple sky, and a massive temple in the distance.

Rena slept till her alarm clock rang, slowly groaning and getting up, rubbing her eyes and stretching, joints in her back popping as she did, eliciting a gentle purr from the catgirl.

"Good morning..." came a masculine voice from behind the girl, who promptly screamed, turning around to look at the intruder in her room.

Her green eyes widened at the sight of the invader, who sat on a chair by her bed, his long blonde hair covering his face partially, five distinctive bangs over his face, six small horn like spikes of hair on his head, his eyes a deep purple, with reptilian pupils staring at her with a predatory look. The man's gaze was set on her, a calm smile on his face as he sat relaxed before the catgirl, who was starting to get annoyed.

"Hey! what the hell are you doing in my house buddy?!" She asked, eyes narrowed at the strange man, who proceeded to get up, standing a good head taller than her, shocking her with his muscular build and height, the smirk on his face remaining. "Oh nothing really...just admiring the newest toy in my collection...." he said, walking round the bed to her, standing right before the skinny feline with that same sinister smirk, his hand slowly reaching up and caressing her cheek. "....after all...i have to make sure your comfortable...my pet..." he said, grinning toothily, Rena looking confused at him, till she felt something suddenly appear around her neck, making her look down in horror, seeing a bright red leather collar with a license, possessing her name and weight engraved upon it.

"ACK! What thee F'#K!?" she screamed, clutching at the collar and trying to remove it, before she looked back at the man standing before her, chuckling like he found the display amusing. "w-whatever you've done...y-you better stop it or-" she began, only to have the man lean in to her face, smiling. " OR you'll what? call the cops?" he asked, before laughing like a madman, making Rena shiver, and then, run, bolting from her bedroom, much to the man's amusement as he slowly walked after her.

"you can run kitty, but there ain't no hiding from Raiju..." he said, smiling as he followed the girl through her home, watching her make a break for the front door. "heh, boy are you in for a shock kiddo...." he said, as Rena flung the door open, freezing in shock as she saw that she was no longer in her sleepy neighbourhood, but in a foreign place, the red grass beneath her feet, the Purple clouded skies, the massive temple and mountain ranges, and, to Rena's shock,the animals, which were all obscenely fat, elephants wide as houses, tigers and lions waddling around with their bellies dragging the ground, it was ridiculous!

"You like?" came the same frightening voice of her captor, who now stood behind her, leaning against the doorframe. Rena turned to the mysterious man named Raiju. "W-What is this place...?" she hesitated to ask. Raiju smiled, offering the girl a hand. "my world of Abdel" he said, smiling as Rea slowly took his hand, using his magic to take them and the house to a new area, seemingly within the temple Rena had seen, allowing her to realise just how massive it was, easily holding her two story house within it, along with several other buildings that Rena looked at with curiosity.

"O-Okay...your gonna have to do a lot of explaining here...." she said, looking to Raiju, who smirked. "sure thing, however, you gotta do something in return." he said, before he held up a finger. "now, i want you to know that I'm giving you a choice of knowing more...like you wanted...or going home and living with a lack of knowledge for the rest of your mortal life." he explained, making Rena arch a brow.

"...hmm...uh...well..." she began, biting her lip some as she wondered what to do, looking at Raiju, who offered his hand once more. "if you seek more..be prepared for wherever the road leads you...and take my hand..." he said, awaiting her answer stoically.

Rena looked at his hand, slowly reaching out, just about to take the mans hand when a roar was heard, making both look up to one of the buildings in the Temple, a smaller temple, who's doors burst open, Rena gasping as a massive Sabre-Tooth-cat girl emerged, Massive in the sense that Rena thought she had to have weighed at least a ton, her entire frame laden with fat, her legs dainty at their feet, but quickly thickening into massive calves and even more into thighs and hips wider than Rena was tall, a massive round belly dominating the front of the woman's body, looking like it could hold Rena within it five times over, and the Sabre-cat's boobs were absolutely massive, hanging over her belly about half way, each mammary the size of a large boulder, perfectly round and perky, much like the rest of her, there was no flab, or even stretch marks on her body as she waddled towards them in a hurry.

"Stop! don't take his hand!" she yelled, making Rena look at her hand, which she had put in Raiju's from shock of seeing the massive woman, Raiju smiling a bit. "too late Herra...." he said, before quickly vanishing with Rena, making the Sabre-cat girl snarl in frustration.
12533221.title: Fiction, or Fact...?

12533222.content:
Heavy Illness: Rena wakes up one morning to discover that her house has been quarantined from the rest of the neighborhood. She soon learns that the case of water bottles she bought two days ago had a virus and she was infected. According to a scientist she speaks to, only that case was infected. The virus causes her to gain huge amounts of weight every day, and if a cure is not found, she may become immobile.

Catgirl or Werewolf: While on a mountain hike, Rena discovers a small cave with a strange necklace. When she puts the necklace on, she discovers that it gives her the power to change from a catgirl to a werewolf. But that power comes at two costs: every time she transforms, she gets fatter and fatter, and the more she uses it, the longer it takes to change back. How long will it be before she becomes an immobile werewolf permanently?

(This is the second time I uploaded this because Writing.com deleted the first upload for unknown reasons.)
12533222.title: More.

choices: During the day Rena's clothing begins to feel snug on her....
125332221.content:
Rena's alarm clock sang a pleasant tune. She woke, yawning and stretching, feeling well-rested. It was Saturday; no work, no busy day ahead of her.
She jumped out of her bed and opened her curtains. The sun was sighing brightly in the air, the birds flying merrily around, and strange men in hazard-suits were walking across her lawn...Wait, what!?
Rena rubbed her eyes, not quite sure if she was just imagining this. But it was all real, regardless what she thought. Who were these strange men? Why were they dressed like that?
She stormed out of her room, ready to bombard these men with questions, but when she opened the door she ran straight into some sort of strong plastic.
"What the hell!" Rena exclaimed, touching the plastic.
Through it she saw dozens of other men in hazard-suits, walking around, taking notes, doing scans with strange beeping devices.
Rena's heart began to race. What on earth was going? Two men closest to her noticed her, and one man ran off somewhere while the other tried to calm her down, saying: "Don't worry, madam, we'll explain everything to you when the doctor gets here."
And the doctor did come, a thin mouse dressed like his other peers for obvious reasons, holding a clipboard in his hands.
"Ah, I see your awa-" The doctor didn't finish his sentence before Rena began to yell at him, more in fear than anger.
"What's going on here? You the hell are you people? Let me go, please!"
But the doctor shook his head.
"I'm sorry, my dear, but we can't do that; it's much too dangerous. Your house has been quarantined from the rest of the neighborhood."
Rena felt her blood run cold.
"Q-quarantined? B-but why?" she stuttered, placing her hands on the plastic seal.
"Because of a virus, obviously," the doctor said.
"Virus?" she said outraged, "But I clean my house everyday; how can there be viruses?"
"Simple: through this," the doctors gestured with his hand, and a container was brought forth.
Inside Rena could see her water bottle she bought yesterday. It looked precisely the same, but she had to admit the water looked a bit yellow.
"Apparently this bottle had a strange virus inside it. We have been tracking it for some time, but when we found it, it was already too late," the doctor explained.
Rena began to sweat. She was infected by a virus. What would happen to her? Was she going to die? Or worse, turn into some kind of radioactive monster?
There was only one way to find out. "What's gonna happen to me?" She asked.
The doctor looked at the bottle in the container for a while before he replied: "Well, this virus is very odd, to be honest. It has the ability to clone fat-cells in your body."
"Fat-cells?" Rena asked, looking curiously at the doctor.
"Yes, fat-cells," he confirmed.
"So your basically saying that I'm just gonna fatten up?"
The doctor nodded.
Okay, that was strange. A virus that made people fat. Who knew! Personally Rena wouldn't mind to put some meat on her bones. She was a thin catgirl anyway, and some fat might give her a more attractive figure, but then she thought how her fat-cells in her body would continue multiplying, turning her into a grotesquely huge sack of fat.
"Can you do anything to help me?" she asked desperately.
The doctor paused, deep in thought.
"Don't worry, miss," he said finally, "We'll fix this problem. But for now you must be patient."
Rena nodded in agreement
125332221.title: Heavy Illness

125332223.content: Fattest Catgirl in Space: Rena is abducted by a group of furries from space who spend their days traveling the stars on a massive spaceship. Rena discovers that the boys often like their women when they pack on the pounds.
125332223.title: More heavy-set options

1253322232.content:
Anxiety Buffet

In this story, Rena is a weretiger who lives in a town of monsters similar to herself. However there is a mysterious assailant going around assaulting people with a tennis racket. Although surviving the attack, Rena is very afraid for her life and starts to binge on pancakes in a desperate attempt to literally swallow her fears. As the town is being searched for the assailant, Rena continues to drown her paranoia with her own gluttony, as do the subsequent monster girls who also find themselves victims of this madman, in different ways that one.
1253322232.title: Next Option

12533222321.content:
It was a dark night in Rustymum, a city populated by the monsters of mythology and folklore. At the hospital, there was a weretiger girl named Rena who was just about to leave the Rustymum Community Hospital where she worked as a doctor. On her way out, she heard grunting and saw her boyfriend Kevin messing with a vending machine. Kevin also worked at the hospital as a doctor and was a somewhat portly yellow-skinned cyclops with medium length blonde hair. “Come on,” muttered Kevin. “Come on. You trying to gyp me?!” “Kevin,” said Rena with a giggle. “Be careful with that vending machine. That’s a very easy way to break a finger.” Kevin just gave a nervous laugh. “Come on, Rena. I’ll be with you once I unstick this chips.”

Rena shook her head and went on ahead with a laugh. Rustymum was like any big city and it had its fair share of crime, which meant that it was not recommended that even monsters came out at night. However, Rena lived on a very quiet part of the city, so she wasn't at all worried in the least. "Kevin eats way too much as it is. One of these days I'm going to force him to go on a diet. You don't see me gorging myself like crazy."

Suddenly, Rena heard strange motions and turned around. “Hello?” asked the young cat girl. “Who’s there?” As Rena turned around, she heard somebody creeping up behind her. “Kevin?” she asks. “Kevin?” It was there a large garbage can fell to the ground and made a loud noise. “Huh?” asked Rena. It was at that moment, Rena felt a chill in the air. She turned around and gasped at the sight of a large man. It was too dark to tell what species of monster he was and he was wearing a Hannya mask that had a vertical blue stripe where the nose should’ve been, black high tops with yellow socks a black tank top and black shorts with red highlights. Above all, he was carrying a large tennis racket that he rose into the air. “Long ago,” muttered the man in a distorted voice. “21st century.” With that, the man in the mask brought down the tennis racket and Rena screamed. She tried to kick the stranger in the groin in an attempt to hold him back, but the assault had no effect on him as he whacked Rena to the ground with the racket and Rena let out a scream.

- - - - - - - - - -

When Rena came to, she was at the hospital and let out a moan as she felt her head. She realized it had been bandaged and then looked up to see Kevin looming over her, worry in his big round eye. “Rena?” he asked. “Oh, thank Heavens you’re alright.” “Kevin?” asked Rena weakly. “Ow! What happened? The last thing I remember was seeing a large man and then he... he attacked me.” Kevin gave a look of worry. “From the look of the wound, he was only aiming to wound, not kill. It wasn’t a particularly strong weapon from the looks of it.” Rena just felt more head pain and thought again about the man who attacked her before she let out a scream. “Rena,” said Kevin. “Calm down. You need rest.

Rena then heard a loud pounding noise and two enormous monster women entered the room, both of them were dressed like policewomen. The first of them was an enormous copper-brown furred minotaur resembling a buffalo with long bluish black hair reaching to her large rear. She was large all over but her E cup breasts and udder put the rest of her body to shame. She was wearing a black tanktop with a red jacket and blue jeans as well as a police badge. Her partner was an equally huge silver-skinned werehippopotamus woman with a tattoo of a hippo’s footprint over her right eye. She had long orange-red hair that was worn in a ponytail and compared to her partner, she was much more bottom heavy. She wore a blue traditional policewoman’s outfit with a skirt and a hat. Both women were so tall that they had to duck to get into Rena’s hospital room and each woman was so wide that they had to go in one at a time to avoid getting stuck.

“Rena Bengal?” asked the minotaur woman. Rena gulped as she looked up at the two women who had to be twice as tall as Kevin. “Yes,” said Rena. “Th-That’s me.” The minotaur and werehippo policewomen flashed their badges at Rena and the werehippo gave a snort. “Detectives Janine Yancy and Ellen Xavan. We’ve come to ask you questions about the alleged assailant. What species of monster was he?” Rena saw the grimace on the werehippo cop’s face and was filled with fear. She tried to remember but instead, grabbed hold of her head and groaned. “I-I don’t know,” said Rena. “He wore a Hannya mask. But from what I saw, he was wearing hi-tops and a tank top. He attacked me with a tennis racket. Then he said "Long Ago, 21st Century".”

Janine gave a snort and showed her intimidating hippo teeth before speaking. “A tennis racket as a weapon? Are you ****ing kidding me.” However, Ellen gave a snort and stepped forward, her bovine form looming over Rena. “Keep an open mind, Janine,” she said. “Stranger things can happen. Ms. Bengal, I can assure you, that this villain will be caught.” With that, Ellen and Janine waddled out of the hospital room, in the process, Janine accidentally damaged a vending machine with her large behind. Rena begun to sweat as Kevin held her hand. "I am worried." For the next few days until she was released from the hospital, Rena had nightmares about the assailant.

On the day that Rena was released, Kevin was walking her out of the hospital. "I never thought you'd come to work as a patient, Rena," the cyclops said. "Are you feeling alright now." Rena gave a sigh. "I guess." The tiger girl said. As they both walked down the street, the couple passed by a TV shop. On the news was a lizard woman resembling a dinosaur with a large spike on her nose and jagged teeth. "It has been three days since a young doctor from the Rustymum Community Hospital was relentlessly attacked by a mysterious masked man dressed for a tennis match. The assailant, known by the press as Johnny Hightop has not been seen since and it is unknown when and who he will strike next." Upon hearing that news report, Rena shivered in fear as Kevin grabbed her by the shoulders. "Come on, Rena," the cyclops said to his girlfriend. "I know a place you can go to forget about this unpleasantness." Rena nodded her head as Kevin walked her away.

Nearby, in a police car, Janine was driving as Ellen was stuffing her face with donuts. "Is that really what they're calling him?" asked Janine. "They have to call him something, Janine. We have no idea of his real name or species. Long ago, 21st Century." "Sounds like the last lyrics of a Japanese superhero show," said Janine as she came to a red light and bit into a Boston cream donut. "But what we do know is that it's a race against time to stop this lunatic before he strikes again."

- - - - - - - - - -

While Ellen and Janine were busy looking for Johnny Hightop, Kevin took Janine to a restaurant atop a mountain overlooking Rustymum. It was a pancake house from the looks of it and there was a mascot of a tiger without stripes on the outside. "Black Flapjack's?" asked Rena. Kevin nodded his head. "This is where I usually go to eat away what's bothering me. Some pancakes should put you in a better mood." Rena nodded her head and then went inside. At the front table of the pancake house was a balding male yeti with a hunched back and a gold fang sticking out of his mouth on the opposite side of a healthy fang. "Kevin," said the yeti. "I haven't seen you in days." Kevin gave a smile. "This time I brought my girlfriend with me."

The yeti noticed Rena and nodded his head. "And what can I get for you both." Kevin smiled. "I'll take the usual." The yeti then turned to face Rena. "And for the lady?" Rena looked over the menu but then she gasped. She remembered her attack from Johnny Hightop and begun to sweat. She remembered those words he said to her. “Long ago.” Rena screamed and tore the menu in half. “Just get me a double order of what he’s having!” Both Ivan and the proprietor looked in worry. However, soon Kevin and Rena received their orders. Ivan’s order consisted of three stacks of blueberry pancakes and a side of bacon while Rena was having twice as much food. Kevin was about to take the first bite when he turned and gasped because Rena was already half-way done with her meal. She was eating at a rapid speed out of stress and even screamed as she choked down some blueberry pancakes slathered in syrup. All she could do at this point was eat away her fear.
12533222321.title: Anxiety Buffet

125332223211.content:
Rena continued to tear through her pancakes while Kevin, in contrast to his usual habits, was eating slowly as he blinked (or winked since he only had one eye) as he watched his girlfriend. “Rena?” he asked. “Rena? Rena!?” Rena had finished her pancakes and then stuffed her face with bacon right before she yelled at the proprietor with her mouth still full. “Proprietor!” yelled Rena. “Another round over here!” The yeti gave Rena another round of pancakes that she started to dig into as she begun to sweat heavily. “Rena?” asked Ivan. “Are you feeling alright?” Rena then begun to gag before she drank some milk to stop her choking. “I-I’m sorry, Kevin,” she said. “I don’t know what’s gotten into me. I-I...” Rena then gasped and looked back because she thought she saw the shadow of Johnny Hightop. Rena turned and saw nothing and then she nibbled on a piece of bacon as her eyes all but bulged out of her head. “You shouldn’t eat so fast,” warned Kevin. “You’re going to get bloated.” Unfortunately, Rena was too stressed out to pay any heed or worry about her waistline. She was already starting to develop a slight bulge in her belly.

- - - - - - -

At that moment, Janine and Ellen had returned to the scene where Rena was attacked by Johnny Hightop. Ellen was looking down at a footprint left behind by the assailant’s sneakers. It was made from Rena’s blood from the attack and spell out the word “Critan”. The minotaur looked up at her werehippo partner before speaking. “Size 16,” Ellen said. “We’re dealing with a rather large monster species.” Janine lifted her mountainous belly to get a good look at her bare pachyderm feet and then looked at Ellen’s hooves. “Well, whatever he is, he’s definitely not a werehippo or a minotaur. What does it say, Ellen?” “Critan. It’s a very popular sports brand. Among monsters that actually wear shoes that is. If memory serves, there are only three stores in Rustymum that sell Critan Sporting Goods. Come on, Janine. We have no time to lose.” With that, both obese ungulate-based policewomen left to find anything to be used to find out Johnny Hightop’s identity. However, as they were driving towards the first sports store, somebody passed them at rapid speed, forcing Janine to stomp on the brakes as Ellen spilt hot coffee onto her udder and screamed in pain. “What the?!”

Janine gave a snort and gave chase after that driver. “Great,” she muttered. “A manic driver. Doesn’t this moron know that we have better things to do than to chase speeders? I’m a detective. This isn’t my job.” Janine turned the siren on to signal to the speeder to pull over. Once the car had pulled over, Janine and Ellen got out, Ellen holding her legs together in pain from the coffee burning her udder. Janine banged on the roof of the speeder’s car and showed her fangs. “Open up, you chowderhead! Don’t you realize how fast you were going!” Out of the car came another female monster who the same height as Rena. From the looks of it, she was the anchorwoman from the television. She was a teal-skinned and blue-striped lizardwoman whose body shape resembled that of a velociraptor but with a ceratosaurus’s horn on her nose.“Excuse me,” said the lizard giantess. “Don’t you realize who I am?”

Ellen was surprised to see the anchorwoman as she was wiping coffee off of her pants. “Blue Newworld,” said Ellen. “Channel 5 news.” Janine just gave a snort and the hippo woman went through her notepad to write a speeding ticket. “Newscaster or not, nobody is above the law.” However, Blue seemed unconcerned about receiving a speeding ticket in the least and smiled. “It will be worth it,” she said. “Now, Detectives, tell me, do you have any leads in the Johnny Hightop case.” “You expect us to tell you that?” asked Janine indignantly. “A reporter. You’re just going to blab it and then we’ll be back to square one.” “We’re already at square one, Janine,” said Ellen. “We don’t even know what species of monster, Johnny Hightop is. The only thing that we have to go by is the brand of shoe that he wears.” Blue gave a smile. “Interesting,” she said. “Can I see the brand?” Janine just stuck the speeding ticket in Blue’s mouth before she and Ellen got back in their patrol carl and drove away. “Hey!” yelled Blue. “Inquiring minds want to know! There’s still such a thing as freedom of speech!”

Blue gave a pout and then started to drive away, closely following Ellen and Janine. “This is going to be the scoop of the year,” said the newscaster to herself. “There is no way I’m missing a chance to get the dirt on Rustymum’s own version of Jack the Ripper. I might even score a Pulitzer prize.” But before Blue could get any farther, she was forced to step on the brakes as she reached a red traffic light. Blue gave a slight growl as Ellen and Janine drove away. She hissed and pounded the steering wheel, making the horn go off.

Janine and Ellen at this point had reached the first stop on their list. It was a shop called Asgard Sports and the manager was a male werewolf with pitch white fur and graying hair who wore a pair of glasses and had blue tattoos over his body. While Janine and Ellen were getting ready to interrogate the manager, Blue was outside the store eavesdropping. "Size 16?" asked the manager. "We only carry up to size 14, Detective." "That being said," said Ellen. "Did a particularly large monster come in here? At least 8' high." The werewolf saw that he was only up to both policewomen's waists. "Nope," said the wolf man. "The biggest monsters we've seen in here are you two. However, there's a shop on the other side of town called David Jones's. The stock boy is a yeti. They also sell Critan brand." Janine gave a snort as she wrote down notes. Outside, Blue was doing the same thing.

In the store trying on a pair of shoes was another monster who was dressed as an ice skater. From the looks of it, she was a female gargoyle with purple red skin and long red hair reaching down to her rear. She had several small horns on her forehead and a pair of snake-like green eyes. She was speaking to an employee who from the looks of it, was a teenage gremlin boy who didn't even come up to her knee. "I would've never expected to see a gargoyle in a shoe store." "Well," said the gargoyle girl. "Gargoyles also don't like their talons to touch the cold, cold ice. Now. Do you have anything in a size 15?"

- - - - - - -

At that time, back at her apartment, Rena was nervously eating cookies as she was reading a newspaper article. “Who is Johnny Hightop?” Rena ate cookie after cookie as she read the paper. She could even swear that she saw the artist’s rendering of Johnny Hightop blink before staring at her menacingly. She then heard the door turn and gasped before she swallowed an entire gallon of milk. She picked up an umbrella from the coat rack and held it up before she advanced to the door that was opening. Rena saw a shadow coming and imagined it as the evil shadow of the nefarious Johnny Hightop and begun to sweat. She remembered what Johnny Hightop said to her. “Long ago, 21st Century!” In that instance, Rena panicked and was about to bring down the umbrella.

But before she could, the figure held out his hands. “Wait!” he yelled. Rena stopped herself just before she was about to hit the man over the head. She was very close to hitting Kevin over the head as he walked inside. Rena breathed out a sigh of relief. “Oh,” she said. “Kevin. Oh, dammit Kevin. I could’ve rung your bell.” The cyclops gave a sigh of relief. “Well, I’m glad you didn’t. You must’ve thought I was Johnny Hightop.” Rena shivered. “Don’t even joke about it. That maniac is still out there.” Rena walked away as Kevin focused his single eye on her rear end that looked like it had gotten slightly bigger. He looked in concern. “Rena?” the cyclops asked his girlfriend. “Have you been overeating. You’re starting to look a little... pudgy.” Rena turned her head and then hissed. “Well, when was the last time YOU saw your toes, Kevin.” kevin wisely shut up as Rena looked to the window and saw rain coming down. The drip of water was in a shape that resembled Johnny Hightop to Rena and it filled her with dread.

Elsewhere, it was growing dark and Ellen and Janine were driving away from Asgard Sports. The rain was coming down so heavily that they didn't know that they were being followed by Blue Newworld in her car. “Dang,” said Blue. “An evil night. Perfect for Johnny Hightop. I almost wish I’d run into him. Boy would that be a scoop.” Blue was forced to stop her car as she approached another red light. She grumbled to herself and took the opportunity to adjust her makeup. But as she looked into the mirror, she gasped.

Right behind Blue was Johnny Hightop wearing a dark green raincoat and holding up an umbrella. He stared at her menacingly and forced her to drive off the road as he swung his umbrella and the lizard woman was forced to stop. There was a loud honking from the horn and Johnny Hightop disappeared just as the sound of sirens filled the air...
125332223211.title: Anxiety Buffet Part II

12533222322.content: Rena gets adopted by a large female minotaur who lost her daughter at birth. Mira the minotaur took Rena into her family as her baby.
12533222322.title: Next Option

125332223221.content: Do you really want to go with this option? You can always choose more.
125332223221.title: Do you really...?

1253322232212.content:
This story takes place on the year 1550. Rena, a noble lady of 19 years, lives a happy life at her father's estate, caring greatly for her complexion (which is very beautiful) and body (which is very thin). But all is not well with her father, Lord Murray, who is desperately trying to find his daughter a good suitor, who will bring forth a heir that will proclaim all his possessions the day he dies. But, alas, all the wealthy men of the county revises his offer, saying, although she is fair, that Rena is far to bony and will not be able to give birth to children.

Either Lord Murray would have to result to drastic measures or his daughter would have to change her eating habits.

Choice one: Lord Murray (resulting to drastic measures now) decides to go and seek help at a self-proclaimed sorcerer, who gives him a special potion that will give Rena the necessary qualities to attract a suitor and survive childbirth. Excited, Murray slips the potion into Rena's tee. The following morning she wakes up with much larger hips, breasts, and a sturdier body. Her father is thrilled and invites many important and wealthy men to a ball, so that they can swoon over Rena, and then, hopefully, Lord Murray can find a few marriage proposals. But little does he know that the potion had a few tweaks that needed to be sorted out, resulting in Rena gaining weight during the feast...

"What do you want?" asked Rena with disinterest, packing a box before his face, obscuring his view.

Marty did not bother her further that day, which relieved her greatly. She had no idea how the clumsy idiot could manage to sleep with dozens of female employees. He was so bombastic, so annoying, so spoiled.

Rena was just glad that she didn't have to deal with him.

"Okay," Jessica said slowly, a little taken aback, "Anyway, any thing else? I saw you being checked out by someone today."

"That's a relief at least," Rena said.

"Now tell me, how did you end up this way?" Anderson asked.

"I don't know!" Rena cried, feeling hot tears come to her eyes, "The first thing I know I'm standing in the bathroom, freshening up, and the next thing I'm swelling up like a balloon!"

"Okay, calm down," said Anderson, "We'll figure this out in due time, but, if you want to, you could stay here for a while."

Rena didn't like taking charity from someone; it said that she wasn't independent, but she had little choice. She could not go back home, for it would be very hard to explain her sudden weight gain to friends and family.

And, Rena realized, she could kiss her new career goodbye, because she was far too fat for the business, and there was no man who liked a fat women, right?

"I'll stay here for a while," she finally said.

"Alright then," said Anderson, clapping his huge hands together and standing up, "Anything else you'd like to ask me?"

"Yeah," said Rena, tucking on her robe, "Did you undress me? And who's robe is this?"

"O, don't worry," he said, "It was Sapphire who undressed you. Your clothing was completely ruined. As for the robe, it's my grandmother's; she forgot it here when she last visited me. She's a big women, and I guess it would also...you know..."

"Yeah, yeah, I know," Rena said rolling her eyes, "I'm a whale."

"Well, do you have any more questions?"

Rena felt her belly growl. "Can I get more food, please?"
12533222322122222211111.title: Laying low.

1253322232212222222.content: Madame Half Ton - Here, Rena is an worker at a laboratory in a city constantly besieged by super-villains, with the lab even being known for making a few by accident. One such accident befalls Rena, who one day gets doused in chemicals after a fight with her supervisor. With nothing happening so far, she returns home to bed. But the next day, she is surprised to discover that she now extremely fat, weighing exactly 1000 pounds. But surprisingly, she isn't immobile: in fact, she's developed superhuman strength, invulnerability, and surprising leaping abilities. But does she decide to become a hero, or a villain?
1253322232212222222.title: More choices, please

12533222322122222221.content:
Mathison was a rather large seaside city. It was well known for a number of things. It's beautiful beaches. It's wonderful restaraunts. It's grand hotels and rich mansions.

And the fact that it's hit with supervillains nearly everyday.

Yes, Mathison, like many comic book cities, suffers a deluge of superpowered maniacs and criminals. Thankfully, there were just as many heroes to stop them. Some were magic. Some made tech. And some came from accidents at First Rate Labs.

First Rate Labs usually delt in creating medical and ecological formulas to save people and plants. But it's developed a bad reputation as "The Hero and Villain Birthplace", since nearly 80% of the cities superpowered beings came from there. But despite that, it's a great place to work on most days.

"YOU AIR HEADED BIMBO!"

Today was not one of those days.

Head reseacher Tyler Marlan was currently yelling at his assistant, a skinny orange catgirl named Rena Caine. Rena had gotten an order mixed up by mistake, and Tyler was not happy.

"I'm sorry, Mr. Marlan." Rena said, worried. "I misread the address. It's an honest mistake."

"Well, thanks to your "honest mistake", a shipment of grass regrowing formula was just sent to a HOSPITAL!" Tyler said. "I swear, you are useless!"

Rena had a reputation for making many mistakes at the lab. It'd either be misplaced equipment, incorrect orders, or spilt chemicals. Many workers laughed at Rena's mistakes, causing her self-esstem and self-image to plummet, making her the nervous wreck we see now.

"I thought the address was 116, not 119. I swear, I didn't mean to-" Rena protested. But Tyler wasn't listening. He started advancing towards her, ranting the whole time. Rena backed up in fear, only to back right into a cabinet.

That's where things take a turn. On top of it was a beaker with a glowing blue formula that had been in the lab for some months. Most workers didn't even know what it did, so they just left it. Unfortunately, it was now about to get use. Rena hitting the cabinet shook it, causing the beaker to topple over and fall. Tyler saw it and jumped back, but Rena wasn't as quick. The beaker smashed open on her head, spilling the formula all over her.

Tyler sighed. "Amazing. Now you've made a mess. You know what, just get out. You've caused enough trouble today." He said.

Rena, now covered in the formula, left the lab saddened. The other lab workers looked on, until a glare from Tyler convinced them to get back to work.
Rena left the building, about to start crying, when a familiar voice stopped her.

"Rena! What happened?" The voice said. Rena turned and saw Marla Emmet, a ecologist on the team. Marla's black hair was in a bun, and she was wearing tinted protective goggles. Her uniform didn't really hide her hourglass figure.

When Rena saw Marla, her heart raced. Most of the people didn't know it, but Rena was a lesbian, and had a crush on Marla since she started working at First Rate Labs, but never acted on it.

"It's nothing, Marla." Rena said. "Just another stupid mistake. Sent chemicals to the wrong place, and got doused in some chemicals."

Marla cocked her head to the side. "I don't see any chemicals on you." She said.

Confused, Rena felt her face and looked at her lab coat. Suprisingly, she was completely clean. "What?" She said, confused. "But I was-" She shook her head. "Never mind. I need to go home and shower." With that, Rena walked away, leaving Marla confused.

What Rena didn't know was that the formula had seeped through her clothes and into her skin. Soon, it would take effect.
--------------------
About an hour later, Rena was in her aparment. After taking a shower, she changed into a tee shirt and shorts and sat on the couch. She grabbed the remote and turned the TV on.

"-again, Captain Lightning has stopped Gravity Well's plan, and is taking him to prison as we speak." The news report stated. "Now, Lady Pixel is once again doing battle with-"

Rena shut off the TV, deciding not to hear it. She was envious of both heroes and villains. Getting to do what they want, having epic battles, while she gets chewed out by Tyler and covered in chemicals. She felt it wasn't fair.

That's when she suddenly felt very tired. It wasn't even close to night. Rena got up and stumbled to her bedroom. She managed to get to her bed in time, before she completely passed out.
---------------------
A few hours later, at around Midnight, Rena slowly woke up. Wondering what had happened, she slowly got up out of bed and onto her feet. She lumbered over to her door to get water, only to find she had trouble getting through the door. After a bit, she did get through, but was confused as to why that happened. She passed by a full lenght mirror that had been in the apartment since she moved in, and she caught a glimpse of herself.

And fully woke up from the shock.

Somehow, in a few hours, Rena had become monstrously fat. Her face now had somewhat bloated cheeks, and she had gained a second and third chin. Her previously skinny arms were now bloated. Her previously flat chest had ballooned into a pair of ZZ cups. Her hips jutted out three feet from her side. Slowly turning, she saw her butt was huge. Each cheek was a big as two beach balls. What she could see of her legs were just as bloated as her arms.

But all that paled in comparison, when she turned to face the mirror again, and finally looked at her belly. It was gigantic, easily twice the size of her chest. Rena was standing five feet away from the mirror (the hall was seven feet wide) and her belly was still able to touch it. It wasn't a perfect sphere, having two rolls.

Only now did Rena realize that she had burst out of her clothes, and was standing naked in the hall, with only her belly covering her legs.

Rena looked at herself in the mirror in...
12533222322122222221.title: Madame Half Ton

125332223221222222212.content:
As freaky as this was, Rena couldn't help but look in intrigue. Somehow, she overnight went from a beanpole to a massive ball of lard. She hefted up one of her massive breasts, confirming that they were in fact real. Then, she dropped them onto her enormous gut, turned, and gave her inflated ass a nice big smack. She watched as it jiggled like mad.

"You know, this could be fun." Rena said to herself, smiling a bit. "I've always been so skinny. This could be a nice change of pace."

Realizing she didn't even know how much she weighed now, she slowly lumbered to her bathroom, and, with great effort, squeezed into it. Then, she looked at the electronic scale near the tub. It was supposed to hold up to 10 tons and had an electronic voice. Slowly, she stepped onto the scale. She waited for a few seconds, and it was done.

"Current weight: One thousand pounds." The scale said.

"Holy crap!" Rena exclamied. "I'm surprised I haven't broken the floor!" Stepping off the scale, she turned and saw that there were cracks in the floor shaped liker her feet. "Oh."

Lumbering out of the bathroom, Rena entered her living room. She then sat on her couch, which groaned under her new weight.

"This is incredible." She said. "That chemical must have done this to me. But, if I'm a thousand pounds, how can I move?" Then something clicked in her head. "Could it be?"

Slowly, she rose from the couch, and looked at something to her right. It was a large chest that she bought at a flea market. It weighed a ton, and took 3 men to move. Walking over to it, Rena grabbed one of the handles, and lifted. To her amazement, it felt as light as a feather.

"Amazing!" She yelled. "I'm super strong!" Setting the chest down gently, she turned and went out the sliding door onto her balcony. Now outside, she looked out at Mathison. It was near a desert. Grinning, she ready herself, and jumped. Instead of just jumping an inch, Rena went flying.
------
A few seconds later, Rena landed in the middle of the desert, leaving a small impact crater.

"That was awesome!" She cried out. "So, I have super strenght, super jumping powers, now what else?" Looking around, she saw a boulder. "Oh, this is going to be stupid."

She waddled over to the boulder, and lifted it up with no problem. Holding it over her head, she prepared herself, and dropped it on her head. The boulder shattered into tiny pebbles.

"OK, so I am invulnerable. Thankfully." Rena said. Then she started to giggle. "I don't believe it. I have super powers!"

Rena couldn't be more overjoyed. This was an incredible discovery. But how to use her new powers? After thinking for a second, she decided she would use her powers too...
125332223221222222212.title: Super Powered Fat

choices: Will Rena find out how to make an excuse for herself?
Will Rena need a friend to cover for her?
1253322232212222222121.content:
Her mother and father raised Rena to always protect her fellow animen, so what other option was there besides becoming a hero? Rena raised a large arm towards the air in triumph, until she realized that she felt a gentle breeze wrap around her. She looked down to find that her clothes had disintegrated in her flight and landing.

"Aw fiddlesticks." Rena proclaimed, the desert sands slowly started to get into her flab. She blushed in embarrassment, her tail wagged around her large posterior. Rena checked her area for any watchers, seeing none she flew off towards the horizon.

===


The travel back home was difficult, she had too many close calls with some apartment buildings and skyscrapers and planes and....anyways. Rena's body was way corpulent to hide and she couldn't exactly blow off her extreme weight gain.

"What do I do for you?" Rena said, her body being the thing addressed. Thoughts flew in her mind,should she make an excuse for her own body? What could she say that would be convincing enough for everybody? She could also go elsewhere for concealment, what about one of her friends? Maybe she could ask her for some assistance in this situation? Rena raised a fat limb to stoke her bloated face.
1253322232212222222121.title: Protect the City (Hero Route)

12533222322122222222.content: Rena lives in a universe not quite as grounded in reality as ours. It operates in the same way as an Eastern RPG (Final Fantasy and the like), and Rena's the hero of the story. However, unlike most RPGs, going up a level not only increases your stats, but also your weight. Yet, because it's an RPG, there's no weight problem!
12533222322122222222.title: Let's Play

125332223221222222221.content:
Welcome to the Crossroads- a place that rests in the gap between worlds. All heroes of all stories must pass through the Crossroads before their stories can begin. Most that pass through the Crossroads don't remember doing so until they return, after their adventures end. However, changing regulations now allow for those looking for a less serious adventure to retain their memories of the Crossroads.

"Rena?"

"Yeah?"

"You're reading that out loud."

Rena squeaked and shrunk into her seat a bit. She was a diminutive catgirl, with emerald green eyes, tiger-stripe fur, and shoulder length red hair that was pulled back into a ponytail. She wore a white T-shirt, blue jeans, a pair of sandals, and a pair of black-rimmed glasses, all of which (even the sandals!) seemed to hang off her twig like figure.

Rena hailed from a world where a freak accident with a burst of gamma radiation mutated the humans into various human-animal hybrids. She had heard of the Crossroads, and was enamored with the idea. So, she gathered her two best friends, Lucy and Bailey, and headed to the omniversal hub.

Lucy was, simply put, really tall. She was nineteen, two years younger than Rena, and yet she was brushing seven feet, more than two feet taller than Rena. Lucy was a foxgirl, with reddish brown fur, bright blue eyes, and light blonde hair that stopped halfway down her back. She wore a pair of denim hot pants, a pair of flip flops, and a low cut shirt to show off her frankly giant boobs.

Rena's other friend, Bailey, was the only one of the trio that was of average height. The cowgirl had black fur, dark brown eyes, and black hair in a pixie cut. She wore a white tank top that strained against her muscles, a pair of blue jeans that strained against her bubble butt, and a pair of combat boots. There was a lot of straining in Bailey's attire.

“Well, while we’re talking about it,” Lucy said. “What kind of adventure do we want? I’m thinking something lighthearted, but not too much so.”

“What the hell’s wrong with you?!” Bailey shouted. “You don’t just go to the Crossroads for some pansy-ass field trip! You go there for the badass adventures where you rip out your opponents’ guts!”

“That’s way too violent!” Lucy shouted back.

“So what if it’s violent?!” Bailey shot back. Before the argument could escalate into yet another brawl between the two, Rena, her nose in the pamphlet she was reading earlier, spoke up.

“Um, it says in the pamphlet that if you’re unsure what kind of experience you want, you can just pick the “random” option,” Rena read from the pamphlet. She looked up at her two friends. “If we do that, then there’s no hard feelings over what we end up with, right?”

Lucy and Bailey looked at each other, then at Rena. “Right,” they said in unison.

“I’m glad you’ve decided!” A cheery voice yelled out. All three girls yelped and jumped back. Standing on the other side of the room they were in was a human woman with curly black hair. She had brown eyes, and she was wearing a black pantsuit, the top strained by her titanic bust. On her right ring finger she wore a small ring.

“My name is Beth,” she said. “I’ll be the one setting up your journey. Before we begin the selection process, do you have any questions? I’ll answer them to the best of my ability.”

“How big are your boobs?” Lucy asked immediately, much to the other two’s embarrassment.

“34J,” Beth answered quickly and shamelessly, much to the trio’s surprise.

“Noted,” Lucy said. “Three sizes bigger.”

“Any other questions?” Beth asked.

“Are there any Limit Break style abilities?” Rena asked.

“Of course!” Beth said. “Final Fantasy is just one of the many series that use the Crossroads. If you want, we could even call that ability Limit Break during your adventure.”

“Please!” The trio said in unison.

“Alright,” Beth said. “The deed has been done. Any more questions?”

The trio shook their heads.

“Good,” Beth said, a tablet appearing in her hands. “Let’s begin. You wanted the world to be random, yes?”

“That’s right,” Rena said. Beth tapped a few things on her tablet.

“Do you wish to retain your memories of the Crossroads and your world during your adventure?”

Rena turned to Bailey and Lucy. They both nodded. Rena turned to Beth and nodded as well, who tapped a few more things on her tablet.

“I’m going to assume the three of you want to start out together?” Beth asked. The three nodded again.

“Alright!” Beth said. “Now we can get on to which classes you’ll be. One at a time, please step forward.”
125332223221222222221.title: Getting a Job

1253322232212222222211.content:
Bailey stepped forwards first. Beth looked at her a hummed in thought.

“I have a few classes in mind,” Beth said after a moment. “I could see you as any physically oriented class, but I have three in mind.”

“What are they?” Bailey asked.

“The first class in mind is the Knight class,” Beth said. “You’ll have high attack, defense, and HP stats, but your magic, magic defense, and speed stats will be low, with an average luck stat. Its Limit Break is called Brave Slash. It hits once and does 1.5 times your normal attack damage, and boosts your attack and defense when you use it. Additionally, once you reach level 50, you’ll have the option of choosing one of two sub-classes. The Dark Night sub class has higher attack and magic than the standard Knight, and you gain the special command Dark, which sacrifices 10% of your HP to deal however much HP was sacrificed in damage to all enemies. The Paladin sub class has higher defense and magic defense than Knight, and gains the special command Hero. While using Hero, you will be unable to attack, but the rest of your allies’ stats with double.”

Bailey digested that for a few seconds. “It sounds powerful, but I’ll pass.”

“Very well, then,” Beth said. “The second class I have in mind is the Dragoon class. It has similar stats as the Knight class, but it has average attack and defense and high speed. The Dragoon’s special command is Jump. When you use it, you will jump high into the air, rendering you immune to all damage and spells. You will stay in the air for a while, after which you will come down and land on the target, dealing double normal attack damage. Its Limit Break is called Death From Above. It is a powerful jump attack that hits once and deals three times normal jump attack damage, with no extra effects. Once you reach level 50, the Jump command will change to the Multi-Jump command. Multi-Jump does exactly what it sounds like- it allows Jump to hit multiple times. You have a 100% chance for Jump to high twice, and the chances are halved for each jump after that, for a maximum of twenty jumps, although that only has a roughly 0.0002% chance of happening.”

Bailey sighed. “Again, it sounds powerful, but not really my style.”

“Alright,” Beth said. “The third class I have in mind is the Brawler class. Again, it has similar stats to Knight, but trades the high HP for the second highest luck value of any class we offer. Its Limit Break is called Slots. Based on how you roll, it can do anything from summon a powerful beast to wiping everything off the board- including your party- to absolutely nothing. The Brawler doesn’t start out with a special command, but at level 50 gains the Dice command. When you use Dice, you will roll three dice, and your next attack will deal a different amount of damage depending on what you roll.”

Bailey hummed in thought. “I’ll take the Brawler,” she said after a while.

“Very well,” Beth said. “I will teleport you to your changing room. When the light flashes green, you may begin your adventure.”

Bailey then disappeared in a flash of blue light.

“Next, please!” Beth said. Lucy stepped up to her.

“I have two classes in mind already,” Beth said.

“What, no thinking for a bit?” Lucy said.

Beth laughed. “The instant I saw you, I knew which two would be your options.”

“What are they then?” Lucy asked.

“Your first option is the Dancer class,” Beth said. “Dancer has high HP, defense, and magic defense stats, with an average magic stat, and low attack, speed, and luck stats. Your special command is Dance. Depending on the environment you’re in, you’ll use certain abilities, such as healing your party or attacking with an element associated with that environment. However, you cannot stop dancing until either you fall in battle or the battle ends. The only exception to this is its Limit Break. Your Limit Break is called Climax. When you use it, you will use all of the abilities of whatever dance you’re currently using at once. If you are not using a dance when you use Climax, you will begin dancing. Dancer is one of the few classes that do not gain anything upon reaching any level.”

“And my second option?” Lucy asked.

“The Seductress class,” Beth said. “The Seductress has extremely high speed and luck, the best we offer, and every other stat except magic is low, while the magic stat is slightly below average. Your special command is Entice, which causes the target to attack their allies. Its Limit Break is also called Climax, only the Seductress’ Climax raises all of the user’s stats. When you reach level 50, you gain the Devote command. It causes the target to guard you until it dies.”

Lucy thought for a minute. “I’ll be a Dancer.”

“Alright then,” Beth said. “Now you can change. Again, when the light flashes green, you may begin your adventure.”

Like Bailey, Lucy disappeared in a flash of blue light. Beth turned to Rena.

“I can’t think of any class for you,” Beth said sheepishly. “I’m sorry.”

“It’s okay,” Rena said. “I’ve already thought of what class I want to be. Its-”

“Wait!” Beth said. “Give me a hint so I can figure it out.”

“Alright,” Rena said. “I’ve always…
1253322232212222222211.title: Getting a Job, continued

12533222322122222222112.content:
“I’ve always loved machines,” Rena said. Beth’s eyes went wide with understanding.

“Oh, you want to be a Machinist, huh?” Beth asked rhetorically. “Well, Machinists have high attack, defense, and magic defense stats, with an average HP stat, and low magic, speed, and luck stats. Your special command is called Tools. Tools lets you use various tools that you can find and buy in stores, each with different effects. However, only one tool is needed to use it, and having multiple tools does nothing, except during your Limit Break. Your Limit Break is called Omni-Tool. Omni-Tool uses all tools that you currently have in succession. If you have, say, two of one tool, during your Limit Break you will use both tools. Machinists don’t get anything when they reach any level. Sound good to you?”

Rena nodded. “Sounds perfect!”

“Great!” Beth said. “Now, like with the other two, I’ll teleport you to your changing room. Once the light flashes green, you can begin your adventure.”

In a brief flash of blue, Rena was teleported into a small room. The walls were white, and just a little bit longer than Rena was tall, while they stretched up for farther than Rena could see. One of the walls, the one to her left, had a mirror built into it, while the wall opposite the mirror had her outfit hanging on it.

Rena’s outfit consisted of a pair of denim overalls, a pair of brown work boots, a pair of gray work gloves, a white tank top, and a pair of goggles. There was just one problem with them- Rena would be swimming in them when she put them on! The overalls looked to be made for someone who weighed at least four tons, with the rest of the clothing to match! Even the boots, when she looked at the size, were size 22, while she wore a size 9! Nonetheless, this was Rena’s outfit she had to wear, so she had to put it on. And before she could put this outfit on, she obviously had to take her current one off.

Rena was definitely not happy with how she looked. Sure, she wasn’t anorexic or anything like that, but she just felt too small. Not height wise, but weight wise. When her friends- especially Lucy- hit puberty and started to grow and get boobs and such, Rena was excited for her turn to come around. So she waited. And waited. And then she realized that this was as big as she was going to get: 4 feet 11 inches, 95 pounds, A cup size. Sighing, Rena put the tent like tank top over her head, and was in for a pleasant surprise.

Once Rena put the tank top on, it shrank down to fit perfectly. She then tried it with one of the gloves- again, it shrank down to fit perfectly. Rena quickly threw on the rest of the outfit, all of it shrinking down to fit her perfectly. Once Rena put her goggles around her neck, her glasses replaced by a pair of magic, intangible contacts, an unseen light began to flash green, and the mirror she had been using fell away to reveal a shimmering portal of blue. Excited, Rena stepped through the portal.

§........§

Rena appeared in the middle of a forest. She shook her head to rid her mind of the fog that came with that portal. She heard a low whistle.

“Damn, Rena, they even made your twig body look good,” Bailey’s voice said. Rena turned to face where the voice came from, and also let out a low whistle. Bailey was wearing a white crop top, a pair of denim hot pants, a pair of combat boots, and her fists were wrapped in white sports tape. Like Rena, all of it fit perfectly.

“Speak for yourself, Bailey!” Lucy said. She was wearing a purple sarong around her waist, and a purple bikini top to match. “You’re looking good!”

“So are you, Tits McGee,” Bailey said back.

Lucy smiled. “That’s right I am!”

Rena, meanwhile, had managed to figure out how to look at her stats.

Rena Westfall

Job: Machinist

Level: 1

EXP: 0

EXP to next: 12

Weight: 95 lbs.

HP: 150/150

MP: 30/30

ATK: 40

DEF: 40

MGC: 20

MDF: 40

SPD: 20

LCK: 5

GPL: 10

What the heck does GPL mean? Rena thought.

“Hey, could you two take a look at your stats for a second?” Rena asked.

“Um, sure,” Lucy said. “But why?”

“Please?” Rena asked.

“Oh, fine,” Bailey said. “Stats.”

On that command, Bailey’s stats screen popped up.

Bailey Allen

Job: Brawler

Level: 1

EXP: 0

EXP to next: 12

Weight: 120 lbs.

HP: 150/150

MP: 30/30

ATK: 40

DEF: 40

MGC: 20

MDF: 20

SPD: 20

LCK: 20

GPL: 10


Lucy Smith

Job: Dancer

Level: 1

EXP: 0

EXP to next: 12

Weight: 200 lbs.

HP: 200/200

MP: 50/50

ATK: 20

DEF: 40

MGC: 30

MDF: 40

SPD: 20

LCK: 5

GPL: 10

“Do either of you have any idea what GPL even means?” Rena asked.

“Nope,” Bailey answered.

“Not a clue,” Lucy said. “Well, might as well walk around until plot happens.”

Not three seconds after saying that, a small child ran past them screaming for help.

“What the hell?” Bailey asked.

“We’ve got trouble!” Rena said. Bailey and Lucy turned to see a giant, bull-like creature charging at them.
12533222322122222222112.title: Let the Adventure Begin!

choices: The trio makes it to the town without any more encounters
125332223221222222221121.content:
“Alright, let’s do this!” Bailey said. Cracking her knuckles, she charged at the beast and threw an uppercut into its jaw. The monster was stopped in its tracks by the punch, dazed slightly. It shakes its head and roars at the three.

As the battle begins, the trio hears this starting to play: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lMd6V1IO...

The monster bellows and charged as Bailey. She takes the hit, her arms crossed to try and reduce the power of the blow.

-35 HP! Current HP 115/150!

“Gah, this thing hits pretty hard!” Bailey called out. She lashed out again, hitting the beast with a straight jab.

-336 HP!

Next came Lucy’s turn. She closed her eyes and began to sway, a dark green aura flaring up around her.

Nature’s Harmony: Forest’s Healing

Restored 75 HP to Bailey! Current HP 190/150!

Over-healed! +20 lbs. to Bailey!

Restored 75 HP to Rena! Current HP 225/150!

Over-healed! +37.5 lbs. to Rena!

Restored 100 HP to Lucy! Current HP 300/200!

Over-healed! +50 lbs. to Lucy!

As soon as the dark green aura around Lucy died down, the trio felt their bodies expanding, fattening up.

Bailey fattened up the least, although it was still a good amount. Her breasts had jumped up from their previous C-cups to somewhere probably in the DD range. Her belly jiggled whenever she moved, and was beginning to sag a bit. Her ass was even bigger and rounder than before, with only a tiny window between her thighs left.

Rena gained the second most out of the three. Her breasts went from an A-cup to either a large B-cup or a small C-cup. Her belly swayed like a pendulum when she moved, and it covered her crotch when she stood up. If she were to check, her ass would actually be slightly larger than Bailey’s now, and when she experimentally tried to walk, her thighs forced her to waddle, and quite severely.

Lucy gained the most weight. Her breasts, previously G-cups, were now in the L-cup range. Her stomach had the same pendulum and crotch-covering that Rena’s did, and her ass was much bigger. However, due to how much taller Lucy was than Rena, she still had some room between her thighs and could still walk normally.

“What the hell?!” Bailey asked. “What kind of world were we sent to?”

“Apparently one where getting healed too much makes you fat,” Lucy said deadpan. “Rena, hurry up and take your turn! Once we kill this thing, we can figure this out!”

Rena nodded. “Right!”

Rena reached into her inventory and pulled out an object that looked somewhat like a crossbow. She aimed it at the monster and fired it.

Tool: Auto-Crossbow

-504 HP!

The monster roared again, this time charging at Rena.

-35 HP! Current HP 190/150!

-17.5 lbs. from Rena!

To Rena’s surprise, taking that hit made her lose weight. Instead of covering her crotch, Rena’s belly now hung just above it. Speaking of her belly, it now shook constantly, even while breathing, which it had been too heavy to do before. Also, while the thickness of her thighs still forced her to waddle, it was much less prominent, to the point where she could have been walking normally if she so wished.
