155121222.title: So much for protection/More.

1551212222.content: I'm Sorry - Rena ends up offending a witch, who over reacts by impregnating her.
1551212222.title: More Options

15512122221.content:
This addition was written by M-man8.

Rena woke up and the birds were chirping and the sunlight lit the corners of her room. She went to her closet and put on some running clothes and then went to the kitchen to get milk. She loved the taste of milk in the morning; it was ambrosia in her mind. After wiping her milk mustache off she grabbed her keys and left her home to run around her neighborhood.

As could be expected she was quite fast at running and admirably agile. She loved to run; maybe she had some forgotten strain of cheetah in her blood. She would run and jump over potholes, puddles, and many other objects. This wouldn't have been to problematic, but as she runs she has the horrible luck to not be able to watch out for moving obstacles to well. During her run at the end of one block this morning, there was a hedge that took up most corner of the block.

Unknown to Rena, there happened to be a woman in her forth month of pregnancy coming around the corner. A very nicely figured woman with a little bulge of life was walking around miserable. She hated to be pregnant; she had gotten rid of every pregnancy she had ever had because she was not a girl that wanted to settle with one partner for the rest of her life.

"What am I going to do this belly of mine? It's going to start to hinder my appearance and no man will want me. I guess I better get rid of this one like all the others. I have to find another woman today." She thought reaching the end of the hedge. "Better do it soon or people wonder what happened."

Meanwhile Rena was thinking about the day as she reached the middle of the hedge. "Well, what am I going to do today? I can finish up this run and then I can go to the store and get some nice fish to eat." She held her hands out as if she was holding a giant fish. "I think that that might be a little big but I love fish."

Then at in a moment they collided. Rena out-stretched hands grabbed the woman’s hips as she started to walk up the sidewalk and she shoved the woman down as her shoulder connected with the woman’s sore breasts.

"AAAAAAH," shrieked as she fell on her back.

"Oh no, are you hurt Ma’am? I'm Soooo sorry. I didn't see you there." Rena was feeling so guilty as she usually did when she bumped into people. She was just rambling at this point because she spotted the lady's bulging tummy and correctly guessed that she was pregnant.

"Watch were the hell you run, stupid. I'm f%^*ing pregnant and you could mess up my beautiful face. Damn, cat-girls. Now my breasts hurt worse." As an awkward pause happened, she knew what to do.
15512122221.title: I'm Sorry

choices: Monsters, ray guns, and big bellies here we come
15512122222.content:
Taking place in the distant future, Rena is a refugee escaping earth after it got invaded by an alien civilization. But on her way to an unknown planet, who's government agreed to harbor them, the ship she was traveling suddenly was hit by a stray asteroid, causing severe damage.

It's not long after before monsters began to appear, killing anything in sight. If surviving on this hostile ship was not enough for the catgirl, she discovers that she was somehow impregnated, and the lifeform inside is growing fast.

Rena must travel to the ship's main room to send out a distress signal before she is either slaughtered by the aliens on board or her belly exploding.
15512122222.title: Breach.

Thinking nothing of it, she puts the ring on, and goes about her day. The next day, however, she awakens to find she's become 9 months pregnant, and the ring won't come off. She soon learns that it's the Ring of Eternal Motherhood, making any woman who wears it permanently pregnant. Now Rena needs to find a way to remove the ring.
155121222222.title: Ring of Eternal Motherhood

1551212222222.content:
After finding out she was sterile, Rena and her husband are devastated that they would never have children.

In her depressed state the catgirl drives around in her town, and she stumbles on a local fair. There she discovers a gypsy women, who offers Rena the chance to bear a child.
1551212222222.title: The old gypsy's offer.

15512122222221.content:
It was a fine spring day. The sun was signing brightly and a cool breeze was blowing across the green field. Sitting on a blanket, the tiger-stripped catgirl, clothed in a yellow dress, breathed in the fresh scent, feeling at peace with herself.

The child cooed in Rena's arms, reaching up with its tiny hands to her face. Giggling, the catgirl lowered here face, allowing the baby to gently squeeze her nose and tuck on her whiskers. It was the most beautiful thing she had ever seen, having her bright green eyes and its father's spots.

She kissed the baby on the forehead and said, "I'm going to name you..."

A loud crack of thunder woke Rena up with a jolt. She lay there in bed, watching the trees through her window sway in the wind and listened to the soft perpetual hiss of the rain drumming against the metal roof.

She had no child. She wasn't even pregnant. It was all just a dream, Rena realized. The catgirl felt hot tears coming to her eyes and she curled herself into a ball. Why? Why did this have to happen with her?

Rena had everything she had ever wanted: a house in the suburbs, a good partner and a well-paying job. The only thing missing in her life was children. She always wanted her own. Rena and her husband tried for many months, but she just couldn't get pregnant.

They scheduled a doctor's appointment, and it was from there that they learned the horrible news that she was sterile, never able to bring forth life in this world.

Rena cried softly, cuddling against the warm and soft figure behind her, who had one of his thick arms draped around her. Although he was sleeping, snoring softly, she got the comfort she needed, knowing that she wasn't facing this problem alone.

After a while she calmed down. Wiping away a stray tear, she looked at the digital clock next to her bed, wondering what the time was, and saw that it was 5:30. They didn't get up for work until 6:30. Rena tried going back to sleep, but she found that she couldn't.

She gently removed herself out of her husbands arm, in order not to wake him, climbed out of bed, and headed to the bathroom to take a shower. If she couldn't go to sleep she might as well get an early start on the day.

It was 6:35, and the dawn was breaking. The weather promised a gloomy and rainy day, which mirrored how Rena felt at the moment as she was eating some buttered toast in the kitchen.

A loud yawn brought her out of her self-pitying. Brian, Rena's husband, a six foot tall, 300 pound leopard, lumbered into the kitchen, clothed in his boxers and night shirt that displayed a video game counsel's remote.

From his soft body, round face, and rectangular glasses that he was adjusting his appearance suggested that he was a nerd. And that was exactly what he was: a nerd.

Rena had known him since the early days of high school, and to this very day, even as a grownup, Brian still loved reading comic books, playing video games, and babbling about computers, a subject that he knew almost everything about.

To the average person, who had been indoctrinated their whole life about the stereotype of how they were obnoxious, unfunny, and boring people, would probably think that married to a nerd would be a nightmare.

But it was actually the complete opposite. Rena found that Brian was the most friendliest, selfless, smartest, and cutest guy she knew. This was her dream husband. Seeing him made Rena feel slightly better, but it wasn't enough to draw her out of her depression.

"Morning, dear," he greeted.

"Morning," Rena said back, her tone listless.

Brian was reaching for a box of cereal in the cupboard, but he stopped and turned to his wife when he heard her voice lacking in the usual enthusiasm he was used to.

"What's wrong?" he asked, concerned.

"Nothing," Rena mumbled.

Brian frowned and said. "If it's nothing then why are your ears drooping," he pointed out.

Rena didn't say anything. She continued nibbling on her slice of toast.

"Is this about the doctor's visit?" he asked.

Rena nodded solemnly. Brian sat next to her and pulled her into a hug. She buried her head into his soft chest felt a teal spill over her eyelid and crust her orange fur.

"I'm sorry things couldn't work out the way we wanted," he said softly, "I also wanted kids, but life's cruel. We can't allow this to get us down. If you want to, we could perhaps get an adoption."

Rena swallowed her lump in her throat and wiped her eyes. "I know this is nothing that we can change," she said, "but it's going to take awhile to get over this."

Brian nodded. "I understand," he said. "Do you think you could go off to work like this?"

Rena was silent for a few moments before she said, "No I don't think so. I'll make up a story that I'm sick for my boss. I can afford to stay a day at home, just to try and get over this."

Brian kissed her on the head, causing her to giggle. She did feel somewhat better now.

"Well, I guess I should be getting dressed," Brian said.

"I guess you should," Rena said.

They broke the hug.
15512122222221.title: The old gypsy's offer part 1.

155121222222211.content:
Rena found herself drifting around the house in a trance-like state. She had tried everything: she had read books, watched TV shows, and searched around on the Internet about a way to cope with her situation, but nothing helped. She couldn't escape her depression.

While she was wondering if she should seek out a psychologist for help or begin to take anti-depressants, Rena felt her foot colliding against something hard and heavy, the pain bringing her back to the real world. When she looked she saw that it was a toolbox. She had wondered into the garage.

Like coming out of a dream she looked around herself, noting that it was mostly empty (Brian had taken their van to get to the computer company he worked at) but for one thing.

Hidden in a dark corner, as if it was trying to conceal its hideousness, was a old, dusty yellow scooter. This was Brian's when he was still at college. Rena had hitched a few rides with him and he even showed her how to drive it. The thing was still fully functional, she had heard from her husband, but the vehicle had no use anymore...until now.

The dark, rainy clouds, Rena observed while at home, was giving away to some sun, and catgirl had decided a change of scenery might make her feel better. She searched and found a helmet, climbed on the bike, and left the house. Where she was going she didn't know exactly. Rena was thinking that perhaps she, like in her home, should drive around aimlessly or go visit her parents for a change.

But as she drove, houses, buildings, parks, and fields passing by with a blur, she spotted something that caught her attention. At the edge of town a group of wooden caravans, which looked like they dropped straight out of some children's fantasy book, were gathered together.

Colorful banners surrounded them, flapping in the wind. Curious, Rena drove there, parked the scooter, and headed inside. It was a gypsy fair. Rena had heard that the town hosted them every now and then. A considerable amount of people were gathered there, buying hand-crafted items from stalls and watching entertaining sights like fire-breathers breathing flames.

As Rena walked passed the stalls and attractions, eyeing them with interest, momentarily forgetting her problems, she suddenly had to jump out of the way when a trio of child raccoons came rushing passed her, laughing and screaming.

Another female raccoon, which Rena caused was their mother, followed them and shouted at them angrily in a language the catgirl didn't understand. From her bulging belly Rena could obviously see that she was expecting. A burly male raccoon, which was most likely her husband, followed her, whispering something in her ear that made her laugh.

Rena watched as they passed and she envied them. They climbed the short flight of stairs that led to one of those wooden caravans and went inside. A scarlet colored tent, something else that caught Rena's attention, was attached to it.

A metal plate with words written in gold colored letters hung above it, which read, "Madame Esmarelda's Fortune Telling and Potion Shop."

Rena didn't believe in silly things like fortune telling and magical potions, but she found that this place was distracting her away from her problems and making her feel alive again. If she participants in something weird at this fair, she might feel even better. Besides, she was rather curious what would be said about her future, just for fun.

The tent was cozy, pillows acting as chairs. A low table was in the center, a crystal ball on top of it, and scented candles were burning, giving the air a sweet scent. Gingerly Rena walked in, taking in the mystical presence that the tent had.

"Hello," she called when she saw that the place was empty, "Is anyone here?"

"My, yes there is, my child," a creaky voice said behind Rena.

The catgirl jumped with fright and turned around. It was another female raccoon, but she was old, her fur turning grey. Her hair was tied in a bun, enhancing her sharp features, and she wore a flowing red robe, her arms covered in bagels. She was smiling kindly at Rena, and to the catgirl she seemed like every child's favorite grandmother.

She chuckled. "Sorry that I scared you, Rena," the raccoon said, "My name is Madam Esmarelda."

Rena's eyes widened in surprise. "H-how do you know my name?" she asked with shocked.

Esmarelda grinned sheepishly. "O, sorry, my dear," she said, placing a bony finger to her chin, "My sooth saying abilities sometimes run away with me. It can scare people sometimes."

"Anyway," she continued, beaming and spreading her arms, "what is it that you seek at Madame Esmarelda's humble shop? Prophecies? Potion? I got them all."

It was a little freaky that this complete strangers knew her name, but it could have been just a fluke, and she dismissed it. "Do you think I can have my fortune read?" Rena said before reaching for her wallet, "How much would it cost?"

"O, no need for that, my child," said Esmarelda, waving her hand, bangles jingling, "Usually the first prophecy I give out are for free."

"Please, sit down," she continued, gesturing to one of the pillows close to the table.

Rena did just that, slightly surprised. She heard they only pretended to know the future to make money, but this one seemed surprisingly humble.

"So, what is it you wish to know?" Esmarelda asked, sitting opposite to Rena.

Rena was in thought for a few seconds. "Will I ever have children?" she asked.

She already knew the answer, but the question was just for fun. Esmarelda looked into the crystal ball, making a show of waving her hands over it.

The raccoon shook her head. "I'm sorry to tell you this, my dear, but I see no children in your future," she said.

Rena nodded sadly. Even a so-called mystic could tell her that her life would be childless.

"Yes, being barren is very sad," Esmarelda continued, looking just as sad as Rena. "I can see that you and your husband, Brian, is struggling to cope with this."

Rena looked up. Okay, now things were getting weird. "How did you...?"

Esmarelda held up her hand to silence her, standing up. "Wait here for me, dear," she said, turning around and heading somewhere into the back of the tent.

She returned later, holding something in her hand. "It's a horrible curse for a woman not able to have children," Esmarelda said, "My own daughter, Estrella, was ones barren too, but with a few very rare ingredients and some magic I was able to fix her with this."

She placed the thing she hand in her paw on the table, and Rena saw that it was a small bottle that contained a pink liquid inside.

"Now she's going to deliver my fourth grandchild next month," Esmarelda said, smiling proudly.

Rena remembered the younger raccoon that passed her earlier, with her rowdy children and bulging belly. Was that Esmarelda's daughter? If that was, than this can solve her problem.

"If I drink this, what would my future then hold?" Rena heard herself asking.

Esmarelda looked in her crystal ball again. "O my," she said, surprised.

"What do you see?" Rena asked, leaning forward.

"A considerable amount of offspring, that's what," she answered, "And most of them look like their father, spots and all, with your green eyes."

That was it. Rena had to buy this. "How much?" she asked, reaching for her wallet, ready to pay any amount she asked, no matter how ridiculous.

"Well," Esmarelda said, "for something like this I would ask 100 bucks, but seeing your story twisted my arm, so I'll give you this for free."

Rena felt tears coming to her eyes. She wasn't sure if this was a dream or real. The catgirl was expecting to wake up any moment, but that never happened. She stood up and hugged the raccoon tightly.

"O, thank," she said.

Esmarelda patted her back, saying, "It's nothing, my dear."

"O no what time is it?" Rena suddenly said, looking at her watch.

Brian had told Rena that he would be home early from work just for her, around 3 O clock. It was now 14:45. He would be home any minute now and very worried when he couldn't find her. It didn't also help that the catgirl had foolishly left her cell phone at home.

"I really need to go," Rena declared.

But before she left, Esmarelda grabbed her shoulder and said, "A quick word a caution: there is something extra I threw into the potion. A sexual stimulant. Viagra, as you lot call it, just to get the love rolling, if you know what I mean. So, it's best you don't drink in now, if that is what you were thinking."

Rena nodded. "Okay," she said, "Thanks for the warning. Bye."

The catgirl dashed from the tent, Esmarelda watching as she left.
155121222222211.title: The old gypsy's offer part 2.

1551212222222111.content:
The first thing Brain noticed, when he arrived home and drove his van into the garage, was that his wife didn't come out to greet him. He looked around the house, and when he couldn't find her he decided to call her cellphone, thinking that she only went out of the house.

To his surprise, he heard it ring somewhere in the house, and when he found it in the kitchen he really got worried. He was debating whether or not he should call the police for help when he heard a familiar noise that took him back to his college days.

Rushing back to the garage, he saw his ugly yellow scooter being parked by his wife.

"Rena?" he asked, confused, "Where were you? I was so wor-"

But he couldn't finish his sentence, for Rena had jumped into his arms and proceeded to kiss him deeply. Brain was shocked by his wife's behavior, being pushed back into the house and into the living room.

"Rena, what's gotten into you?" he asked a few moments later, sitting on the couch, breathless from all the kissing.

The catgirl didn't answer his question as she pulled close the curtains. She pulled off her shirt and unfastened her bra, allowing her breasts freedom.

"Questions later," she said, squeezing her boobs together, licking her lips, "Your job now is to make this kitty meow. Show me that chubby guys can be studs too."

"O-o-okay," stuttered Brain, unsure how to feel about this situation as his half-naked wife climbed on top of him, gripped his tie and pulled him closer, kissing his passionately again.

On one hand some sex after a stressful day at work seemed like one hell of a tasty treat, on the other he knew he should be concerned by his wife's sex-crazed behavior. In the end the will of his rapidly hardening cock won, and he allowed himself to be ridden by his wife.
1551212222222111.title: Getting frisky at home.

15512122222222.content: The Mansion - In this story, Rena wakes up to find herself trapped in a bizarre mansion. Not knowing how she got here, Rena also discovers that she has somehow become 9 months pregnant in just a few hours. Eventually, she learns things. First, the mansion resides in another dimension, one where time doesn't flow, the rooms shift around, and bizarre things keep occurring. Second, there are other people in the mansion, trapped as well, but seeing different things. And third, her pregnant belly is still growing, and as long as she's in the mansion, she'll never give birth.
15512122222222.title: Move along.

155121222222221.content:
Rena never did enjoy getting up after a nice nap. She always just wanted to sleep and sleep. But she knew that wasn't to be. So, slowly, she woke up.
And realized right away something was wrong.

She realized that she wasn't in her tiny apartment anymore. Instead, she was in what looked like a master bedroom. There was a large wardrobe, a full length mirror next to it, three doors, and a medium sized window. Rena also realized she was lying on a huge bed.

The next thing Rena noticed was when she looked out the window. It was the dead of night outside. Which couldn't be right, since Rena took her nap in the middle of the day, and felt like she only slept for 3 hours. There was no way it could be night already.

The third thing she realized was that she felt really heavy. She couldn't place why. So, still disoriented, Rena attempted to get up.

And was immediatly stopped by someting. Now even more confused, Rena finally looked down at herself, and discovered the final thing that was wrong.
Now, Rena had always been a thin catwoman. Flat stomach, no breasts to speak of, and a boney butt. Even at 21, she had no curves. She felt OK with that So, it was a bit of a shock for Rena to discover that she was currently very pregnant.

Her once A cup breasts had inflated to about DD cups, and felt very full. Her black bra (she now remembered she took her nap in her underwear) was straining to contain them. But beyond that was the real surprise. Her belly had inflated to basketball size, an orange furred dome dominating her frame. She also saw that her belly button had popped out.

Rena spent a few moments in shock, before remembering that she was still in an unknown bed. So, very carefully, she swung her body to the side, put her legs over the bedside, and slowly lifted herself up into a sitting position. Then, she stood up properly.

Thrown off by her new center of gravity, Rena wobbled for a few seconds before finally finding her balance. Now up, Rena slowly waddled over to the mirror.

She had to admit, pregnancy looked oddly good on her. Her belly was nice and round, her breasts big and full. Turning, she saw that her boney rear had also filled out nicely, becoming a nice bubble butt filling her panties. Rena wagged her tail and wiggled her butt, teasing her own reflection.

Turning from the mirror, Rena looked at the wardrobe. As much as she wanted to admire herself more, she needed to find out where she was. And she wasn't going to explore this place in her underwear. So she waddled over to the wadrobe and opened it. Inside was only one thing, a...
155121222222221.title: The Mansion

1551212222222212.content:
Rena looked at the garmet in confusion. She recognized it as a catsuit. It was shiny black leather, with built in high heels. Rena sighed, and grabbed the suit. If it was the only thing in there, she didn't have much of a choice.
-----------
After about an hour of struggling, Rena finally got the catsuit on. She was currently staring at herself in the mirror.

As expected, the suit was skin tight. She couldn't zip it up all the way, leaving a plunging v-neck that exposed her cleavage and belly button. What was covered was hugged tightly by the suit. Turning, she saw that the catsuit hugged her butt tightly, and that there was a hole for her tail. Finally, she looked in the mirror at the 5 inch heels. She just couldn't understand why they were there.

Suddenly, Rena yelped as she felt a kick in her belly. Rena started rubbing her stomach.

"So, you've finally made yourself known." Rena said. "Well, I don't know where you came from, but I guess I'm stuck with you."

Placing her hands under her belly, Rena waddled to the door, opened it, and stepped out of the room, heels clacking.

Outside the room, Rena saw a hallway, much more lavishly designed then the room. Rena had two directions to go, left and right. So, which way?

155122.content:
Planet Rena

Tiny aliens come to earth looking for a new home. They find Rena, and choose to build their new home inside of her. The benefits of having the tiny aliens are vast. Improved health, extended life time and youth, immunity to a great many diseases, amazing strength. The down side, with a growing population of little people, eventually there won't be enough room in Rena's skinny little frame.
155122.title: More Mixed Paths

1551221.content:
This chapter by System_Crash.

Rena sat on her couch, mindlessly staring at the clock. It was Saturday and, despite all of her best efforts, she had nothing to do. All of her friends were busy with things she couldn't do with them, the house was clean, the laundry was done, she didn't have anything to do for work, and she had already done her usual Saturday run around the neighborhood. It was just a slow day.

After mindlessly flipping on the television and finding that there was nothing to watch Rena decided that, at least to do something, she could go to the park for a while. There were sometimes fun things going on there, maybe she would see some people throwing frisbee or playing some other sport she could, hopefully, jump in on.With those thoughts ringing in her mind, Rena got up and quickly put on some tennis shoes before heading out the door. She had chosen to wear just a simple black tank top and denim shorts that day, just the right kind of things for the weather. With a smile and a quick glance up at the cloudless blue sky Rena began walking to the neighborhood park.Rena lived in a fairly nice suburban neighborhood called Infinity Acres.

It was a safe neighborhood, mostly with middle class families that had two working parents and some children that were watched by the few, no working adults in the area. Rena was one of the few cat-people in the neighborhood, but there were a couple families. She was also, however, one of the few single women, every other person either too busy with work to date or already in a steady relationship that just hadn't become a marriage.Rena came to the park, the fairly large grassy area dotted with trees. A large pond sat in the middle where ducks and the occasional toy boat could be sailing across the calm, glossy waters. Birds were chirping in the calm trees, and Rena couldn't help but smile. It was really a wonderful day.After walking around the park paths for a while Rena decided to take a seat on the bench, leaning back as she took a break. Though it was nice out, it was also fairly hot. The sun looking down on the suburb with its glare. Still, other then the sun there was nothing in the sky.

Well....... almost nothing.A single, rather large black bug buzzed around mindlessly, going about its usual bug business when it began to notice something. A small glint up beside the sun. The bug turned, tilting its head to one side as the dot grew larger. Then, in a quick cut the bug was gone, blown apart as something streaked down towards the ground, crashing into the tall grass, but leaving no sign of its presence.(Because it works so well in other parts of the story, alien language text will be noted by <>)

<Is Everyone okay?> A voice shouted from the very tiny, smoldering remains of what was an alien space ship. <Yes, but the engines are shot and the cockpit is totaled. The ship isn't going anywhere.> From the smoke a pair of very tiny figures appeared, no larger than a grain of dust. The figures were snake like in appearance, with frills around their heads, scales on their bodies, and long tails instead of legs.One of the snake-aliens, with tarnish gray scales and green markings on his hood and down his spine, turned and shook his head, <Make sure everyone gets out okay and then salvage what you can. I'm going to go take a look around.> <You got it Lerden.> The other snake, the engineer who had rust color scales, said with a nod before slithering back towards the wreckage. The black scaled snake, Lerden, watched his fellow head back towards the smoking pile of metal before turning his head and looking up one of the gigantic, single leaf trees they had crashed into. It was such a strange plant, nothing like it existed back on their home world.After searching for a time Lerden found a blade of grass that was not standing perfectly straight, and crawled up it until he stood on the very top where he could get a clear view of his surroundings. There ship scanners had already shown him a lot about the planet and huge creatures that inhabited it. The planet itself was as large as their home galaxy, and each person almost the size of a planet.At that Lerden turned, looking up and noticing one of the planet sized creatures was sitting very close to where the ship had wrecked. In fact, her foot was just a mile away(mile for them, not a mile for earthlings). They had a chance.

Rena stretched, stifling a yawn. The park wasn't much more exciting then her house. There was just nothing to do today. She debated getting up, but found enough interest in watching a father and son pilot a remote controlled airplane to stay sitting for another ten, fifteen minutes. Still, once that was done Rena stood, stretching one last time before turning and taking a step out, deciding to head home.The walk home was uneventful, even though Rena kept getting a strange feeling that seemed to be crawling up her leg. Still, she ignored it, turning and heading down her walkway before stepping inside her house and shutting her door. Mindnlessly, Rena took off her shoes, tossing them into the corner before yawning and muttering to herself, "Maybe there's something on TV."

At that Rena flopped down on the couch, grabbing up the remote. Still, just before she could turn the TV on she heard a strange buzzing noise, kind of like static. Then, the buzzing stopped and a tenative voice began to say, "ainlsas2385onffsa89dhqa". Rena lifted and tilted her head, looking around. She did not realize that the sound was coming directly from the edge of her ear. Lerden and the other alien-snakes sat percariously on the edge of Rena's ear, Lerden turning away from the microphone as he looked at his engineer teammate.

<What's wrong.>

<She doesn't speak our language sir.>

<Then do a quick mental scan, get me a translator.>

The engineer only nodded, pushing a few buttons on the strange metal box in front of him before a small red beam flashed across the nearest part of Rena's skin. On the boxes digital screen,a few pictures of Rena's DNA appeared before the computer analyzed it and had prepared everything, launching a second flash to get the current build of Rena's neural network.

<Were good to go. Try again?>

"Hello."

Rena jumped a second time, turning her head around as she tried to figure out where the voice was coming from. "Whose there." "Please, do not jump around so quickly. You may throw us off." Rena slowed, raising a confused eyebrow, "What?" "Please, just hold still for a few seconds and I'll explain everything I am Lerden, a visitor to this world of giants. Our home world, a great many galaxies away from here, has been ravaged with war for so long I brought these few fathers, mothers, and children here in hopes of giving them a life of peace."Rena began to get slightly annoyed, "Who is this? Rob, are you trying to play a trick on me." "I assure you miss, this is no trick. Please, just go over near a mirror and I can prove it to you."Rena, undeniably curious about what was going on, slowly moved over to a nearby wall mirror. She turned her head, and was surprised to see something beside her ear. At first it looked like a small bug, but suddenly part of the mirror's image seemed to be magnified and its showed a small caravan of strange-snake people, probably a hundred or so of them, gathered around bug like vehicles that were clinging to her fur.It was very difficult, but Rena fought the urge to squash all of them with her hand. Lerden took this opportunity to continue, his voice filling Rena's one ear.

"As you can see, we are a small race. While your solar system has eight planets our has hundreds, each floating around the sun and each planet about your size. The war rages between our people, and our planets. We just had to escape." "But, why are you on me?" Rena asked, still trying to fight the urge to slap them with her hand."Our ship was circling this planet as we tried to find a new home when something huge and metal flew by us. I believe it was one of your airplanes. It threw us off course and we crashed into the forest, or the grass beside your feet. We were just lucky you were there. We would not have survived in that grass for very long, the beastly creatures that hide in it surely finding us a tasty snack.""Well, your safe now. So, how about I put my head down by the table and you get off so I can talk to you." "Of course," Lerden replied, not wanting to anger Rena.

After a few tense moments of holding her head above her coffee table Lerden told Rena all his people were off, and she quickly disappeared to get a magnifying glass before returning, looking at the tiny snake-people that now stood on her furniture."Thank for not harming us miss....""Rena," she whispered quietly, realizing that her voice was probably many times louder to them."Rena. Again, thank you. We are safe here, for the time." "What do you mean?" Lerden sighed, looking back at the hundred or so snake-people standing behind him before talking into the strange voice translator and amplifier. "Though we appreciate your kindness, we can not hope to survive in this world of giants for very long. Any homes we build could easily be crushed under a leaf from your trees. A gust or even the force of your breath could lift my people off the ground. We, the Pyths, can not hope to survive in such a place." Rena felt a little twinge in her heart. It was so sad to hear about these people. Rena couldn't even imagine being so small. They were literally dust-snake-people. Pyths, it was a strange name but Rena just shrugged it off. Still, as Rena watched the tiny people she couldn't help but ask, "Is there anything I can do?"Lerden seemed to perk up at this, as far as Rena could tell, as if he had been hoping Rena would make such an offer.
1551221.title: Planet Rena

15512211.content:
"Please, miss Rena, I must ask you to do something that many of your people would probably refuse. We can not survive in outside world of this planet, but your bodies are in truth much like our home planets. Instead of being huks of stone, they are living, breathing things. The plants that grow on their surface feed the planet and us. The creatures live, as do our people, on and in the planet.""So, what are you asking?" Rena asked as she lifted an eyebrow."Please, great Rena, would you allow us to live within your body."

"What!?" Rena couldn't help but shout, obviously hurting the ears of the tiny Pyths. "Are you crazy, you can't live inside me."

"We can," Lerden assured, his voice trying to be confident though his ears were ringing, "we have amazing technology, and because your body is so much like our home planet we can easily adapt."

"But, where?"

"There are a great many places in your body that have space large enough for us. Our technology can even create several homes in just the space between your muscles. We can leave around ever part of your body, and harm nothing. In fact, we can really be a benefit to your body."

"What do you mean?"

"Our home planets are living, and in such they would get old at times. For a while, a planet would die until another one let off a chunk of itself to form a new one. Because this process destroyed thousands of homes and cities, we began developing technology to benefit our planets. From our scans of your body and mind, that same technology can benefit you as well.

"Rena leaned in a little bit, getting interested, "How would it help me?" "Our technology could greatly increase your lifespan, and your youth would be proportionally extended. Any disease that were to enter your body would be killed before it could germinate, our entire power being focused on killing any bacteria or virus. We would take care of your body and, at the same time, defend it. It would be our home, a place my people hold sacred above all things." Rena leaned back a bit, crossing her arms. It wasn't a bad deal. Let them live in her and basically get the perks of youth, life, and a killer immune system. Still, the thought of having such creature crawling around inside her made Rena squirm a little bit.

Finally, she leaned forward, bring the magnifying glass back up as she asked, "How would I talk to you if I wanted to." "If we were in your body I could set it up so that whenever you perform a set action you could call me or whoever you want. I’ll contact you before we are ready to leave your body for good.”

Before Rena could protest, Lerden turned off the display, his face constantly painted with the look of a deep sorrow. Leaving? They were going to leave her body? Granted, after what she had to went through, she was tempted to be happy about that but a more sensitive side of her told her that it was wrong for them to leave the safety of her body and venture out into the harsh earth or outer space. Even after suffering so much, their injuries, the loss of life, they still put her orders and wishes ahead of theirs. Maybe….maybe they deserve a second chance, because Lerden and everyone else fought for her sake, not theirs.
15512211111122211.title: The Rena Civil War Part 3

155122111111222111.content:
By the sixth day, Rena felt…great. She had the energy to get up, use the bathroom, and hungrily ate two bananas, some bread (she didn’t even bother to toast it up), and even ate an entire bag of beef jerky and a couple of eggs just before gulping down some water. With her stomach full and her spirits returning, Rena got to the nearest mirror and couldn’t help but breathe a sigh of relief.

She was still quite tall, now six feet but she could live with that. The important thing was she was thin again, the only noticeable difference being she still had those natural DD cups but she could live with that. Still, this was normally when Lerden would have greeted her good morning…did they already left?

Rena couldn’t help but sit on her bed, feeling a little sad. They…they weren’t bad snake-people-things, they just…needed a place to live. And truthfully, it was going great until those other Pyths came inside of her and things got out of hand…

Rena didn’t have much time for nostalgia as a display of Lerden came back on. He seemed tired and his eyes were a bit distant from the lack of sleep.

“Lerden, you did it! I’m back to normal! How did you do it so quickly?”

“After we got you some food and water, we called back all of the Pyths who left your body before the war…we all worked together to get rid of the material.”

“Wait a minute…what happened to it?”

“Well, some of it we dumped in the trash with the ships but the war in your body and your inability to eat took a toll on our food supplies. We had no choice but to convert some of the material into an edible substance and ration it out among us.”

“You were eating dirt this entire time?!?”

“A better analogy would be to say we were eating payment but after what we done to you, eating dirt would have been the only thing we would have deserved to consume. Now that we’ve fulfilled our promise, it’s time to dismantle the cities and leave.”

“Wait….leave? What for?”

“We broke a promise to you, Rena. We vowed to treat your body as scared and we failed. We caused you pain and misery and repeated the same mistakes back on our home planets. Perhaps our kind is not meant to live inside the giants of this world or even others. Perhaps we need to try to survive in the ground with the worms and hope nature is less cruel to us than we were cruel to you. Good bye, Re-”

“Don’t leave! Please, don’t leave me!”

“Rena?”

“Look….I’ll admit, when things were going crazy, I wasn’t in the best of moods but…look, it’s my fault. I shouldn’t have yelled at you and disagreed with going to the cabin. Maybe if I just called in sick or had your guys do your hacking stuff, you could have made it look like I was in a hospital or something or…I don’t know but it’s all my fault the war happened!”

“Rena, no, it’s our fault. We let the greedy and inconsiderate in our mists control the policy of your body. Only by leaving you can we make this right.”

“No, you’re wrong! You fought for me, represented me, spoke up for me. You did everything you could for my sake. You and the other Pyths fought against the brotherhood so I could keep on living like a normal person, you took care of me before the mess started, and even after this happened you sacrifice your own comfort to turn me back to normal, even to the point of eating building material; I can’t imagine anyone doing something like that. After all of that, I think the least I could do is offer you a second chance.”

“Rena, you…you can’t be serious.”

“I am. However, after what happened, I think I deserve the right to lay down some conditions of my own.”
“Rena, any price we could pay would be worth a chance at redemption. Whatever it is, I promise you we will be diligent this time and honor your requests.”

“Okay, first off, no more secrecy. If something happens, I want to know ASAP so I can help you out. While it’s reasonable to assume the outdoors can be dangerous, I think I can give us some living space in my own house and the outside group seemed to have come back okay.”

“I understand; we will be more front and forward with concerns inside.”

“Secondly, I want you to continue building ships. You don’t have to leave if you don’t want to but in case there is another population explosion or maybe another group comes here, you’ll have a back-up plan just in case. I can always give you fruit or any food you want and I’m sure you could easily find other people who would be more than willing to give you another home. Maybe you could do that fat but not really fat thing to someone who’s already overweight and not concerned about their body image.”

“A good suggestion, one we will look into should the need arise. Anything else?”

“Yes…there is one little thing. You do have a very impressive form of government, one that I think my own government could learn from. But seeing how you were overthrown by the former President and Congress has spoken the need of some measure of balance for my sake. Unless you plan on running for office I want you to be named Prime Minister for life.”

“E-excuse me?!?”

“Sure. Let me explain. Your government will take care of any…let’s call them ‘internal’ affairs. You know, how you run your government, what buildings to make, your laws, etc. But you will have power on any and all ‘external’ affairs, things that will affect me directly, like needing me to buy materials for your ships, eating unusual or different foods to help the population, expanding parts of my bodies. While I don’t want to be a dictator, there needs to be a way to convey my wishes; after all, it’s still my body. So if you guys have a plan I don’t like, your word will be taken for my word, you will have the power to veto a measure or law that will directly affect me, and your Congress can scrape a bad idea in exchange for a new one. Also, in the matter of external affairs, I want not only you but as many of your leaders as possible to talk to me, so that you’re not the only one I’m speaking to. Understand?”

“Well…yes but…”

“I’ve made up my mind. Those are the conditions I want met in exchange for a second chance. Do this and I’ll even allow you some extra room in my neck and checks as long as you leave the rest of my head alone, especially my brain.”

“You would be willing to give us extra space that close to your head?”

“It’s something I was thinking about as I laid paralyzed while you were still working on bringing me back to normal. I looked ridiculous with a normal neck and head on such a fat body. So as long as you don’t go overboard, you can have it. While I still don’t want to look fat, if I had to for a short time, I should at least look consistent; a thin neck and head on a large body is very suspicious on my planet.”

“After everything you went to…and not only are you willing to give us a second chance, but you’re opening up more of your body to us.”

“Yes, but only if your people agree to my conditions.”

“The first two will not be a problem, but…I know this is highly unusual but would you mind speaking your conditions to the new officers in government as soon as they are elected? I say this because if I tell them you want to give me a position of this…Prime Minister…even if it’s for your sake…they might think I’m just trying to grab power for myself.”
“I understand. I’ll run a bath and you get the robot ready. In the mean time, what can I eat or do to help you rebuild?”
Just in time for work, Rena went about her life as usual. The Pyths were overjoyed that Rena was generous enough to give them a chance to start over and while things were a little too run down for a proper celebration, one was already planned once the sick were cured and the buildings rebuilt. Still, they tried to keep their population growth in check, putting to use some techniques and tricks their scientists had come up with; it wasn’t a permanent solution but it should prevent a repeat incident.

In only two weeks, most of the buildings and cities in her chest and torso were rebuilt and everyone were back to full health, Rena unable to stop smiling when she saw Lerden with a new, healthy arm where there was only a stump not too long ago. With the capital rebuilt and new leaders elected, Rena drew a bath so she could meet them and see the signing of the new conditions, including the ceremony for Lerden to be named Prime Minister; in truth, it was really the same position he already performed for Rena, only now he had more authority so he wouldn’t be pushed around by the government, assuming the new mind set among the Pyths could even make that happen anymore. After that little venture, Rena was more than willing to eat whatever food or materials they asked so they could keep rebuilding their cities while Lerden promised that they would work hard to keep their repopulation cycle down to a reasonable level.
155122111111222111.title: The Rena Civil War Part 4

1551221111112221111.content:
As bad as the war was, things were, if possible, actually going better than ever. They kept building their little ships in rotating daily shifts with smaller teams, so everyone had a chance to enjoy being in the safety of her body for six days with their families and they even made little barriers around the cabinet so that they could put their brilliant little minds to ease. In a month’s time, the cities were rebuilt back to their former glory, only needing to be filled with people in due time. They even built several museums in the various cities of her body. They were mostly designed to be identical, a solemn reminder of events past so that the younger generation would remember the terrible atrocities and not repeat the same mistakes. Lerden really took to his role as Prime Minister, with all the humility and professionalism of a good public servant, and it wasn’t long that he was giving little reports to Rena daily, to help her feel more in control of her own body, even though the Pyths were being more than reasonable so far.

Still, it was only a matter of time before instinct took over and while they made strides, they couldn’t completely do away with their Repopulation Cycle. Lerden agreed to talk to Rena early about it, before things got out of hand again.
“….so you see, while the situation isn’t nearly as bad as last time, it’s still a bit more tricky than before that other ship crawled on your body at the beach.”

“So even if you were to increase my breasts the size planned earlier, it still might not be enough?”
“Correct. We need more space but we’re trying to do this right this time. The government is more than willing to send volunteers out to look for other hosts now that we have ships to use if you feel that it would be too difficult to increase your body mass.”

“Please, after defending me and repairing my body, giving you more space is the least I can do. Still, how much more space do you really need?”

“Well, unless you did something unusual, it would still have to be a combination of increasing your breasts and increasing your body mass. The only difference is that the more you increase your breast size, the less space we would need throughout the rest of your body. Either way, I think that the absolute worse is that you would look like someone that weighs 200 lbs and I doubt it would be any larger than that and this time we can make the changes happen much slower, so it would look more natural to the outside world.”

Rena sat back in her chair. She really didn’t want to get bigger breasts or get fatter and she really could ask them to send some of the population off to find another host, now that a cabinet was filled with a whole fleet of ships that could safely scout for more host bodies. Still, there was a general chance of mind set among the Pyths. The ones that remained and the new generation were more caring about her body, the lessons of the museums sinking deep into the younger generation while the not that much older one still remembered those dark days. They were more respectful and were truly treating her body like a thing to be kept scared, almost like a temple. And she was still feeling the pangs of guilt for not letting them take her to the mountains and causing that war that killed off so many of them; the least she could do is say yes. Even if she looked strange, she really wanted to offer them some more space; besides, she could just claim she was gaining weight, which was true in a sense.

=====================================
1. As Rena sits, she thinks to her day at the beach and recalls the little bit of attention she got. She kind of liked being noticed, that little bit of growth making a few men turn their heads since the growth had a, at least to humans, bit of a sexualized nature to it. It’s then that Rena gets a little bit of inspiration. If she’s going to gain “weight” in order to make room for the Pyths, why not have a little fun with it? She agrees to have her breasts enlarged to the original plan (HH cup) but since that’s not nearly enough, Rena asks them to, in all simplicity, increase the mass of her rear. With some work, it would give the Pyths plenty of room to get their cities large enough until the repopulation cycle is over and would allow Rena to experiment with a very voluptuous hourglass figure.
To help out Rena, the Pyths agree to tailor fit any and all of her normal clothes for her as she gets a bit bigger, only needing some cheap fabric so their ships can fix up her clothes for her. It takes a few weeks but in addition to a very generous chest that has the feel and shape of natural largeness, Rena also develops a bit of a round bubble butt. It’s almost looks a little too big for her body but nothing too extreme, with just a little more meat at the thighs for support. And it just might make some guys took notice of her more; after all, some guys like a big chest, others like a big rear, and some like a big both. It might make her look just a little bit strange in public but after everything the Pyths went though and the additional sacrificing they put themselves though to make due on their promise, the least Rena could do herself is to sacrifice a little herself.
This would also be a good time to see where Rena works and how people might react to her growth; if it’s service or customer based, it just might give people a reason to shop and draw in customers, if you know what I mean.

2. Rena simply goes through the original plan, having her appearance look a bit larger. Since it’s all over and Rena is six feet tall, it shouldn’t be too much but if the re-population cycle takes just a little bit longer, the worse is looking about 200 lbs, nothing too bad. The only different is how much the growth is spread between her already enlarged breasts and the rest of her body.

usually don't come calling unless there is something important."

The effects that these activities had on Rena was very noticeable to her: on her work days she found that she woke up quicker in the morning, and a cup of coffee was not always necessary, she was much more energetic, a perfect attribute when she went jogging, and she had shiny, healty-looking fur.

But inside the catgirl's body things weren't so prosperous. There was a feud going on. It first began because of a debate where to establish their first settlement but later evolved into heated arguments. Afraid of a civil war, Lerden decided that it would be best that the Pyths divide themselves.

Population soured, which meant that the breasts were on the brink of overpopulation. Something had to be done.
