choices: Into the Twilight Zone we go!
Get me the hell out of here!
155122222222222222232.content: Rena wakes up in a desert with little idea how she got there. But as she begins to explore this odd world, she discovers that she isn't in her own world anymore but a pocket dimension, where the rules of physics doesn't obey reality properly. Worse, Rena is being hunted down by something...
155122222222222222232.title: In a pocket dimension.

1551222222222222222322.content: Rena is a treasure hunter, who, recently, found clues that could lead her to her biggest find yet. Now she is on her way, sailing towards Patterson' Island, where a mansion sits abandoned for decades. What mysterious items, and what expanding qualities, would they contain?
1551222222222222222322.title: Patterson's Island.

15512222222222222223221.content:
"There it is!" cried Rena, observing through her telescope the building that was built on the forlorn piece of land known as Patterson's Island.

"Indeed it is," said Lowrance, standing next to the tiger-striped catgirl.

The old lion, wearing his yellow rain-coat and blue pants, smoked his pipe, leaning on the rails of his ship.

"But I doubt that you'll find anything useful up there," he said after blowing a few rings if smoke, "Trust me, I've been fishing these seas for years now. There's nothing up there but a old, rotting building, and, perhaps, if you believe is such nonsense, the ghosts of the Patterson family."

She luckily didn't believe in such nonsense. They were only tales that the locals of the fishing-village known as Harold's Bay told. But she did believe in the other tale they told, that this isolated, and abandoned, mansion had treasure hidden deep within its bowels.

Being a treasure hunter, Rena was willing to believe any story about priceless artifacts, even if it was silly. She would spend a long time researching about it, and that was exactly what she did with the Legend of Patterson's Treasure.

According to locals, there were heaps of treasures that the wealthy Patterson stashed away somewhere in his mansion. After a major storm called Hurricane Franklin struck the coast of this poor little town a few decades ago, Patterson, his wife, and children, mysteriously vanished.

People tried, with the mansion now unoccupied, to find the treasure, but legend has it that they were driven mad and out of the building by the ghosts that protect the treasure inside. Rena didn't believe it. She thought that the stories were made up to keep people away.

If she could find this legendary treasure, she would be set for life!

"O, there's a treasure in there, alright," said Rena, closing her telescope and throwing it in her pack, along with other objects like blueprints to help her navigate through the building.

The lion shrugged, knowing that it was better not to argue. "Whatever you say," he said, placing the pipe back in his maw and puffing smoke.

A while later, Rena was climbing into a motorized skiff that would take her to the island. She had some boat-knowledge, meaning that she could pilot the boat herself.

"You know what to do if you get yourself into trouble," Lowrance shouted from the side of the large boat.

Rena smiled and nodded, saying: "I do."

Along with other things, the catgirl had a powerful walkie-talkie that she could use, though, she hardly doubt that it would happen, if she got into trouble. After exchanging her thanks and goodbyes, Rena proceeded to sail towards the island.
15512222222222222223221.title: Escape from Patterson's Island.

Rena thinking fast tries to stop them, startling the thieves. Which causes them to loose hold on their prize, which crashes of the ground. Wondering how she is going to fix it, when suddenly the necklace glows and jumps upwards. Attaching itself to Rena's person surprising the cat girl!
Afterwards the casket reforms itself and Rena looses consciousness, but her body isn't alone anymore. Now possessed by spirits of the seven deadly sins, who confusingly look to their surrounding. Accessing Rena's memory they do her routine and head off to her apartment. Eventually Rena will regain consciousness of her body, but now shares it with seven spirits. Each one against the other one, only working together when it serves their best interests. Rena for now doesn't know it yet, but soon she will know their presence.
Who were the thieves that were taking the casket? What are these spirits thinking? What are the origins of the casket? Can Rena escape from these beings clutches? Will she even want to? Questions that will be answered in the story, but for now let's focus on Rena's awakening. And sloth seems to want to come first...

1551222222222222222322222.content: Rena is living the good life as a plus-sized catgirl, a successful business woman slowly climbing the corporate ladder, full of dreams to become the next big CEO of the company. And, luckily, nothing seems to stand in her way...except beings a from another planet.

15512222222222222223222221.content:
"Wom, wom, wom, wom!"

The sound could best described as otherworldly, a noise that pulsed like a heartbeat into the night. The saucer-shaped disc glided across the starry sky slowly, hovering right above the quiet, little neighborhood. Ten spite the noise, no one seemed to have awoken to investigate it.

The UFO suddenly came a halt above a large house, and a bright light emanated from underneath it, shining directly on the home like some massive spotlight. In one of the bedrooms a figure lay sleeping peacefully, completely unaware what was happening.

The light of the bizarre craft streamed through the windows. Suddenly, the figure on the bed began to rise, floating in the air, but still remained asleep. The curtains drew back and a window opened on its own accord, and she floated out of it.

She ascended to the craft, entering the hole which the light came from, strange silhouettes watching ominously as it approached. Ones the person entered, the hole closed and the bright light disappeared.

For several minutes longer it continued to float before the hole opened again, and she floated out of the UFO, back into her house and into her bed. The curtains drew back, the window closed, and the light dead again, as if this never happened.

The spacecraft, its work finished, flew away into the night.

"Wom, wom, wom, wom!"

Curiously, all three are blank, save for what appear to be instructions...
1551222222222222222322222222.title: The Books Three

choices: Play with the Tome of the Twin Mountains
Play with the Author's Guide to Addition and Multiplication
15512222222222222223222222221.content:
"What are you?" Rena asked, holding Heavy Matters in her hand. She looked at the other two books that came with Heavy Matters; the Tome of the Twin Mountains and the Author's Guide to Addition and Multiplication. The two books Rena was not holding were open to the first page, a short list of instructions showing. Sighing, she opened Heavy Matters to the first page, finding a similar set of instructions.

I. The names of those written in this book shall gain or lose the amount of weight specified.
II. In the case of multiple people sharing the same name, the book knows who the intended target is.
III. Reality shall change to accommodate the changes made by this book, unless specified otherwise.
IV. Only the person writing in this book is aware of the changes in reality by default.

The other two books had the same instructions, only with "amount of weight" replaced by "number of cup sizes" in the Tome of the Twin Mountains and by "number of children and number of months" in the Author's Guide to Addition and Multiplication. The rest of all three books were blank.

"Eh, what the hell," Rena said. "No harm in trying it out. If it's fake, it's fake. If it's real, I can fix whatever I change."

She picked up a nearby pen and wrote in neat, flowing script in Heavy Matters "Rena Westfall +400 pounds."

As soon as Rena finished writing, she shrieked in surprise. Her formerly rail thin body had abruptly shifted to that of the fattest woman she'd ever seen! Her belly flopped over her knees while sitting down, her boobs had blown up a few sizes, even her fingers were pudgier! Thankfully Rena's chair had widened to accommodate her thickened thighs and butt, otherwise she'd be stuck! With a quick inscription of "Rena Westfall -400 pounds" our favorite catgirl was back down to her normal size.

"That... was actually kinda fun," Rena admitted. With a furitive glance to the side for whatever reason, Rena put her pen to the paper again and played around some more. One moment she was a normal weight, the next she weighed three tons, then three ounces, then seven hundred pounds, and so on until Rena got bored. She quickly wrote in a loss of 350 pounds, bringing her back to normal, before feeling unsatisfied and wrote herself up to a chubby 200 pounds.

"Which of you should I play with now..." Rena mused to herself, scratching her new potbelly.
15512222222222222223222222221.title: A Writer's Dream...?

info.brief_description: Follow Rena, a catgirl, through different kinds of adventures featuring expansion
info.description:
(Originally written by Pwnisher696, now under new management)

I know what you're thinking, "Yet another fetish story? Don't we have enough of those already?" You're right, we do. But let me explain. Some time ago there was a story on this sight called Rena's Adventure. It focused on a catgirl that would have different adventures, depending on the storyline chosen, all of which featured various forms of expansion. Though not created by them, the story's two foremost contributors were writers by the names of System_Crash and Nameless One. These guys were amazing! Their work made what would have been another fetish story into a series of epic adventures of novel quality, with some expansion thrown in. Sadly, the story was deleted. In honor of System_Crash and Nameless One, I have decided to revive the story, with a few personal touches of my own. I know I can never be as good as them, but I will do my best to restore this interactive to its former glory.

Here's how it works, you select the main expansion theme (Inflation, weight gain, BE, etc.) Then you pick a storyline featuring that choice. Please feel free to create your own storylines as well. The more the merrier! I will also add some of my own, as well as ones from the original that I can remember.

Before we get to the rules, a quick summary of our main character. Rena is a 21 year old catgirl with orange fur and black stripes like a tiger. She has sparkling green eyes, long red hair down to her shoulders, with a skinny figure with a flat chest and butt (but that's soon to change.) Her personality depends on the storyline.

Rules
1. I know nobody's perfect, but please try to use correct grammar and spelling. I understand if you make a mistake here and there, but not through the entire thing.

2. Unless you're giving more options for storylines, all chapters are to be long. Absolutely NO short chapters.

3. As far as nudity goes, from the waist up, be descriptive, from the waist down, be discreet.

4. No sexual intercourse, please.

5. No toilet stuff. That's just disgusting.

6. Please be as detailed as possible when adding

7. This may be a fetish story, but I also want to see plenty of plot. Don't focus the entire thing the expansion theme.

If you read the original, and want to see it resurrected, I implore you to help by contributing. Let's make this the greatest expansion story ever! All credit goes to Nameless One and System_Crash, as well as the creator of the original story, Teriki Tora.
